We want you to feel accepted for who you are and to feel safe, valued and to help us build a culture of true belonging. Experian is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we take affirmative action to create a more inclusive and equitable world of work. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of age, disability, gender identity, marital status, race, ethnicity, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, Veteran status or whether you’re pregnant or on family leave.  Job Description  Experian is a global leader in Data and Analytics. We have access to award-winning solutions that support both businesses and consumers alike. Our Affordability products assist by blending bureau and open data sources to get the best view of an individual. By having a clearer view, businesses can then ensure they offer affordable products and services to their customers.  Based in our Glasgow office, you’ll begin your journey by learning about Data Annotation – The process of labelling data in the correct format. As your progress, you’ll then take on more responsibilities growing your career as a fully-fledged Data Scientist.  One day you could be reviewing bank account transaction data and turning this into valuable insights – the next you could delivering a proof of concept to a client on how our products could benefit them.  As a Graduate Data Scientist, you will learn how to:  Develop and maintain data processes and models to support Experian’s Affordability data products. Things such as: CastScore, Income Insights and CaaS Create, review and maintain datasets for use in Experian data products Work with data science colleagues to peer review and constructively challenge work done in the team Work with clients to gather data requirements, execute proof of concept activities, and provide expertise to support the usage of Experian data products  This will be achieved by working with data science colleagues to understand existing models,   datasets and processes. Your input is highly valuable, which is why we encourage you to proactively give feedback and offer thoughts and suggestions, on how to improve our products and services. You may have a bold new idea or a different take on an existing product that will help us improve it and provide great value to organisations and consumers.  We see Graduates as the future of our organisation meaning your potential will be celebrated and rewarded here at Experian.  If you choose to join us, you’ll receive industry training, wide-reaching career opportunities and a wealth of support through our Early Careers Network, buddy, line manager & mentor scheme. You’ll also join onto our 2-year structured Graduate Development Programme, which is packed with workshops, short-courses & online material designed to help kick-start your career.  Our concept is simple. We believe in expanding horizons – it’s what makes Experian a global leader and a Top UK Tech Employer.  Qualifications  You’ll have recently achieved or be on track to achieve a minimum 2:2 degree classification. A Bachelor’s degree with a high mathematical content (e.g. Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research (O.R.), Economics, Physical Sciences, Engineering) is encouraged.  Any knowledge of Python is valuable to this role as we utilise tools such as sklearn, panda, numpy, scipy, flask and jupyter notebooks to support with data manipulation.  It’s important you’re the type of character who isn’t going to give up when you hit a complex problem. Proactivity and curiosity will be your best friends in this role.  Additional Information  Application Closing Date: Sunday 22nd January 2023. We aim to respond to all applications no later than the week after the closing date.  Start Date: September 2023  For this role we aim to hold online Assessment Centres W/C 20th February 2023 (*Subject to change)  Why choose us?  Our colleagues’ health and wellbeing are a top priority for us, that’s why our reward, benefits and wellbeing programmes are designed so you can come to work feeling your very best self. Our benefits focus on health, money, and lifestyle so you can tailor your benefits to your own personal needs. Whether it’s your physical and mental wellness, getting to work or preparing for the next big milestone in your life, we have a range of flexible options to have you covered!  We look forward to receiving your application.  Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together  Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together  Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Data Scientist - Benchmark/Analytics
Description: Citi is a world-leading global bank. We have approximately 200 million customer accounts and a presence in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions worldwide. We provide consumers, corporations, governments, and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. We enable clients to achieve their strategic financial objectives by providing them with cutting-edge ideas, best-in-class products and solutions, and unparalleled access to capital and liquidity.  Citi Belfast is one of the largest employers in Northern Ireland with a diverse and talented team of over 3000 people from over 40 different nationalities across our four Belfast offices.  We are the only global investment bank operating in Northern Ireland. Every day, our local experts interact with global teams in over 100 countries developing and supporting next-generation technology solutions for the enterprise and delivering critical services to the bank and its customers, to make sure we are a stronger and safer organization for our clients.  You will have a truly global reach, which will provide you with new experiences and development opportunities right here in Belfast's iconic Titanic Quarter.  Department Overview:  As a global institution Citi submits market data to a range of external benchmark administrators. To ensure a robust risk control environment across this activity, this role will entail reviewing a defined population of such submissions, undertaken across the global network, to ensure they are in line with defined standards, procedures and against market rates.  The Data Scientist is a developing professional role. Deals with most problems independently and has some latitude to solve complex problems. Integrates in-depth specialty area knowledge with a solid understanding of industry standards and practices.  This role is to be part of Markets Risk and Control (MKTS R&C) Global Benchmarks , supporting the oversight of benchmark activities across global Markets and Securities Services.  Role Overview:  The successful candidate will primarily hold responsibility for monitoring the data that has been submitted to Benchmarking Administrators.  You will support the Independent Post Submission Review (PSR) team to verify the validity of the data through various systems and processes, escalating any concerns identified and working with Business contacts to validate information.  This role will be suited to a graduate with experience of statistical analysis and/or programming, or an experienced individual who perhaps does not hold a degree but has proven experience in handling complex data and programming.  Responsibilities: Working with our systems to review trends or patterns to data, to identify when an anomaly requires further investigation. Supporting the PSR Team to maintain and update the requisite systems to continue to function as needed to appropriately monitor benchmark data. Identifying when data sets do not follow expected trends and highlighting these to the Benchmarks PSR Supervisor for actions to be agreed Supporting the Benchmarks PSR Supervisor to prepare information packs and presentations for Senior Management. Undertaking ad-hoc requests from management as required While this role will work on the analysis of Benchmark data, you will also support the wider Benchmarks team with deliverables where required. Other responsibilities may include for example; updating and enhancing global policies and procedures, control testing and inventories, ad hoc projects and remediation efforts in the conduct risk space  Qualifications: This role would be suited to candidates who hold a Bachelors Degree or above in a highly quantitative field, such as Physics, Maths, Statistics, Quantitative Finance, Econometrics, Engineering or equivalent. However, this is not essential and proven experience in programming and / or statistical analysis will be also be considered Relevant experience in risk, compliance, audit or regulatory functions. Experience in working with the various risk and control systems and reporting requirements Project management skills. Excellent organizational skills, ability to multitask and adapt to change. Problem solver with the ability to translate plans in actions Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills Proficient in Microsoft Office with an emphasis on MS Excel Experience of any of Python, R, VBA, SQL is beneficial Self-motivated and detail oriented  Education: Bachelor's/University degree or equivalent experience  Exceptional candidates who do not meet these criteria may be considered for the role provided they have the necessary skills and  experience.  What we Offer:  We work hard to have a positive financial and social impact on the communities we serve. In turn, we put our employees first and provide the best-in-class benefits they need to be well, live well and save well.  We'll provide you with the resources to meet your unique needs, empower you to make healthy decisions, and allow you to choose which benefits suit you and your personal life best.  Visit our Global Benefits page to learn more.  Highlights to our core benefits include: Award winning pension On-site health services Private medical insurance packages to suit your personal circumstances Paid parental leave Generous holiday allowance starting at 27 Days plus bank holidays; increasing with tenure  Citi Belfast also champions diversity within our workforce, which helps us be well and live well together. We have over 40 different nationalities in our Northern Ireland offices, are a vocal supporter of LGBTQ+ rights, and are proud to have 47% of our leadership team made up of individuals who identify as women.  We encourage and lead inclusivity through our Pride, Disability, Multicultural, Families Matter, and Women affinity networks that are run by and for, Citi Belfast colleagues; providing them with the support they need in their personal and professional journeys and supplying them with the tools to help educate colleagues on all things related to each network to help us work better together.  Job Family Group:  Risk Management -------------------------------------------------  Job Family:  Business Risk & Controls ------------------------------------------------------  Time Type:  Full time ------------------------------------------------------  Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.  Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.  Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi") invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi .  View the " EEO is the Law " poster. View the EEO is the Law Supplement .  View the EEO Policy Statement .  View the Pay Transparency Posting

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Function:  Business Intelligence and Data Science  Closing Date:  27/01/2023  Virgin Media are on a mission to become the most recommended brand by our customers. The combination of 02 and VM have 46 million of them, so this is a big opportunity We have At the heart of this strategy is investing in data science and machine learning initiatives.  This role is a hands-on role working across multiple programs of working including personalisation, operations and network data science capabilities. You’ll be building ML models and writing code in real time services powering the virgin media digital products (website and apps), our marketing capabilities, network efficiency and ensuring our operations are running optimally. You’ll be part of a larger team of data scientists, and as a principal will be working to set direction and accelerate the most critical projects.  A normal week might look like reviewing prediction models, digging into data to look for opportunities, writing code for production services, doing code reviews for junior members, working with an established data engineering / ML Ops team to determine platform choices for data scientists to be most efficient and effective. You’ll work with stakeholders to determine how data science can optimize their processes, and then work with the wider team to bring those solutions to fruition.  We’re primarily a Google and Python shop. It’s fine if your background is in Azure, AWS or another cloud technology provider. Experience in cloud technologies in some manner is expected, as you’ll be expected to give guidance to more junior members of the team on optimal methods for interacting with these. You’ll work with other principals to be evaluating the current state of technologies to choose new ones as well, but primarily we build in house.  Apply for this job if you are a senior data scientist or ML engineer working on production ML backed services and looking to take the next step in your career. You’ll join a great team of product managers, software and ML engineers, data analysts and analyst engineers and data scientists!  The must haves: Experience applying knowledge in statistics and machine learning to real world commercial problems Experience bringing live services using machine learning and python to production. Expert knowledge of Python and relevant libraries (numpy, pandas, matplotlib, Scikit-learn, tensorflow, etc…) knowledge in other programming languages is valuable, but this is a Python shop. (R, Matlab…) Experience with things like CI/CD pipelines, Docker or similar, cloud hosting, good software engineering practices – we have an ML Ops team but as a principal you need to be familiar with why these things are good and how to use/do them Experience working in an agile software development environment Strong mathematics or statistics background gained through MSc/PhD education in scientific field / computer science Ability to translate consumer business problems into data science use cases and requirements  Other stuff we're looking for: Good interpersonal skills offering ability to explain complex techniques to non-technical audience Focus on implementation and business impact of modelling through commercial acuity Proactive and creative while considering approaches to use data to solve problems. Advanced data preparation and munging skills with ability to transform data into suitable formats and outputs. Ability to visualise and communicate findings in an understandable manner to non-technical users  What's in it for you?  We know that benefits mean so much more than the 'stuff' we can give you, so we offer a wide range of support, rewards and tools - all focused on helping you to prioritise what really matters.  All work and no play just isn't our style! We're already planning our future ways of working, for when life becomes a little more normal again. We're constantly evolving our approach to enable you to find a great work life balance.  If you go on to be successful in your application, some of the many benefits include:  25 days' annual leave, plus UK bank holidays  Annual bonus paid up to 15% of your annual salary  A defined contribution pension scheme, run by Fidelity, matched up to 10%  Access to wellbeing benefits such as the Unmind App, personal medical cover (which you can opt to upgrade to cover loved ones) and critical illness cover  Season ticket loans  Your birthday off every year, to treat yourself  The option to buy and sell up to 5 days leave, to suit your personal needs  Next steps  If you think you've got some amazing skills to offer us, and Virgin Media feels like a place where you can belong, we'd love to learn more about you. Once you've submitted an application the next steps of the process, if successful, are likely to include a two-stage interview process including technical and competency assessments.  When you apply, you'll be asked about any adjustments you might need to support the recruitment process. Let us know, and we'll be sure to discuss it with you.  Thanks for your patience in the meantime and for showing an interest in joining the Virgin Media family.Let us know, and we'll be sure to discuss it with you

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Opportunity to work on a new digital data focused greenfield project |Data Scientist | Housing Association | Python | R | 6 month contract   About Our Client  A leading housing association  Job Description  Responsibility for using advanced data modelling technology and assist the business in making insights driven decisions. This role will be at the forefront of enabling organisational change, as the client evolve as an innovative, digitally focused organisation Extract, analyse and interpret large amounts of data from a range of sources, using algorithmic, data mining, artificial intelligence, machine learning and statistical tools, to make it accessible to the business Present your findings back to key business areas in a clear and engaging manner and achieve success by advising business areas on any findings gleaned from utilising all available data sets and ensuring our data environment is reliable, secure, cost efficient, and strategically sound. The Successful Applicant  Have exceptional Maths and analytical skills. Have knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks etc and their real world advantages/drawbacks. Have solid knowledge of various statistical techniques and experience using machine learning algorithms. Have strong programming skills, especially R, Python What's on Offer 6 month contract Warwickshire based (Remote working offered) £600 per day (outisde IR35) Contact: Zeeshan Safdar  Quote job ref: JN-102022-5785662

Title: Audience Measurement - Data Scientist - Out Of Home Advertising
Description: Are you looking to build your career in one of the world’s largest research Organisations?  Are you curious about how we consume technology, content and entertainment? The Audience Measurement team at Ipsos use deep understanding of people to make sense of audiences and how they consume technology, content and entertainment. We use these to influence media strategy, helping clients to answer crucial questions, such as how to target audiences, maximise attention across platforms, enhance audience experience, and demonstrate or increase audience value.  Keen to work on complex mathematical/scientific problems? Have experience using a range of advanced mathematical / physical models / statistical models /machine learning methods? ﻿If this is what you are looking for from your next role, then please read on....  We are recruiting for a Data Scientist who is passionate about solving problems specifically for our Out of Home Advertising team. We are seeking someone with a passion and high competence for mathematics, statistics modelling/understanding and programming skills working on production quality collaborative projects with emphasis on understanding and use of methods algorithms.  This is not your average data scientist role, this role is about giving you the autonomy to solve problems which directly impact our daily lives whether it is our television viewing habits, radio listening habits to other forms of media consumption. Creative, innovative, passion, flexibility, adaptability, tenacity and agile, these are just some of the words that describe the culture of our team. This is an opportunity for you to make an impact whilst also having a realistic chance to learn and develop your skills further.  Audience Measurement is one of Ipsos' global specialisms. Its core research expertise lies in counting and profiling viewers, listeners, readers and users of media. The Audience Measurement data and service is used by marketers and media agencies to manage and measure their advertising investment in media and by the media to help price their product, trade with advertisers and schedule content.  Data science is at the very heart of Ipsos projects and provides an important central resource covering large media industry measurement contracts, syndicated surveys and ad hoc insight projects.  The Data Science Unit has been created in Ipsos in direct response to the way the converging media and advertising market is moving. Their remit reflects the growing industry importance of Big Data, passive measurement technologies, complex modelling, data visualisation, data integration and calibration methodologies.  The role….  You will be an integral member of a team delivering advanced analytics and data science elements of complex research projects and you will continuously develop and extend your skill set.  Reporting to a Principal Data Scientist, the role will involve working on state-of-the-art out-of-home audience measurement solutions for domestic and international media markets.  What will I be doing?  This role is a central role in the day-to-day work of our specialised audience measurement data science team. Working in this role, you will be: Developing and maintaining production quality data science software and pipelines systems for our out-of-home audience measurement contracts Using mathematical modelling and machine learning to model human travel behaviour and demographics Manipulating complex data from different sources and data processing in R, Python, SQL and Google Cloud Platform Developing machine learning models with senior data scientist guidance Writing and maintaining production quality code Engaging with stakeholders across the business (internal and external). Managing good professional relationships with clients and internal stakeholders Advising the product team and stakeholders on how to use the data and analysis and communicating methodology and results  What do I need to bring with me?  Interest in and understanding of a range of mathematical / physical models / statistical models / machine learning methods, including: Supervised and unsupervised learning, simulation, optimisation, graph theory and model validation Strong intuition and enthusiasm for data including statistical and machine learning principles Keen to work on hard mathematical/scientific problems with perseverance important Competence in and interest in using multiple data sources, including wrangling of complex data Strong programming and desirable experience of deployment of production standard code as part of data science workflows: Python or R - writing functionally and/or OOP Experience in git with collaborative development of data science workflows / products desirable Strong team player with ability and willingness to work independently, learn and to share knowledge An interest in enriching data sets and modelling human and consumer behaviour Bachelors or Masters in mathematically oriented discipline  About Us ...  Ipsos is one of the world’s largest market research companies with offices in 90 countries. We are an innovative, entrepreneurial, client-focused organisation, providing research services to over 5,000 clients worldwide. Proudly, we are the only global market research company that is still controlled and operated by market researchers. We aim to be intellectually curious and passionate researchers who set ourselves high standards and aim to work collaboratively to service our clients most effectively.  Our culture is unique - we have the entrepreneurial spirit and quirkiness of a small boutique, but we also have the resources, scale and diversity of a large global agency. We have more bright, friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic people, from more backgrounds, with more interests, skills and experiences to learn from. Our values are based on our diverse cultural backgrounds, helping us to be responsive, client-focused and flexible.  We are committed to equality, treating people fairly, promoting a positive and inclusive working environment and ensuring we have diversity of people and views. We recognise that this is important for our business success - a more diverse workforce will enable us to better reflect and understand the world we research and ultimately deliver better research and insight to our clients. We understand the importance of choice and offer a blended work environment, office and work from home. We also realise you may have commitments outside of work and will consider all flexible working applications - please highlight what you are looking for when you make your application.  If this is what you are looking for from your next role, we look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Scientist (Graduate Role)
Description: Ta oferta została pozyskana z tablicy ofert pracy. Więcej informacji We are looking for a Data Scientist who will support our product, sales, leadership and marketing teams with insights gained from analysing company data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimisation and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes. Title: Data Scientist
Description: Ta oferta została pozyskana z tablicy ofert pracy. Więcej informacji C4S Search is happy to be partnered with a new client, a team of highly skilled engineers and data scientists building a unique commercial decision engine for the hospitality industry. Their products are based on advanced data science and machine learning methods and have been recently acquired by a well-funded US start-up. They are a growing team of 40 people that will expand to 100 by mid 2023, and we operate independently while facing the scientific challenges of applying modern multivariate modeling techniques to commercial operations research. Their research covers a range of topics including time series analysis, Bayesian statistics, Monte Carlo simulations, and reinforcement learning. They maintain a Python codebase and are transitioning to a real-time microservices infrastructure. The data science team is focused on end-to-end model ownership and reproducibility, with model improvements driven by their impact on clients in their sophisticated validation framework.  As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for developing highly granular forecasting algorithms for demand in the hospitality industry using modern machine learning techniques. You will expand the datasets and algorithm classes in use, and provide insights into algorithm behavior to communicate to customers. You will work as part of a 25-person science organization to drive a technology-driven shift in the hospitality industry using insights from Operations Research and advanced statistical modeling techniques.  You should have experience in building models with modern ML techniques and be proficient in Python and relevant libraries like pandas. Attention to code quality, including unit testing and validation pipelines, is important. The ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team and take ownership of your work is essential.  In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and practices such as: Python, Pandas, SciPy, Scikit-learn, NumPy, Tensorflow, PyMC3, Dask, Gurobi, Looker, and cloud-native technologies.  You will also be eligible for a market-tracking salary, options package at our parent company, unlimited vacation, and a supportive team environment.

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Atkins Building Design practice are committed to delivering project solutions in any sphere of the built environment that demonstrably improve the quality of life for those people who live, work and play within them. We do this using positive and pioneering technology and exploiting applied research and innovation, with data being the backbone to everything we develop. In support of this we have a dedicated multi-disciplinary research & innovation team, introducing a range of complementary skills to the more traditional design and engineering professionals. Through SNC-Lavalin’s significant industry position, we are involved in some of the world’s largest and most important building projects and this team is central to ensuring our designers deliver leading-edge solutions.  We are currently looking for a data scientist to work alongside our existing data science team working across a broad area of data analytics related to the built environment. This role will provide the opportunity to be directly involved in the delivery of a global giga project and explore new ways that data science can inform and improve the construction industry. The ideal candidate for this role would be someone who 3-5 years’ professional experience post-graduate working in an applied data analytics role within a commercial environment. Knowledge of the built environment sector and how new technology and data driven frameworks can create better places for people is preferable.  Full-time. London based (flexible).  Responsibilities Work alongside the Head of Research & Innovation to develop practical and applicable data led solutions in response to innovation challenges. Lead the scoping, design and delivery of data science outputs and projects for live built environment projects. Prototype solutions, rapidly testing new ideas, debugging, and refactoring existing models. Setting the data structure and building databases where relevant or supporting others to build databases. Responsible for their code, continuously striving to improve code quality and impact. Identify new opportunities to utilise data science to develop current design methodologies as well as new areas of service, both within Atkins and external partners. Work collaboratively with a range of experts in support of organisational objectives. Liaise with other elements of Atkins SNC-Lavalin to leverage the expertise and experience across the business as well as lead the implementation of new propositions developed. Explore opportunities to apply research evidence and innovative technology solutions within the context of our design process and methodology. Skills & Experience Degree level qualification in Data Science, Computer Science, or similar field. Masters level degree in Applied Data Analytics or similar would be preferable. Broad knowledge of data science techniques, use cases and potential impact, as well as the tools and technologies. Experience in applying data science and analysis in an applied research environment to meet commercial objectives. Programming experience in languages such as; Python, SQL, R, VBA, apache spark,big query, Node.JS, or similar for the purpose of research, urban analytics, construction analytics or similar. Demonstrable understanding of data ethics, data preparation and manipulation. Familiar with technology, tools, project organisation and delivery related to the built environment and construction sector. Behaviours Ability to work independently as well as part of team constituting a range of discipline specialists and delivery teams. Quick learner providing the ability to adapt to new technologies and methodologies. Ability to drive analytical scope and methodology for projects, including shaping the models in reference to a commercial environment. Demonstrable passion for staying one step ahead of the competition, testing and experimenting with new technologies and methodologies and encouraging immediate team to do so too. The ability to use data to explore new opportunities for research in the built environment. What we offer?  Atkins recognise that there are many well qualified people who are looking to further their career, but who cannot commit to full time employment. We support flexible working arrangements and are interested to discuss how we can accommodate individual requirements. As part of this commitment, we understand the need for a diverse and flexible workforce, where a work-life balance is important. So, by default Atkins offers flexible working, where there is no fixed 9 ‘till 5, no need for a 5-day week, no requirement for a full-time contract, and no requirement to spend all your working time in the office.  Rewards And Benefits  We offer a competitive salary that is regularly tested against other consultants with a default 25-days leave each year plus bank holidays and options to buy some or sell of that leave. Salary and benefits will be commensurate with experience and qualifications.  Please refer to our website for details of our full benefits package.  https://yourrewarduk.snclavalin.com/.  Training  Atkins is committed to developing its people both personally and professionally. Our colleagues have the advantage of access to a high ranging training portfolio and development activities designed to help make the best of individual’s abilities and talents. We also actively support staff in achieving corporate membership of relevant institutions.  Additional Information  This role may require security clearance and offers of employment will be dependent on obtaining the relevant level of clearance. If this is necessary, it will be discussed with you at interview. If applying to this role please do not make reference to (in conversation) or include in your application or CV, details of any current or previously held security clearance.  We are committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive community - a place where we can all be ourselves, thrive and develop. To help embed inclusion for all, from day one, we offer a range of family friendly, inclusive employment policies, flexible working arrangements and employee networks to support staff from different backgrounds. As an Equal Opportunities Employer, we value applications from all backgrounds, cultures and ability.  | |

Title: Graduate - Data Science
Description: Duration: Two years  Salary: £33,600  Location: London Heathrow  Application Closing Date: 18 January 2023  Start Date: September 2023  The Programme  Airlines are complex, everchanging and data rich, which means that the industry provides one of the most varied and interesting places for data and analytics professionals to work. Problems like determining the optimal mix of aircraft to buy for the next 20 years, or how to improve overbooking set up, requires a creative approach identifying and exploiting value from current and new data sources, applying advanced analytical techniques and visualisations.  You will apply your analytical skills to influence real life multi-million pound decisions from day one, making a tangible impact on the business as your recommendations, tools and models drive key business decisions.  You will provide the analytics input into key business projects. These projects cover all aspects of the airline from Operations to Network Planning to Commercial and have a big impact on the profitability, sustainability and customer satisfaction of our company by increasing revenue, reducing costs, helping to manage risks and optimising our customer experience. Because of this, you will have the opportunity to work across a variety of business functions and form close working relationships with decision makers and leaders within the business.  Across the programme, you will have the opportunity to develop your Data Science and Data Visualisation skills on a project by project basis across different areas of the business.  About You  Are you a curious, innovative thinker? Do you see yourself as a creative and collaborative problem solver with a talent for communicating complex ideas and who can apply your numerical competence to identify trends, patterns and insights from data?  From an academic point of view we are looking for a minimum of a 2:2 degree (with significant Numerical /Data Science / Advanced Analytics / Applied Statistics / Computer Science content) and a minimum of grade B at A-Level Maths (or equivalent).  What's in it for you?  Looking to join our graduate scheme? You won't be disappointed. Recently winning TargetJobs 'Most Popular Graduate Employer in the Transport, Logistics and Supply Chain' category, and being ranked #17 in the GTI Top 300 Graduate Employers, we can't wait to welcome you into the British Airways family.  Benefits  We have many benefits for graduates at British Airways, here are a handful to showcase the diversity of our graduate community Part of the British Airways graduate network and community, with the opportunity to engage with graduates from all schemes in the business and learn from former graduates Involvement in our ambitious sustainability vision, volunteering an active role to champion specific community groups including LGBTQ+ 'Flying Proud' and ethnic minority network 'BeMe' Involvement in Community Investment programmes, taking part in fundraising challenges for partnership charities, supporting causes close to your heart Volunteering in schools, colleges and universities, sharing personal experiences to inspire, motivate and coach students and support their potential to gain employment in the industry we love Access to heavily discounted flights to globe trot, and a generous annual leave entitlement to turn your bucket list into reality Further information & Next Steps  We are delighted that you are considering applying! Here’s some more information you may need about the application process: All sections of your application need to be complete, including all online tests, by the deadline given Due to high volumes of applications, you may only apply for one graduate programme. We would recommend for you to read about each graduate scheme before applying as only your first application will be considered If you are successful with the online tests, you will be invited to complete a short video interview and application questions within a given timeframe Across all stages of the application process, if you fail to submit by the deadline, your application will be automatically withdrawn. Do you have any questions or need advice? We will be running weekly virtual drop in centres for applicants to talk to our recruitment team. Come along any Tuesday between 4pm-5pm by joining the MS teams link.  Join our graduate team to find out more about this programme where you can watch on demand a recent Live Q&A webinar by Using this link. Don’t forget to keep an eye on our main event page on the careers website to see any events you can join to find out more information and top tips, as well as which universities and events we will be attending.  Timelines for this recruitment process Initial applications open between 6 October – 18 January 2023 If your initial application is successful, you will be invited to complete a video interview in February 2023 If your video interview is successful, you will be invited to a Virtual Assessment Centre in March 2023 For more information about our Data Science graduate scheme click here: https://careers.ba.com/data-analytics

Title: Data Scientist, Consumer Lines Analytics, International Accident & Health
Description: Scope Business line: International Accident and Health (IA&H) The position will report to EMEA Pricing and Underwriting Analytics Lead  Responsibilities Developing and delivering consumer lines’ pricing strategy by using advanced machine learning, statistical and optimization techniques to set prices that maximize the value generated through customer acquisition and retention. Execute all aspects of analytics initiatives including exploratory data analysis, machine learning model development, model evaluation and benefit estimation: Developing queries to extract modelling data from our warehouses, creative data exploration and feature engineering. Building, enhancing and assembling machine learning and statistical models to predict losses and customer behavior to improve our pricing. Using and developing pricing algorithms to deliver new price optimizations and tests. Research, recommend, and implement statistical and other mathematical methodologies appropriate for the given model or analysis. Create excellent working relationships with business partners across the Chubb organization, IT and analytics peer groups. Collaborate with internal and external partners, motivate them to achieve optimization goals & learning agendas, and build consensus through strong communication & collaboration Translate specific business needs and goals from partners into effective A/B and multivariate test plans, define test criteria, strategy, methods, and Loss Cost/Conversion model monitoring Drives multivariate testing and communicate test cases/results to a variety of partners with varying levels of expertise on the subject Develop competitive/price elasticity models and analysis utilizing data and analytical skills resulting in dashboard and ad hoc reports for key accounts  Required Experience). 3+ years work experience in an analytical, modelling or data science role with programming experience in Python required. 1+ year work experience in A/B-tests or design of experiment SQL and experience working with large or complex datasets. Extensive experience of multiple statistical methods, tools and language e.g Python, R, etc. Hands-on experience with building and developing GLMs and machine learning models. Experience with version control, automation tools and ML Ops based deployment. Be a fast learner to understand our business, its value drivers and the data it generates. Title: Data Scientist
Description: Ta oferta została pozyskana z tablicy ofert pracy. Więcej informacji Band: 5/ E em> p>  p>  Contract Type: Fixed term appointment (33 months) em> p>  p>  Purpose: strong> p>  The main purpose of the job is to compute new diffusion matrices, taking into account co-located measurements of the wave and plasma parameters, for chorus and plasmaspheric hiss using data from THEMIS-A, THEMIS-D, THEMIS-E and Arase and to assess the role of these waves in radiation belt dynamics. The job will require frequent updates and presentations at team meetings and writing research papers in collaboration with other members of the SWA team. p>  p>  Duties: strong> p>  We employ experts from many different professions to carry out our Science as well as to keep the lights on, feed the research and support teams and keep everyone safe! We aim to attract the best people for our jobs. If you are looking for an opportunity to work with amazing people in amazing places, then British Antarctic Survey could be for you. p>  Our vision strong> p>  At BAS, our vision is to be a world-leading centre for polar science and operations. Making our vision a reality depends on the excellence and diversity of our staff. We are committed to creating a workplace where all our staff can flourish and succeed. BAS is a Disability Confident employer, we are proud to hold a bronze Athena Swan award and we are a member of enei, the Employers Network for Equality & Inclusion. p>  Working at BAS strong> p> Calculate new diffusion coefficients, taking into account co-located measurements of the wave and plasma parameters, for equatorial whistler mode chorus using wave, magnetometer and density data from the THEMIS-A, THEMIS-D and THEMIS-E satellite missions li> Calculate new diffusion coefficients, taking into account co-located measurements of the wave and plasma parameters, for mid-latitude plasmaspheric hiss and whistler mode chorus using wave, magnetometer and density data from the Arase satellite li> Investigate the roles of equatorial chorus at large radial distances and of plasmaspheric hiss and chorus at mid-latitudes on radiation belt dynamics by comparing and contrasting the new diffusion coefficients with those using existing methods li> Incorporate the new diffusion coefficients from the THEMIS spacecraft and Arase with those from the Van Allen probes to create diffusion matrices for chorus and hiss throughout the radiation belts li> Give presentations at monthly meetings and scientific conferences li> Write research papers in collaboration with other members of the team li> ul> Skills Specification strong> p> Qualification p> BSc/ MSc in physics or closely related subject. li> PhD in physics, maths or closely related subject li> ul> Knowledge and Experience strong> p> Essential p> First degree and some relevant research experience li> Published two or more first author research papers in peer reviewed Journals li> Either experience working with large satellite data sets or experience working with large computer models li> ul> Desirable p> Knowledge of plasma physics or radiation belt physics li> ul> Skills and Competencies p> Experience developing significant bodies of code in Python li> Experience writing code in FORTRAN or similar high-level language li> Working knowledge of unix type operating system li> Experience with software repositories, ideally GIT. Experience of high-performance computing. li> Proficient in written and spoken English language li> Ability to work as part of a team under direction li> ul> Who are we? strong> p> British Antarctic Survey (BAS) delivers and enables world-leading interdisciplinary research in the Polar Regions. Its skilled science and support staff based in Cambridge, Antarctica and the Arctic, work together to deliver research that uses the Polar Regions to advance our understanding of Earth as a sustainable planet. Through its extensive logistic capability and know how BAS facilitates access for the British and international science community to the UK polar research operation. Numerous national and international collaborations, combined with an excellent infrastructure help sustain a world leading position for the UK in Antarctic affairs. British Antarctic Survey is a component of the Natural Environment Research Council (NERC). p> Choosing to come to work at BAS means that you will have access to a whole host of benefits from a defined benefit pension scheme, excellent holiday entitlement, access to employee shopping/ travel discounts and salary sacrifice cycle to work scheme. Title: Data Scientist
Description: Ta oferta została pozyskana z tablicy ofert pracy. Więcej informacji Our client is growing at pace due to the success of their Industry leading products for clinical trials. We are looking for a Data Scientist.  Areas That We Are Currently Evaluating Are  The Data Scientist will be involved in working with the Product Development team in the design and development of new releases of my clients market leading risk based monitoring product. We are currently re-building the platform with a view to making the application more comprehensive and build in more statistical monitoring methods. The main role of the Data Scientist will be to develop statistical models and visualizations that can be used to identify potential data quality issues with subjects, sites and studies. Statistical approaches to working with small data sets (that would be applicable to Phase I or II trials) Quality Tolerance Limits using process control methodology Bayesian models using historical data sets to inform tolerance limits for new studies Trend Analysis Site comparison models Cross study comparison models This role will also be involved in advising on test strategies for the models.  As we progress with the new build it is our intention to move into more automated modelling using machine learning, so this will provide a great opportunity for anyone interested in developing skills in this area.  Study Implementation The role will in part be a client facing role, the statistician will be involved in the initial protocol risk assessment, evaluating the study design and statistical analysis approach for risk and bias. Following on from this the statistician will also work with the QRBM Implementation Consultants to define Key Risk Indicators for the Centralized Monitoring strategy, and once set up, to determine control thresholds/tolerance limits. Once the study is underway, the statistician will also be involved in the ongoing review, providing support and guidance to client and RBM Implementation Consultants on data interpretation and adjustments to study tolerance limits/thresholds. My client are passionate about learning from experience and listening to our customers, and it is important that the statistician is involved in the implementation process to bring the lessons learned from our study projects into the product development. This is a great opportunity for someone who is interested in how we can make better use of data in clinical trials to determine which sites, patients and data are most at risk with a view to being able to identify the leading indicators that are predictive of study and site quality.  My client are passionate about our culture and values and we are looking for someone who will thrive in a hardworking, energetic, creative and team-oriented environment. Ideally you will be excited by the opportunity to have a leading role in the implementation and development of statistical approaches in centralized monitoring, direct access to the senior leadership team, and the opportunity to be involved in the implementation and continuous development of an application that will truly make a difference to advancements in getting medical treatments to patients.  The Candidate  Experience in data modelling, using statistical methods to identify behavioral and data patterns. Industry experience would be advantageous, but this is no clinical endpoint analysis so a different way of thinking about data and stats modelling is required.  An interest and/or experience in machine learning models would also be an advantage but not essential.  Interpersonal Skills Self-motivated Creative and visionary Strong communication, ability to make a positive impact with internal and external stakeholders Enjoy working in a small, but growing, results-oriented team Ability to take responsibility for the consistency and quality of deliverables Technical Skills (not Exclusive) PhD or MSc in Medical Statistics, Statistics or Data Science Desirable to have an understanding of Agile software development Experience in modeling and regression analysis Programming skills ideally in R, Python and SAS Experience/interest in application of Machine Learning Ability to review clinical protocols and understand the study design and subject visits schedules Ability to demonstrate and apply critical thinking to KRI and data visualization design and centralized monitoring implementation Understanding of clinical trial data and data structure, particularly from EDC, including CDISC/CDASH and SDTM standards Ideally an understanding of other standards in Healthcare such as Snowmed, Bridg, HL7 #DataScientist

Title: Data Scientist
Description: About The Role  W HO ARE WE  We’re Entain , and our vision is a simple one; to be the world leader in sports betting and gaming entertainment by creating the most exciting and trusted experience for our customers, revolutionising the gambling space as we go. We're home to a global family of more than 25 well-known brands we’re pretty sure you will have heard of before – Ladbrokes, Coral, Foxy Bingo, Gala Bingo, PartyPoker , Bwin... the list goes on.  Don’t just read about our journey though, check out this video whilst you review the rest of this job advert. Watch here: We’re Entain .  What's In It For You  We offer a competitive industry salary package plus a generous annual company bonus, but that's not all. As an employee at Ent a in you will have access to a bespoke benefits platform which lets you customise your benefits so they are truly unique to you, and what benefits you.  This includes options to opt-in to share save schemes, increase your annual leave accrual, access to professional development tools, retail discount vouchers, health care plans, free subscription to Unmind and much more more .  What You Will Do  We are looking for a passionate , and curious D ata Scientist who will help us discover and monetise the information hidden in our unmatched data sets, help ing us make smarter decisions to better serve our customers , and grow our product s .  We work on exciting and novel machine learning problems , with a modern and evolving technology stack ; finding the right answer, not just the first answer to these key initiatives.  We are a global team operating across the Entain portfolio , embedded into the business activities across all our geographies and brands ; with a clear mandate to support customer acquisition , retention , and protection .  Our project portfolio is both broad and deep, and our work is visible and impactful to the company’s vision and success.  You can choose one of our established offices in London, Gibraltar or Vienna . You will benefit from access to learning resources and conferences and be part of a fun and inspirational work environment .  You will be a key player working alongside experienced data scientist s on exciting initiatives which determine the future of our product s (critically, y ou will not be focusing on building dashboards and reports ) .  What You Will Be Involved In  Building models and machine-learning algorithms , taking the opportunity from ideation through to deployment in our live production environment Analy sing large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns , presenting the results in a commercial impactful manner Extracting and interpreting the business insights and provide recommendations based on those insights Appling mathematical rigor and a highly refined sense of both "where to look next" and "what to do instead" when performing your analysis Undertaking pre-processing of structured and unstructured data for your analytics Conducting research and development activities, data exploration and discovery, develop prototypes, algorithms and proof of concepts, leveraging leading data science and technology solutions – bring in the best of the wider community to the team. For an extensive list of projects you will work on within this role, you can download our full role spec in on our careers page within the job profile!  Who Are You  Experienced in the application of data science , having applied these concepts in CRM or other commercial settings Strong data science understanding and experience of solution delivery from idea to productio n Pragmatic thinking & high degree of attention to detail ; able to operate as a n individual contributor, as well as part of a larger team Experience in working with vast amounts of data to detect trends and patterns Comfortable working with ambiguous requirements, and translating these into testable experiments , challenging and clarifying scope and success measures as needed. Commercial acumen - interested in the business applications of the model not just the techniques behind the models themselves Development experience in Python , SQL ( including concepts like sliding window, partition-based calculations) ; plus, key concepts such as version control .  We are also keen for people to be naturally motivated, curious and eager to learn. We love honesty and integrity, live and breathe team spirit and play as one team. If that sounds like a team and company you want to thrive within, we would love to hear from you.  About Entain  We may sit on the FTSE100, but for millions of customers worldwide, we’re the brands they hold in their hands – and heart. As the home of household names like Ladbrokes, Foxy and PartyPoker, to name just a few, we elevate lives with moments of excitement. And right now we’re elevating ourselves above the competition. We’re leading the industry in bold new directions - and it’s our diverse and talented team who are making this possible. Believe us, the best is yet to come. For our customers. For our future. For your career.  DEI and Wellbeing @ Entain  At Entain we do what’s right. It’s one of our core values. Which is why we’re taking the lead when it comes to creating a diverse, equal and inclusive future - for our people, our industry and our society. We’ve created a culture where everyone can feel psychologically safe, included and heard. Where being accepted for who you are is a given. Here, we celebrate our individual differences, and make sure everyone feels supported, respected, and empowered to thrive – and that starts from the moment you apply to join us. We want our employees to feel healthy and supported at home and at work. That’s why we have our Well-me programme, which provides information, tools and training to help our people look after their mental and physical wellbeing in ways that matter to them.  Life @ Entain  We’re a team who love to play, and win, together. We love building bonds between our people, and we love to build your career up too. Join us, and we won’t just be your employer, we’ll be your biggest cheerleader. We’ll give you the power to lead the conversation on your learning and career goals from day one, and then get behind you with all the support you need to take your career – and our business – to new heights.  Apply Online

Title: Data Scientist / Software Developer
Description: Hybrid Intelligence is a team within Capgemini Engineering that uses data science, applied mathematics and software engineering to solve complex problems for clients. We are always looking for the best science, mathematics and engineering graduates and postgraduates to join us. We offer exciting opportunities to use a range of skills to create, develop and deliver solutions to some of the most challenging problems in the world.  We are currently recruiting for people to start in spring 2023 and beyond.  Your Career  You will use your domain knowledge and technical skills to truly understand and solve the challenges faced by our clients, who are all world leading companies in science and technology. Your activities will vary from project to project, but will broadly involve data science and software engineering, from analysing and interpreting client data to developing bespoke software solutions in a range of programming languages. Projects themselves are varied, from developing smarter drug trials to controlling the orbit and attitude of satellites.  You will need to build excellent relationships to collaborate with colleagues and enthusiastically engage with clients. We will provide a dedicated support network around you to ensure the best start to your career. Project team sizes are typically small and durations are relatively short, so you will make a big impact and quickly gain experience across different domains, allowing you to apply innovative thinking and transferable skills to solve fresh challenges.  Your Future  The key to our success is the quality of our staff. We value your academic background as much as technical skills, so we do not expect you to be a software expert. If you have a good grounding in Python and a keen interest to learn, we will invest in you to develop professional skills in new technologies and languages. We will provide extensive training throughout your career and many courses often lead to recognised qualifications.  Working on our projects is hugely rewarding and you will never stop learning and developing. With support from your manager, you will shape your own career, and we will help you develop the skills you need to achieve your ambitions. Career paths can be focused on technology, domain expertise or people management, or a combination of these.  About You  We are looking for a creative problem solver with an excellent academic record in science, mathematics or engineering. Though not essential, we value PhDs and we recognise and reward the additional skills they bring. You should have excellent interpersonal skills and be comfortable explaining complex concepts to clients and colleagues from all backgrounds.  You should understand and enjoy programming in Python and be able to write a few lines of code. You should also know how various data science techniques, from statistics to machine learning, are used to interpret complex data.  Our Culture  We are proud of our amazing culture, where a positive attitude and a commitment to continuous learning are valued. The wellbeing and engagement of all staff is our priority, and we work in a collaborative and supportive environment with a good work-life balance. As well as a competitive starting salary, we offer a range of benefits, which you can select to fit your needs.  We encourage flexible working and we trust staff to balance the needs of their projects with their personal commitments. Sometimes you will be required to work on client sites, which are usually within easy reach of your base location. Sometimes you will dial in to remote meetings with a geographically dispersed team. At other times there is no substitute for meeting up with colleagues to work together and share ideas.  We are dedicated to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We appreciate individuals for who they are and value the diversity they bring to the workplace.  About Capgemini  Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of 300,000 team members in nearly 50 countries. With its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fuelled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms.

Więcej informacji Marshall Wolfe are proud to be supporting our client, a fast growing Data analytics consultancy in their search for Data Scientist to join their expanding team.  You will have the opportunity to work on, or lead on, a variety of projects with customers across Financial Services, Energy and Utilities, Industrial Manufacturing, Medical Research, Sports and Entertainment, Retail, Automotive and Engineering, amongst others.  Responsibilities  As a Data Scientist you will lead in developing and implementing algorithmic tools to best gain insight from customer data. You will also research and apply data modelling, machine learning and data mining techniques to provide client-friendly insight.  You will self-direct your work to ensure best-in-class productionised analytics and insight generation. You may act as lead consultant or mentor to less experienced members of the team, so first class communications skills are a must.  Skills  Experience with IDP (Intelligent Document Processing) Experience in deploying AI solutions using Cloud-based systems (ideally AWS) Advanced Experience with Python. Commercial client facing experience in Data Science, ideally, a combination of excellent academic research and high-impact commercial experience. In depth understanding of common Machine Learning problems Experience in advanced topics of Machine Learning (e.g., NLP word embeddings, Bayesian inference, hierarchical models, deep learning, Gaussian processes, causal inference, graph theory, etc.).- Experience in preparing data for Machine Learning (e.g., using SQL and/or NoSQL technologies). Experience with leading/supporting ML Operations (for example robust CI/CD, Model monitoring, automatic deployment, automatic retraining, data and code auditing, comprehensive logging and alerting) Have knowledge of the usage of at least one of the popular deep learning frameworks (e.g., MxNet, Tensorflow, Caffe2, Pytorch, etc.)  Hybird/Remote working avilable  Office Locations based In London and Suffolk

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Data Scientist: ML Models, Power BI, Azure, SQL, Python, NLP  An exciting opportunity for a Data Scientist to join a cloud-native, Lloyd's insurance organization. As part of a truly greenfield environment, you will work with a highly technical team of Data Scientists and Catastrophe Scientists. The successful Data Scientist will take complete ownership of the end-to end project from data collection, to data modelling & analysis to stakeholder engagement.  As part of this diverse team, you will be hands-on in building and deploying ML models into production. You will have experience in Azure Cloud Data Services, Python, SQL and Power BI but will also have the opportunity to expand your technical skillset in a vibrant and progressive work environment. As a motivated self-starter this is the perfect place to cut your teeth in a technology first environment that continue to push boundaries within the Insurance sector.  Responsibilities: Build and deploy ML models into production Understand best DevOps practice for scalability and reusability Build solutions and applications to solve complex business problems Ability to communicate with all levels of the business, including stakeholders and team members Contribute own ideas and assist in supporting objectives of the team  Requirements: Experience of taking ML models from research and development into production Understanding of statistical models Proficient knowledge of programming languages such as SQL/Python/R Experience in Cloud Data Services such as Azure, Databricks, and Snowflake Bachelors/Masters degree in Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or Computer Science  Data Scientist: ML Models, Power BI, Azure, SQL, Python, NLP

Title: Graduate Data Scientist (Python, Matlab)
Description: Are you a Graduate or Junior Data Scientist, who is looking to work in a fast paced, global, market leading company?  Here at Innovative Technology we have an excellent opportunity for a Graduate or Junior Data Scientist (Python, Matlab) to join our talented team in our global head office in Oldham, Manchester.  We’re Innovative…  We’re in our 30th year here at Innovative Technology, we now have offices on five continents and employ over 400 people, with over 150 based from our state-of-the-art R&D hub and global head office in Oldham, Manchester.  From self-service checkouts to arcade machines, we provide our retail, banking, kiosk, vending, gaming and amusement customers with products and services that help them securely accept automated payments, with our industry leading technology keeping us at the forefront of our sector.  By being true to our values of Innovation, Collaboration, Respect and Drive we’ve seen significant growth and won numerous domestic and international awards, whilst offering outstanding career opportunities and great benefits. We’re Investors in People & are proud to hold the IIP Silver accreditation. You’ll find us on the edge of the Pennines and less than half an hour from central Manchester, with modern offices, free parking and excellent transport links.  About the Graduate Data Scientist (Python, Matlab) Opportunity:  Our Data Scientists help power our ITL products with cutting-edge machine learning algorithms. Joining our dynamic team, you will work with a diverse range of data where you will have the ability to showcase your mathematical toolbox and advance your data science skills.  Whether you are researching, developing or implementing machine learning algorithms, as our Graduate Data Scientist you will be responsible for the progress of your own project and its integration in a real-world product. This will be done under the supervision of our experienced Data Science Team, ensuring the process is interesting and challenging.  If you are an enthusiastic individual with a genuine and keen interest in Data Science, who is not afraid of hard work and solving new problems, then this Graduate Data Scientist (Python, Matlab) role is the ideal opportunity for you.  Key responsibilities of our Graduate Data Scientist (Python, Matlab) will include:  Investigating and analysing sensor, image, time and numerical information to identify insights and patterns in data. Researching cutting-edge machine learning algorithms for Innovative Technology’s currency validation technologies. Designing, implementing and validating new algorithms to ensure our product accuracy continues to be industry leading. Participating in quarterly internal Kaggle events on ITL concepts and ideas. Participating and presenting at regular team knowledge sharing events. Attending conferences, seminars and other events to ensure we are keeping up to date with newest Machine Learning techniques.  Our ideal Graduate Data Scientist (Python, Matlab) will have the following qualifications, experience and knowledge which will need to be demonstrated on the application form:  Qualifications  A degree or PhD in Mathematics, Computer Science or Computational Science  Essential  A degree or PhD in Mathematics, Computer Science or Computational Science Passion for researching and implementing machine learning techniques and algorithms Highly numerate, analytically minded with a practical approach to solving problems Experience in programming, ideally in Python or MATLAB and C++  Desirable  Experience in computer vision and image processing Knowledge of machine learning techniques such as Support Vector Machines, Decision Trees and Deep Learning  Package & Perks you will receive as our Graduate Data Scientist (Python, Matlab):  A competitive salary Workplace Pension Scheme, with a 3% contribution from us Flexible working hours and some working from home available Paid breaks, lounge style canteens and games tables, with free hot premium drinks 32 days holiday (including public holidays) and the opportunity to earn up to an extra 12 days holiday each year Private Healthcare Scheme Dental scheme Life Insurance Educational Sponsorship Electric Car Scheme Onsite electric car charging points Staff car workshop Cycle to Work Scheme Informal dress code Free onsite modern gym  What’s next?  If you’re looking to develop as a Software Engineer (C#, C++ & MySQL) and want to join our award-winning team on the latest cutting-edge technology we want to hear from you.  A better way... Through our people, drive and commitment we push boundaries to deliver innovative products and services.

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Ta oferta została pozyskana z tablicy ofert pracy. Więcej informacji Quantitative Developer/Data Scientist  Data Modelling, Decision Science, Computational Mathematics, Machine Learning, Python, Power BI,  Who are we?  We are Amplifi Capital, and we have disrupted the financial industry by building a modern FinTech Ecosystem that allows Credit Unions in the UK offer ethical and responsible financial project to near prime customers. We have ambitious plans having grown 5x in 2021 and with over 45,000 customers on our platform, we’re on course to be the biggest player in the UK credit union market by the end of 2022.  What do we offer?  As well as a competitive salary you will receive 25 days holiday, pension, private health care, discount shopping and the opportunity to work in popular Canary Wharf at our state of the art offices. Work from home days are available.  Why do we do what we do?  We are all passionate about this industry and our aim is to grow a select group of Community Lenders into network challenger banks offering a viable alternative to high-cost lenders.  Sounds great right? What will you be doing?  We're looking for Quant Developers/Data Scientists to join our highly agile, London-based team. Working on vast data sets, the successful Data Analyst will be manipulating massive amounts of data from a variety of unstructured sources and will be applying statistical analysis and quantitative modelling. As a Data and Quant analyst, you'll be working in Python and SQL, along with applying your skills in mathematics, physics and statistics.  Responsibilities  Develop new predictive models and refine existing ones that drive every aspect of our business from underwriting and pricing to marketing, maintenance, and collections. Develop and maintain high quality data pipelines. Productionize ML models including training pipelines, monitoring, and reporting. Interpreting and analyzing data problems.  Requirements  Prior professional experience in a data science role, preferably within financial services. Graduate degree in a STEM field with a strong understanding of computational mathematics, statistics, and machine learning. Experience of using programming languages / analytical software such as Python, SQL, MLFlow, and Power BI. Deep learning experience would be highly desirable. Good communication and collaboration skills with a diverse team in both technical and non-technical elements and an ability and willingness to learn and to work hard. Ability to conceive, plan, prioritize, and manage your own projects.  Benefits  As well as a competitive salary you will receive 25 days holiday, pension, private health care, discount shopping and the opportunity to work in popular Canary Wharf at our state of the art offices. Work from home days are available.

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Data Scientist  Permanent  £50,000 - £55,000 + benefits  Leeds based with hybrid working    Xcede are excited to be partnering with a major Logistics organisation who are looking to hire a Data Scientist to be based in their Leeds office (once a week, the rest can be worked from home).    The role will be fully hands on, offering the opportunity to combine Data Science/Machine Learning and Analytics techniques, whilst owning projects from end-to-end. They are looking for candidates with excellent experience in the Data Science fundamentals, and someone who is confident when liaising with stakeholders.    Key skills/experience required:    Degree in a STEM subject ideally Experience utilising Machine Learning and Advanced Analytics approaches to solve business problems Specialist in SQL and Python + open to learning new languages Strong understanding of building Machine Learning models using techniques such as forecasting, time series analysis and optimisation Excellent statistical approach to problem solving An understanding of how to move ML models into production AWS experience is desirable Ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders Excellent communication skills   No sponsorship available for this role, unfortunately.    For more information, please send an up-to-date CV to Nathan.carolan@xcede.com    Data Scientist, Python, SQL, Computer Science, Statistics, Data pipelines, SQL, Regression, Forecasting, Time series, Optimisation, Random Forest, Decision Trees, Predictive modelling, Machine Learning, AWS

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Data Scientist Medical Hardware company  Job Title: Data Scientist  Are you passionate about using data to drive change and improve the world around us? Are you an experienced data scientist looking for a meaningful and impactful role on society within our hospitals?  Our client is a leading provider of innovative hardware solutions for cleaning air within hospitals. They are dedicated to improving the health and safety of health care environments and are looking for a talented data scientist to join the team. They are within their pre seed stage so they would be looking for someone who is willing to tackle this challenge.  As a data scientist, you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of projects, using your expertise in statistical analysis, machine learning, and data visualisation to inform the development of our products and drive continuous improvement. You will work closely with our engineering and product teams to identify areas for optimisation and help us make data-driven decisions.  To Be Successful In This Role, You Should Have  A degree in a related field, such as computer science, statistics, or mathematics Strong experience in statistical analysis and machine learning (3+ years) Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and C++ Excellent communication and problem-solving skills A passion for using data to drive change and improve the world around us  If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, we encourage you to apply now. The position is paying up to £60,000 per annum for the right person and it would be on a remote working schedule.  Robert Walters Operations Limited is an employment business and employment agency and welcomes applications from all candidates

Title: Data Scientist
Description: Data Scientist - London - Hybrid (Flexible) - Up To £100,000 per annum As a Data Scientist, you will be expected to have strong experience in SAS, R and Python. As a Data Scientist, you will be expected to be highly proficient using Excel and other analysis tools. As a Data Scientist, you will be expected to have excellent verbal and written communication skills. As a Data Scientist, you will be expected to have ability to convey complex concepts to non-technical members of the team. As a Data Scientist, you will be expected to interact with credit reference external parties. As a Data Scientist, you will be expected to work closely with colleagues to deliver projects. Essential Responsibilities: Work on the creation and deployment of best in class segmented credit models that are appropriate for unsecured consumer lending products. Work closely with the wider analytics team to drive improvement to the overall value of the portfolio by adapting data sources, modelling strategies, cut-offs and application processes. Produce written summary of analysis and recommendations and present those to senior technical or non-technical audiences. Produce MI to monitor the adequacy of existing models. Alert the management team of any model degradation, propose and own remediation actions. Essential Experience & Skills: Strong experience of Python, R, SQL and strong Modelling. 3+ years in Finance/Banking services experience, with at least a few years in credit/loan/debt domain. Strong experience of modelling, data science, or decision science in the context of risk management and credit/loan/debt within the financial services industry. Strong knowledge of data manipulation and modelling languages using SQL, SAS, R and Python. Experience in development, deployment and monitoring of best-in-class models and statistical algorithms. Experience in understand the business needs and use a variety of modelling techniques. Ability to work in an extremely fast paced start-up environment.
