Title: Applied Intelligence Big Data Scientist
Description: Accenture Applied Intelligence  You've heard of Artificial Intelligence (AI), but what about Applied Intelligence?  AI may be the talk of the town, but it's not a silver bullet. That's where Applied Intelligence comes in: It's our unique approach to combining AI with data, analytics and automation under a bold strategic vision to transform business in a very pragmatic way.  AI Centre of excellence in Poland is part of a global team of more than 6,000 deep AI experts and 3,000 data scientists. We work with almost any technology partner including SAS, AWS, GCP, and Microsoft.  We build resilient data approaches, make AI vision a reality and make it scalable. Our work makes an impact and help businesses prepare for tomorrow.  What will you do:  Work with us at the forefront of the digital revolution contributing your creativity, innovativeness, critical thinking and numeric skills to help us shape the global digital landscape.  Use Big Data technologies to improve Client businesses by combining standard and advanced data processing such as information extraction from unstructured data, bespoke data integration methods incorporating graph analytics with statistical ML/deep learning models.  Work in interdisciplinary teams that gather technical, business, Big Data and data science competencies that deliver work in agile methodologies (at client localization, remotely or mixed).  The range of your accountability, responsibility and autonomy will depend on your experience and seniority - we are looking for both experienced specialists as well and non-experienced talents.  What do we expect:  Graduated or soon to be graduated from university with MSc/BSc in areas such as Informatics, Physics, Mathematics, Quantitative Methods and are continuously looking forward to use your knowledge to solve complex business problems.  Have an unstoppable thirst for knowledge and are comfortable with ongoing skills development whether it comes to learning completely new technology, mastering relevant ML algorithm or deepening your practical knowledge on more traditional tools such as R, Python or SAS.  Have experience and/or interest in Big Data technologies such as Hive, Spark, NiFi, HBASE, HDFS, Kafka, Kudu,  Have experience and/or interest in delivering analytical projects with top Cloud platforms such as GCP, Azure, AWS  Understand that ETL is one of the key components of successful delivery in Analytics and are capable of working at any step of analytical model development or looking to extend your skills in areas which you are less familiar with.  Have a very good command of English language (it is nice to have command of additional language, for instance, German).  Are a great team player (it is nice to have experience in working in international teams)  We Offer You:  Permanent contract with competitive salary  Paid overtime  Private medical care, life insurance and employee share program  Financing of certificates in latest technologies and tools  Yearly training time allowance depending on your career level  Career and competence support,  including ongoing mentoring and clearly defined career paths  Exposition to latest technologies in the field of Data Engineering and cloud computing in connection with a global network of analytics professionals

Title: Applied Data Scientist
Description: Life at Plume  At Plume, we believe that technology isn't about moving faster, it's about making life’s moments better. Which is why we’ve built the world's first, and only, open and hardware-independent service delivery platform for smart homes, small businesses, enterprises, and beyond. Our SaaS platform uses WiFi, advanced AI, and machine learning to create the future of connected spaces—and human experiences—at massive scale.  We now deliver services to over 40 million locations globally and have managed over 2 billion devices on our platform. We’re expanding rapidly, pioneering a new category, and we achieved our Series F funding in just four years. Our customers include many of the world's largest Communications Service Providers (CSPs) who look to Plume to help them evolve their smart home offerings while gleaning insights from their own data.  With a bias for action and a love for being trailblazers, the team at Plume embodies a combination of relentless curiosity and imaginative innovation. We challenge ourselves to think in ways that other companies don't, work to do what should be done (rather than what can), and if we can’t do it exceptionally well, we don’t do it. It’s how we've assembled a team of world-class builders, thinkers, and doers. And it’s how we’re reinventing what’s possible every day.  Plume's Data Services team is looking for Machine Learning Engineers with a desire to innovate in building ML models on the edge. You will work cross-functionally with product, data science, software, and firmware development teams to tackle challenges around building and deploying ML algorithms. Due to the unique datasets and requirements that Plume has, you will be solving challenging problems on a daily basis using cutting edge technologies and advanced architectural patterns involving both distributed systems and edge devices. This is a high impact role with immense growth opportunities and will truly put your software and machine learning engineering skills to the test.  What You’ll Do Lead the development of machine learning algorithms on health/fitness data Improve existing machine learning pipeline scalability, usability, and performance Work closely with cross-functional teams to tackle challenges around time series data coming from sensors and edge devices Connect the gap between R&D and production and collaborate with our product managers, data scientists,  and firmware engineers to ensure the delivery of high quality and robust solutions for our users What You’ll Bring BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related technical field 3+ years of industry experience in developing ML systems Strong programming skills in Python Proficiency manipulating big data with Apache Spark (PySpark) Experience with leading machine learning product development on time-series data (sensor,  IOT devices, health/fitness tracking, audio, etc.) Strong knowledge in software architecture design, debugging, source control management, testing, performance, scaling, and operations. Experience and demonstrated capability to handle challenges with vague or abstract problem definition Bonus If You Have Knowledge in edge devices with limited computing power and memory size. Experience building and deploying machine learning models that run efficiently on edge devices Signal processing Please send your application in English language.  About Plume  As the creator of the only open, hardware-independent, cloud-controlled experience platform for CSPs and their subscribers, Plume partners with over 250 CSP customers, including some of the world’s largest such as Comcast, Charter, Liberty Global, and J:COM.  Using OpenSync, the most widely supported open-source, silicon-to-cloud framework for smart spaces, Plume’s software-defined network allows CSPs to decouple their service offerings from hardware and rapidly curate and deliver new services over a multi-vendor, open-platform architecture.  Backed by investors such as Insight Partners and SoftBank Vision Fund 2, Plume is now valued at $2.6B, having added over $500M in funding in 2021 alone.  Plume is an equal opportunity workplace that maintains a continuing policy of nondiscrimination in all employment practices and decisions, ensuring equal employment opportunities for all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, pregnancy, childbirth or related individual conditions, medical conditions (as defined by state law),  military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

Title: Python Programmer in Data Science
Description: Opis stanowiska pracy  Looking for an experienced Mid/Senior Python Programmer to support Data Science/AI team in building and deploying complex ML/Statistics based solutions.  The Data Science Team in Warsaw is responsible for support/development of dynamic pricing system for fuel at the gas stations and many other tools  Responsibilities  Developing and enhancing data/analytics/ML systems in Python, maximizing their performance and scalability Designing, building and supporting processes for data cleaning and manipulation in Python, Pyspark & SparkSQL Working within a modern Azure Cloud data platform (Snowflake / Azure Databricks / DevOps)  Required Skills And  Experience  Years (5+) of professional experience in Python programming as a primary language (non-scripting) with DevOps experience Experience in OOP/functional coding in Python Understanding of multithreading/multiprocessing in Python Knowledge of advanced language features in Python: context managers, decorators, descriptors Experience with probability, statistical modeling and inference (OLS, GLM, hypothesis testing, A/B testing) Experience with linear and nonlinear regression models,  hyperparameter tuning Experience in Virtual environment (venv) Experience in unit testing or validating code/data Strong understanding of relational databases, working knowledge of SQL Understanding of data engineering Understanding of cloud technology, experience with Azure/AWS-based applications Experience in developing and deploying to Linux environments Experience working in agile methodologies (SCRUM) GIT version control, GitHub, GitLab Agile mindset and willingness to learn new tools  Fluent English (project communication in English)  Nice To Have  Experience with Docker Experience with various Python libraries such as Pandas/NumPy/SciPy/Scikit-learn/Matplotlib for data analysis and modeling Experience in building data pipelines Working knowledge of PySpark and SparkSQL Experience in Spark and SQL environments (Azure Databricks/Snowflake/MS SQL Server or close equivalents) Experience with CI/CD tools (preferably Azure DevOps) Experience in JIRA and Confluence  What do we  offer?  Annual bonus Private medical care Multisport English lessons subsidized by the company Group insurance Attractive discounts for products and services at our stations Employee stock purchase plan Modern and convenient office that you can virtually visit here - https://goo.gl/maps/CLteHfYcdYMbdESq6 Trainings & possibility to develop skills in a wide international environment  When working with us you can depend upon it that you will not be judged on the grounds of race,  national origin, gender, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Oppositely – we believe that our diverse and inclusive culture helps us create an amazing atmosphere where everybody feels welcome.  Check who we are here: https://youtu.be/td-QGnNnvW0  If you are looking for a place to work where you could learn new things, have some real challenges, implement advanced software that is used on global scale, you are more than welcome to join us!  R293103

Title: Data Science Lead
Description: Job Description  We are searching for a passionate lead Data Scientist to help us improve our services and products using Machine Learning.  Qualifications  You will need to: Mentor, coach, and lead members of the data science team. Work with business and technical stakeholders to select appropriate ML solutions; Research, design, develop and support machine learning solutions for the following use cases: advantage play identification and fraud prevention, identification of suspicious user behavior patterns, chat analysis, identification of player preferences, game presenter performance detection using video data Work with other teams to make sure that the necessary data are available. Apply statistical inference and experiment design methods to experimental and observational data. Plan data science teamwork and report to stakeholders.  To succeed in this role you should have:  University degree in numerical field (Machine Learning, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, etc.); Experience and understanding of linear algebra, statistical modeling, experiment design, and analysis. In-depth knowledge in at least one Machine Learning field such as regression, classification, clustering, pattern mining, or optimization; Experience with at least one Machine Learning frameworks such as Scikit-Learn, Keras, Tensorflow, Pytorch, or MLLib; Hands-on with Python, in particular packages such as Pandas, Numpy, Matplotlib (or equivalent); Experience with SQL and Big data tools such as Spark/Hive; Highly proficient in spoken and written English; Excellent communication skills and a pragmatic approach to problem-solving; Willingness to learn and interest in the latest trends in programming and machine learning.  We will appreciate  Experience in team lead position; Knowledge of Scala or Java; Experience with designing and deploying machine learning pipelines to production; Experience with AWS or other cloud providers; Experience with Kafka, Clickhouse.  Additional Information  We offer  Entrepreneur culture of the company, which allows you to try new approaches and technologies all the time Being a part of an international team in a successful, publicly traded company Health insurance, contemporary office environment, tech conference attendance, training, hackathons, and other benefits and perks.  Evolution is a market-leading developer and provider of products and services for online casino entertainment. Our excellence is driven by over 15,000 EVOlutioneers across 30 markets worldwide, working in product innovation, software development, IT solutions, game hosting and business support. Evolution's dynamic and creative environment creates a unique opportunity for personal and professional growth.  Our integrated business-to-business solutions guarantee that our clients can always provide an unrivaled online entertainment experience to their players globally. We thrive on remaining an award-winning digital powerhouse of entertainment products and services with an ever-expanding line-up of product brands: Evolution Live, NetEnt, Red Tiger, Ezugi, Big Time Gaming, Nolimit City and DigiWheel.  Evolution is a Swedish company founded in 2006 and listed on Nasdaq Nordic (EVO). More information on Evolution.com.  Apply now  You're almost there!  We look forward to receiving your application. This will only take a minute to complete.  Upload CV  Connect with LinkedIn  Fill manually  Please read our Applicant Privacy Notice before submitting your application and note that by submitting your application, you accept our privacy policy and cookie policy as well as the privacy policy and terms of use of SmartRecruters, the platform we use for administrating CVs.

Title: Genomic Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description: At Bayer, we are visionaries and determined to overcome our planet's greatest challenges and contribute to a world where enough food and adequate medical care for all people are no longer unattainable goals. We do this with energy, curiosity and pure dedication, always learning from the people around us, expanding our mindset, improving our abilities and redefining the "impossible". There are many reasons to join us: if you are looking for a varied and meaningful professional future where you can really make a difference together with other brilliant minds, we want you on our team.  Genomic Data Scientist (m/f/d) Biomedical Data Science is a group within pharmaceutical research and development at Bayer. Their goal is to gain new insights into therapeutic mechanisms and patient populations by analyzing large, complex data sets. This is done in collaboration with internal and external partners, including world-leading institutions such as the BROAD Institute.  YOUR TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES Responsibility for designing and performing complex analyses to identify novel drug targets and biomarkers relevant to the implementation of clinical development research projects; this includes all therapeutic indications, with a focus on kidney disease and cardiomyopathies Use genome-wide association studies and rare disease genetics to systematically identify new targets and elucidate target mechanisms Analysis of a variety of data sets, including (but not limited to) large-scale human genetic, transcriptomic, metabolomic and proteomic data Responsibility for the  Identification of suitable data sources and data sets,  e.g. through cooperation with external institutions Cooperation with researchers from different backgrounds (biology, medicine, pharmacology, chemistry) to identify critical points in drug discovery projects and provide suitable solutions for such critical points by analyzing existing complex data sets WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE Completed doctorate or equivalent degree in bioinformatics,  statistical genetics, biostatistics or a similar field; Applicants (m/f/d) with a PhD in Life Sciences (chemistry, biology, medicine, physics, computer science) combined with a strong data science focus will also be considered First experience in the analysis of omics data and human genetics Good IT, programming and analysis skills (e.g. R, Python, bioinformatics software) High self-motivation and striving for scientific excellence as well as strong analytical thinking in connection with a  Scientific accuracy Ability to solve problems and structure  and simplify complex tasks as well as present complex issues clearly and convincingly to project teams Fluent spoken and written English The position is limited to one year.  YOUR APPLICATION This is your chance to join us in tackling the greatest global challenges of our time: maintaining people's health, feeding the world's growing population and slowing climate change. They have a voice, ideas and perspectives that we want to hear. Because our success starts with you. Be part of it!  Bayer welcomes applications from all persons regardless of ethnic origin, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, trade union membership, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other extraneous criterion under applicable law. We are committed to the principle of treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.  Location of Wuppertal-Aprath Division: Pharmaceuticals Reference code: 782627

Title: Junior Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description: Are you interested in machine learning and looking for a new challenge? Then apply now and get to know us!  Tasks Our international team develops tailor-made end-to-end solutions using machine learning for our customers. Our projects cover the entire life cycle, from the first strategy consulting to implementation.  As a Data Scientist, you are responsible for developing state-of-the-art algorithms for our customer-specific solutions You implement algorithms at scale and automate workflows to solve our customers' business problems You will work on a variety of data-related components such as data platforms, dashboards and products around data and machine learning You use your communication skills,  to work closely with our customers to analyze their problems and communicate the results effectively Benefits  HYBRID WORKING CORPORATE EVENTS JOBRAD & JOBTICKET CERTIFICATIONS We offer you an attractive salary and a competitive overall package. Regular and systematic (external and internal) training opportunities. Benefit from our team, learning resources, hackathons and more to drive your technical development and have a presence in the machine learning community. Working in a modern company with the dynamism of a start-up and the security of a corporation. In small, innovative, international teams, we drive digital change forward.  Qualifications We look forward to your university degree in computer science, business informatics, industrial engineering or another course of study with a strong quantitative background Thanks to your relevant experience in industry or the development of production systems, you have good knowledge of Python, Java, Scala, Pyspark or SQL You are familiar with the basics of statistics and machine learning and also know their applications in production  such as NLP,  recommender systems, timer series analysis and computer vision In addition, you have already had contact with data management as well as with cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud or Microsoft Azure You communicate well and happily in German and English About Machine Learning Reply: Machine Learning Reply offers tailor-made end-to-end solutions in the field of data science,  covering the entire project life cycle - from initial strategy consulting to data architecture and  From infrastructure topics to data processing and quality assurance using machine learning algorithms. Machine Learning Reply has extensive expertise in the field of data science in all key industries of the German HDAX companies. Machine Learning Reply enables its customers to successfully introduce new data-based business models and optimize existing processes and products - with a focus on open source and cloud technologies. With the Machine Learning Incubator, the company offers a program to train the next generation of decision makers, data scientists and developers.

Title: Radar Data Scientist
Description: Teraki is a multinational and multicultural Berlin-based tech company. We stand for innovation in the rapidly developing automotive domain of connected car, self-driving and world 3D mapping. Teraki enables improved Machine Learning performance through its edge processing products for Automotive (IoT) applications and enables the launch of new technologies by enabling on-sensor ML. We help our customers on the challenges that are posed by the exploding computational requirements of processing sensor data in autonomous robots and cars with different on-board sensors, cameras, RADAR systems, thus enabling wider-range access to autonomous systems. Your responsibilities: Defining and collecting training datasets Building training pipelines and real-time inference run-times (PyTorch, TensorFlow, TensorRT, Python, C++). Experience in the field of real-time and embedded systems Track and analyze the scientific literature and regulation on RADAR and LIDAR to identify relevant research questions and technical trends Develop algorithms using and improving simulation environments, eg. with sensormodels Conduct Machine Learning experiments, publish internal reports, and file patents. Communication with internal and external stakeholders What we are looking for: PhD or Master graduated in computer science, mathematics, physics or a related field. Hands-on experience with radar or camera data ideally in automotive industry, robotics or drone's domain Strong programming skills in Python. C/C++ knowledge would be an advantage Demonstrated professional and research experience in machine learning, image/signal processing, numerical optimization or computer vision Familiar with one or few areas related to signal processing such as multi-channel signal processing, RF-signals, MIMO acquisition, multi-dimensional processing, hyper-spectral images, antenna array Strong technical and nontechnical communication skills Fluent in English The position we offer gives you a chance to:  Actively contribute to the new mobility revolution and the emergence of novel data-driven automotive platforms Increase your technical know-how in hot topics of autonomous driving Experience research and development in an industrial setting Work in a vibrant startup environment and share insights within an international team Work on your own self-contained R&D project What we offer:   The chance to immerse yourself in autonomous driving, with tasks from embedded design to machine learning To work closely with world class European, Asian and American companies To work in a dynamic start-up environment in the heart of Berlin, and to share insights with an international team spread across Europe and the US To work in a small,   but highly motivated, multidisciplinary, multicultural team with flat hierarchies. Free public transport around within Berlin and free German classes

Title: Data Scientist* für den vertrauenswürdigen Einsatz von KI
Description: At Fraunhofer IAIS, around 350 employees research and develop individual solutions for the integration and analysis of data for our funding bodies and our customers from industry. Artificial intelligence, machine learning, big data, multimedia content analytics, information integration as well as enterprise modeling and analysis are the focal points of our work.  Against the background of the use of AI in all areas of our everyday lives, it is of central importance to make the use of AI trustworthy. We are concerned with questions such as: How can I judge whether AI-based lending systems do not unjustifiably discriminate against applicants? How do you get an autonomous car to comply with GDPR? How can you understand the decisions of AI-based medical diagnostic tools as a human? How can I make AI systems resilient to targeted manipulation?  Another focus of our research is the development of test methods to make the answers to these questions recognizable and comprehensible even for non-experts. Develop and research with us – with the opportunity to do a doctorate – on novel AI methods that contribute to answering these questions. Help us make a significant contribution to the development of artificial intelligence in order to significantly influence our everyday lives and the society of tomorrow.  What you do with us Development and further development of test criteria to evaluate the trustworthiness of the use of AI systems Execution of AI tests for concrete use cases Development of AI testing tools Development of methods for the trustworthy design of AI systems (e.g. procedures for XAI, robustification, uncertainty assessment, etc.) Advising clients (authorities, industrial partners, scientific institutions) on the trustworthy use of artificial intelligence Standardisation of research results Presentation of work results at conferences, workshops and industry events What you bring to the table Completed scientific university studies (master's, diploma, doctorate) in computer science, physics or mathematics with an excellent degree from a university with an international reputation,   gladly with a doctorate. In addition, applicants from related subjects (e.g.) Legal informatics in question, if you have appropriate previous knowledge or are willing to acquire it Previous knowledge in the field of data science, machine learning and artificial intelligence Ideally, you have initial professional experience in the field of data science and / or artificial intelligence Very good analytical skills,  enjoyment of abstract thinking and conceptual work High enthusiasm and resilience as well as the willingness to quickly adapt to new issues  Enjoyment of preparing complicated technical relationships for different stakeholders Strong interest in interdisciplinary issues Professional appearance Fluent German and English skills (at least level C1) What you can expect An interdisciplinary team consisting mainly of different experts in artificial intelligence and working with many interesting  external stakeholders (companies,  Authorities, associations, etc.) works together Future-oriented innovation projects in which we enter unknown territory with our customers, i.e.: a lot of creative freedom, highly creative work, cooperations with DAX 30 companies, hidden champions of German SMEs and tech start-ups Application-oriented research at the highest level within a German competence center for machine learning and the opportunity for further scientific qualification You will receive  Tailor-made soft skills and professional training The opportunity to build up a broad spectrum of competences: working at Fraunhofer means being a generalist: from project acquisition, planning and actual project implementation to the presentation of results, in different industries, from start-ups to international corporations, supervising students and a lot of contact with the university. Routine work is a foreign word for us! The opportunity to take on responsibility: Possibility of developing into a project or business unit manager, a senior researcher or a founder in cooperation with the Fraunhofer Venture Group In our institute, diversity is an important, strategic goal: We are actively committed to equal opportunities and diversity. All our employees take part in mandatory unconscious bias training We live a family-friendly culture: Sometimes the family comes first – we know that The weekly working time is 39 hours. The position can also be filled part-time. Severely disabled people will be given preference if they are equally suitable and qualified. We would like to point out that the chosen job title also includes the third gender. The Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft attaches great importance to gender-independent professional equality. Employment, remuneration and social benefits are based on the collective agreement for the public service (TVöD). In addition, Fraunhofer can grant performance- and performance-related variable remuneration components. The position is initially limited to 2 years, with the possibility of extension.  With its focus on future-relevant key technologies and on the exploitation of results in business and industry, the Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft plays a central role in the innovation process. As a guide and initiator for innovative developments and scientific excellence, it contributes to shaping our society and our future.  Have we aroused your interest? Then apply online now with your detailed application documents. We look forward to meeting you!  If you have any questions about this call, please contact: Ms. Jasmin Kröhling Recruiting Manager Phone: +49 2241 14-2636 Fraunhofer Institute for Intelligent Analysis and Information Systems IAIS www.iais.fraunhofer.de reference number: 40182 Application deadline:

Title: Genomic Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description: At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.  Genomic Data Scientist (m/f/d)  Biomedical Data Science is a group within Pharmaceuticals R&D at Bayer. Its objective is to deliver novel insights on therapeutic mechanisms and patient populations through analysis of large, complex datasets, in collaboration with internal and external partners, including world leading institutions like the BROAD institute.  Your Tasks And Responsibilities  Be responsible for the design and conduct of complex analyses to identify novel drug targets, biomarkers and other insights relevant for the translation of research projects into clinical development stages; this will cover all indication areas of Bayer pharmaceuticals, with a focus on kidney diseases and cardiomyopathies Use genome-wide association studies and rare disease genetics to systematically identify novel targets and elucidate target mechanisms Analyze a wide variety of datasets, which will include (but will not be limited to) large scale human genetic, transcriptomics, metabolomics and proteomics data Be responsible for the identification of appropriate data sources and datasets,  including for example through collaboration with external institutions Liaise and interface with researchers from diverse backgrounds (biology, medicine, pharmacology, chemistry) in order to identify critical points in drug discovery projects, and provide appropriate solutions for such critical points through analyses of available complex datasets  Who You Are  PhD or equivalent in bioinformatics, statistical genetics, biostatistics or a similar field; candidates with a PhD in life sciences (chemistry, biology, medicine, physics, informatics) combined with a strong computational focus will also be considered First experience in the analysis of omics data and human genetics Strong IT, programming and analysis skills (e.g. R, Python, bioinformatics software) High self-motivation and strive for scientific excellence as well as strong analytical thinking and scientific rigor Ability to solve problems and to structure and simplify complex tasks as  well as to present complex issues clearly and convincingly to project teams Fluent in English, both written and spoken  This is a fixed-term contract for one year.  YOUR APPLICATION  This is your opportunity to tackle the world’s biggest challenges with us: Maintaining our health, feeding growing populations and slowing the rate of climate change. You have a voice, ideas and perspectives and we want to hear them. Because our success begins with you. Be part of something big. Be Bayer.
