Title: Praktikum als Financial Data Scientist für Geldmarktdaten
Description: We offer committed and qualified students a remunerated internship as a Financial Data Scientist for money market data in our central statistics department.  Location: Frankfurt am Main Start: by arrangement Duration: three to six months Our offer We offer you the opportunity to gain insights into statistical work with microdata as well as to contribute and expand your knowledge in the field of machine learning and data science.  Within our interdisciplinary team, you will take on independent tasks in the preparation of transaction data records in the field of money market statistics (MMSR). In addition, our employees support you in processing the reporting of money market statistics.  Your profile Master's students or students with an imminent Bachelor's degree Pronounced quantitative focus, preferably on (business) mathematics, (business) informatics, economics or related courses of study Very good knowledge of R or Python desirable Ability to work in a team and independent way of working Good German and English language skills, spoken and written Willingness to start work early once a week Your application  The Deutsche Bundesbank promotes equal opportunities for women and  men. Therefore, we particularly welcome applications from women. Part-time employment is possible in principle. Severely disabled people with equal aptitude will be given preferential treatment.  Dr. Matthias Hansmann, phone 069 9566-37898, will be happy to answer your technical questions. Our career team will be happy to answer your organizational questions at praktikum@bundesbank.de.  We look forward to receiving your online application, stating the period you would like.

Title: Data Scientist (*)
Description: At DB Schenker, you are part of a global logistics network that connects the world. A network that allows you to shape your career by encouraging you to contribute and truly make a difference. With more than 76,000 colleagues worldwide, we welcome diversity and thrive on individual backgrounds, perspectives and skills. Together as one team, we are Here to move.  The Global Data Strategy & Analytics department is on a mission to turn DB Schenker into a data-driven company. Our Data Science team focuses on designing advanced analytics solutions to solve potential business use cases in logistics utilizing Machine Learning, AI techniques, Data Visualization tools and Big Data technologies in cooperation with our Software Engineering team, internal business units and global IT.  Your tasks:  Co-operate with internal business units to find use cases that potentially can be supported by data analytics and machine learning solutions Identify, gather and process required data sets Perform data analysis, communicate insights to our stakeholders and create prototypes to solve business problems Design and deploy scalable advanced analytics components in co-operation with software engineering team and internal IT departments Define key performance indicators and evaluation  techniques to measure the impact of our products  Your profile:  Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, Finance or similar Preferably a PhD in a quantitative field Several years of industrial experience in data analytics or machine learning projects Hands-on experience with SQL, Python and relevant data science libraries such as Scikit-Learn,   Keras, TensorFlow Demonstrated ability to translate business needs into quantitative analytics problems Experience in software development and deployment (Docker, Git, CI/CD) Clear and succinct verbal and written communication skills in English Passion to learn new technologies and analytical methodologies Experience in agile methods such as Kanban, Scrum or The Spotify Model  Benefits:  With seminars, trainings and further qualifications we offer our employees (m/f/d) individual and long-term   development and career opportunities on professional, project and management levels. Fascinating national and international projects and tasks such as sports and events logistics, trade fair logistics or special transports enrich the work environment. We take social responsibility for our employees (m/f/d). DB Schenker offers a comprehensive workplace health management with programs for health promotion and prevention.  Chancengleichheit und selbstbestimmte Teilhabe Schwerbehinderter und Gleichgestellter sowie eine respektvolle Zusammenarbeit sind innerhalb des DB Konzerns fest verankerte Grundsätze. Deshalb werden schwerbehinderte Bewerber bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt berücksichtigt.

Title: Junior Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description: JUNIOR DATA SCIENTIST (m/f/d) Artefact, a rapidly growing global AI and data consulting company, is looking for a talented, energetic junior data scientist to join its nascent tech team at Artefact Germany. Will that be you?  What tasks you will take on with us You will be involved in the development of DS/ML models. For most of our assignments, we create, develop or maintain data science or machine learning models. This can include: models for predicting sales, models for detecting CV products, production optimization, etc. You will gain a wide range of data science experience. You are expected to work on a few assignments per year (1-3) that will familiarize you with different industries, use cases, and technologies. You will see how your work works in practice. Unlike other companies that specialize in fancy fads, we specialize in developing solutions that can be used for years and actually make a difference for our customers. This also means that you will gain experience in dealing with customers and non-technical people. You will work with state-of-the-art tools. Our stack varies from customer to customer, but is generally very modern - for example: GCP with Terraform, DBT, GitHub Actions, Palantir Foundry. You could also do state-of-the-art research. In some specialized areas (e.g. marketing measurement), Artefact is a world leader in developing industry-leading practices, and we are still expanding strongly in these areas. What you bring You know a programming language (preferably Python, but also R, Julia, Scala, etc.). You have in-depth knowledge of data processing, data modeling, algorithms and data architecture. That's equivalent to a master's degree in data science, but we're flexible. You have excellent problem-solving skills in dealing with data and can learn quickly. You will be able to tell non-technicians about your work in English. "Nice-to-haves" We don't expect you to meet all of these requirements, but you should bring at least a few of them: You know SQL and have already done complex data manipulation. You have experience in the application of data science and AI in the real world, in production systems or with customer data. You've built predictive and predictive models, especially with tabular data. You have experience with clustering algorithms. You have already carried out several NLP projects. You do data science outside of notebooks. You are familiar with MLOps practices. You have significant software engineering skills that complement your data science skills. You have good visualization skills (dashboards, SHAP...). Why ARTEFACT? Challenging projects for large national and international customers in a wide variety of sectors. Diverse career prospects with promotions based on your personal performance - not on your length of service. Team spirit that holds us together in our daily work and is our priority. Personal development through training, coaching and exciting customer projects, also on an international level. Attractive benefits: Unlimited home office options, flexible working hours, 28 days regular vacation, 1 day birthday vacation, Christmas and New Year's Eve off, mental health initiatives, Jobrad leasing, company pension scheme, workation opportunities, free drinks/coffee/water, ... About ARTEFACT ARTEFACT is a global service company located at the interface of marketing, consulting and data science. Our more than 800 employees worldwide are breaking down business and IT silos and transforming organizations into customer-centric market leaders using digital, data and AI.  ARTEFACT offers a wide range of services from strategy to implementation that help companies gain the competitive advantage of data transformation.  If you have any questions, feel free to send us a message to leopold.mebazaa+jobs@artefact.com or michael.voelske+jobs@artefact.com.  We encourage applicants from all backgrounds and welcome you regardless of gender, origin or LGBT+ background.

Title: Modeling and Simulations Data Scientist
Description: Job Number: R0160006  Modeling and Simulations Data Scientist  The Opportunity:  Are you excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set? Are you fascinated by the possibilities presented by the IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence advances? In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open up new opportunities. As a data scientist, you can turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors — from fraud detection, to cancer research, to national intelligence — you know the answers are in the data.  On our team, you’ll use your leadership skills and data science expertise to create real-world impact. You’ll work closely with your customer to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environment to find the pieces of their information puzzle. You’ll mentor teammates, develop algorithms, write scripts, build predictive analytics, use automation, apply machine learning, and use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn that set of disparate data points into objective answers to help senior leadership within United States Army make informed decisions. You’ll provide your customer with a deep understanding of their data, what it all means, and how they can use it. Join us as we use data science for good in informing the developing plans to stabilize security.  Empower change with us.  You Have: 2+ years of experience with analyzing or visualizing data using Sequel, R, and Python 2+ years of experience with the application of advanced data analytics, including predictive modeling, data mining, and advanced operations research 2+ years of experience with analytics delivery in a consulting role Knowledge of using data science to support modeling and simulations Ability to establish and maintain small Local Area Networks TS/SCI clearance Bachelor’s degree and 5+ years of  experience with Data Science or Master’s degree and 3+ years of experience with Data Science  Nice If You Have: Experience working in the Department of Defense or the Military Experience with applying data visualization techniques to tell the story of the data and the problem and deliver the solution  Clearance:  Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.  Create Your Career:  At Booz Allen, we know the power of analytics and we’re dedicated to helping you grow as a data analysis professional. When you join Booz Allen, you’ll have the chance to: Access online and onsite training in data analysis and presentation methodologies, and tools like Hortonworks, Docker, Tableau, and Splunk Change the world with the Data Science Bowl—the world’s premier data science for social good competition Participate in partnerships with data science leaders, like our partnership with NVIDIA to deliver Deep Learning Institute (DLI) training to the federal government  You’ll have access to a wealth of training resources through our Analytics University, an online learning portal specifically geared towards data science and analytics skills, where you can access more than 5000 functional and technical courses, certifications, and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and state-of-the-art tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications that directly impact your role? You may be able to take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site boot camps, certification training, academic programs, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. We’ll help you develop the career you want as you chart your own course for success.  We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal,  state, local, or international law.

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description: At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.  Data Scientist (m/f/d)  Your Tasks And Responsibilities  Be an integral part of the Bayer Crop Protection Innovation Lab team and support farmers worldwide to qualify and quantify weed, disease, and pest problems in their fields Collaborate with designers, product managers, and other engineers to identify opportunities for leveraging data to drive business solutions Develop and operate our data lakes and meshes as highly scalable services in the cloud to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques, and business strategies Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy Design and ensure data quality and data governance standards Quality-driven software development:  writing reusable and clean code to automate our pipelines and workflows Develop guidelines and best practices through teamwork, mentoring and code reviews  Who You Are  Master of Science in Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields Deep understanding of data architectures, e.g., data lake/ mesh architectures Professional experience with technologies such as cloud (AWS, GCP), Elasticsearch, Spark,  Kafka, Dask/ Pandas, SQL and NoSQL databases Professional experience developing enterprise-grade production software using object-oriented programming languages such as Python, Java, Scala, or Go Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/ drawbacks Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions,  statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications. Experience in modern software development processes, software architecture, quality assurance, testing and CI/ CD (Git) Several years of experience with agile development models (Scrum, Kanban, XP, etc.) Passion for delivering high quality and robust solutions and learning new technologies Very good command of English, both written and spoken  YOUR APPLICATION  This is your opportunity to tackle the world’s biggest challenges with us: Maintaining our health, feeding growing populations and slowing the rate of climate change. You have a voice, ideas and perspectives and we want to hear them. Because our success begins with you. Be part of something big. Be Bayer.  Bayer welcomes applications from all individuals, regardless of race, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, union membership, religion, family status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or any unlawful criterion under applicable law. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.  Location: Leverkusen  Division: Crop Science  Reference Code: 623882

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description: At Bayer, we are visionaries and determined to overcome our planet's greatest challenges and contribute to a world where enough food and adequate medical care for all people are no longer unattainable goals. We do this with energy, curiosity and pure dedication, always learning from the people around us, expanding our mindset, improving our abilities and redefining the "impossible". There are many reasons to join us: if you are looking for a varied and meaningful professional future where you can really make a difference together with other brilliant minds, we want you on our team.  Data Scientist (m/f/d) YOUR TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES Support of business and innovation projects Applying agile data science approaches Interface management to stakeholders of the company in order to design and implement the strategy regarding digital topics Lead complex projects using advanced simulation, modeling, and machine learning techniques that integrate multi-layered data models from internal and external sources Develop and  Training of Smart Factory team employees Maintain awareness of the application of Artificial Intelligence in the Life Science and Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) / Fast-Moving-Consumer-Goods (FMCG) industry and research Create opportunities for data product development by identifying weaknesses in the business to improve efficiency Perform scaling activities to turn the data science prototype into end-to-end solutions  to convert WHAT YOU BRING WITH YOU Master's degree or comparable academic degree (PhD) First professional experience in the relevant fields of activity Knowledge in at least one of the following areas: Bayesian deep learning, probabilistic graphical network, Gaussian processes, MCMC methods and/or deep learning (RNN, GAN...) Passion for using statistical and mathematical tools Very good programming skills in Python and/or R, including the ability to analyze data Knowledge of machine learning and deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow Strong skills as a business analyst and experience in dealing with different customers Good knowledge of database, data mining and integration tools, e.g.SQL, KNIME, Trifacta, etc. Strong skills in presenting results and  the presentation of solutions for the company Ability to work in an interdisciplinary and agile environment Fluent German and written English YOUR APPLICATION This is your chance to join us in tackling the greatest global challenges of our time: maintaining people's health, feeding the world's growing population and slowing climate change. They have a voice, ideas and perspectives that we want to hear. Because our success starts with you. Be part of it!  Bayer welcomes applications from all persons regardless of ethnic origin, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, trade union membership, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other extraneous criterion under applicable law. We are committed to the principle of treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.  Location of Grenzach-Wyhlen Division: Consumer Health Reference code: 724921

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description: What we offer You will work together with a team on exciting and challenging topics in a state-of-the-art, innovative and creative environment. An intensive induction "on the job" with competent colleagues guarantees a quick entry into the independent task processing. Performance-related payment, the promotion of your personal development and professional qualification are a matter of course for us. As a family-friendly company, Evonik Industries AG has held the "audit berufundfamilie" award from the "Initiative der Gemeinnützige Hertie-Stiftung" (initiative of the non-profit Hertie Foundation) since 2009.  Learn more about Evonik directly from our employees RESPONSIBILITIES Processing of questions from the field of production and technology using methods of machine learning and statistics Development of requirements and subsequent implementation with internal and external partners in interdisciplinary teams Data consolidation, creation of mathematical models, selection and implementation of optimization methods and development of meaningful  Visualizations Contribution of ideas for the continuous development of our service offerings in our team as well as sharing of knowledge in the group-wide data science community REQUIREMENTS Successfully completed relevant university studies, also with a doctorate, or comparable knowledge in the fields of statistics and machine learning In-depth knowledge in the field of feature engineering, regression and classification methods Additional knowledge, e.g. in the field of  Computer vision, time series analysis, reinforcement learning or mathematical optimization as well as from the field of data engineering (setting up data pipelines, relational databases, Microsoft Azure, Docker) are desirable Business fluency in spoken and written English An independent way of working and strong team and communication skills Interest in interdisciplinary work in an industrial research-oriented environment, openness to new topics Willingness to  occasional business trips Your Application To ensure the fastest process of your application and to protect the environment, please apply online via our careers portal at https://careers.evonik.com Company is Evonik Operations GmbH

Title: Data Scientist - Ranking (m/f/d)
Description: Explore a new world of possibilities  At HomeToGo, we’re on a mission to make incredible accommodation easily accessible for everyone. Our team is united by a passion for travel, driven by innovation and impact, and guided by open-minded leaders at every level. Our commitment to recognizing and empowering exceptional talent is the foundation of our growth. We are actively hiring candidates from all around the world, including sponsoring visas for Germany. An amazing journey of opportunity with an international team lies ahead - join us!  Your future contribution  As a Data Scientist, you will become a key contributor to improving our most impactful machine learning models. We use machine learning to filter through our massive inventory of over 15 million vacation rentals and curate the best-suited offers for our customers. By improving and creating these ranking models, you will help millions of travelers find their perfect vacation rental.  How You’ll Add Value  Help our customers find their perfect vacation stay by showing the right offer to the right customer Help our hosts improve their listings by learning what our customers value Engineer and test clever features for our Ranking ML models Analyze A/B test results to explain outcomes and propose further iterations Seek out different ways of modeling the user funnel  You’ll be successful in this role if you  Have at least 2 years of commercial experience using machine learning to solve real-world problems Obtained an MSc or PhD, ideally in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, or another quantitative field Have previous experience analyzing behavioral user data Are proficient in Python Have experience with SQL and cloud data warehouses Have experience with Gradient Boosting models Have experience designing and analyzing A/B tests Are excited to dig deep into data to figure out the root causes and  impacts Bring a desire for continuous learning and a collaborative team-player attitude  What HomeToGo Offers  Career growth opportunities and promotions, 360° feedback and open feedback culture, mentoring opportunities from an international team of passionate, industry experts. Culture driven by our Leadership Principles : entrepreneurial, results-driven, encouraging ownership and enabling each other to succeed. Transparency about company goals, collaboration and support from an international team. Caring for the environment (proud to be a certified ClimatePartner and a climate neutral company!) as well as our employees (work-life balance, weekly yoga classes, personal training discounts, mentoring program and psychological support). Attractive benefits package, including competitive compensation, visa sponsorship and relocation support. Additional benefits include language courses, full IT support and equipment, internal workshops and training, company and team events, modern and centrally-located office, additional holidays, Travel Industry Card . Check out what your future colleagues have said about us on Glassdoor and Kununu !  Apply for this position  About Us  HomeToGo is the marketplace with the world's largest selection of vacation rentals, listing millions of offers from thousands of trusted partners, including Booking.com, Vrbo and TripAdvisor. From vacation homes, cabins, beach houses, apartments, condos, house boats, castles, farm stays and everything in between, HomeToGo combines price, destination, dates and amenities to find the perfect accommodation for any trip worldwide.  Founded in 2014, HomeToGo operates localized apps & websites in 25 countries across Europe, North America, South America, Australia and Asia-Pacific. HomeToGo also operates brands such as Agriturismo.it, AMIVAC, Casamundo, CaseVacanza.it, e-domizil, EscapadaRural, Tripping.com and Wimdu.  HomeToGo is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to hiring and nurturing exceptional talent, representing various backgrounds, perspectives and skills. We are authentically candid and open-minded, fostering a safe environment for diverse opinions. Our hiring decisions are based on qualifications, merit and business needs. We do not discriminate against race, ethnic origin, gender, sexual orientation, religion, political, ideological or religious views, disability or age.  We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce of equality and diversity at HomeToGo and to provide opportunities to everyone. We therefore welcome your application even if you aren't completely confident that your experiences fit the job description criteria. We would really love to get to know you!

Title: Data Scientist am Standort Dresden (m/w/x)
Description: Are you also fascinated by new technologies that make the world around us a better place? Our software products are used in numerous factories worldwide. Join our team and have it in your hands to improve our customers' production processes and make them more efficient through modern technologies.  Your role: Implement algorithms and workflows for mathematical modeling of metrology problems Among other things, evaluation and further development of methods for the detection of key variables, dimension reduction and anomaly detection as well as time series analyses Joint exchange and development of solutions within the team Your profile: Successfully completed studies in MINT disciplines or comparable qualification Sound knowledge of  C++ experience with algorithmic implementation and performance optimization Structured and independent way of working Curiosity and high willingness to learn Strong analytical, conceptual and creative skills with a structured and solution-oriented way of working Very good knowledge of written and spoken English Desirable: Experience with machine learning frameworks Knowledge of statistics Experience with software architecture and interface design  Experience with ticketing systems such as Jira Knowledge of C#/.NET Interest in measurement technology and evaluation of measurement data Good knowledge of spoken and written German Our innovation location in Dresden convinces with chic offices and highly motivated teams. Here you can work in a professional development environment with current technologies and a modern infrastructure.  With us you will experience the advantages of a small business - similar to a startup - in combination with those of a large company. For example, a collective agreement is binding here.  What do you mean? Do you want to experience effectiveness by repeatedly encountering products made with our software in everyday life?  Are you interested in an appreciative and close cooperation with flexible working time models and the possibility of mobile working?  Then you should definitely apply for this task!  Your ZEISS Recruiting Team: Stefan Schmid

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d) Remote Option
Description: Location: Nürnberg, DE, 90411  Job Requisition ID: 6303  Schaeffler is a dynamic global technology company and its success has been a result of its entrepreneurial spirit and long history of private ownership. Does that sound interesting to you? As a partner to all of the major automobile manufacturers, as well as key players in the aerospace and industrial sectors, we offer you many development opportunities.  General Information  We are also happy to receive applications from interested Young Professionals (m/f/d).  Your Key Responsibilities Create, deploy and operate Data Science Solutions in the context of machine lifetime analysis as part of a cross-functional, agile product team Collaborate closely with business stakeholders and condition monitoring specialists Carry out time series data analyses for the prediction of machine states Research scientific papers and apply relevant techniques to industry problems along with thorough validation of results Become a fully-committed member of a product team  which takes ownership of new AI services from literature research to model serving Become an active part of our strong Data Science Solutions department where exchange and networking beyond team borders is a welcome source of inspiration  Your Qualifications Completed degree in (business) informatics, mathematics or comparable qualification Ideally some years of professional experience in the field of statistics,  vibration analysis and time series analysis, gladly acquired through relevant internships Knowledge of signal processing, hypothesis testing, Bayesian modelling, lifetime analysis Sound knowledge of Python and relevant libraries (e. g. pandas, numpy, tf , statsmodel, scipy, scikit-learn) Understanding of basic programming principles and modern DevOps Tooling are required e. g. SQL, Git, Docker, Jenkins First experience in the creation,  deployment and operation of AI services, ideally in an API-first approach Experience with running machine learning experiments on the cloud and using AzureML services for results and artefacts traceability would be preferred, also usage of Azure Synapse analytics is plus Past experience with big data analyses will be an advantage, ideally in the context of condition monitoring Knowledge of NLP methods is a plus as well as of model maintenance (data drift/ model drift) in production would be helpful Very good knowledge of spoken and written English, German is a plus Open to new cloud technologies and data science methods and continuously striving to improve Distinct analytical competence, ability to concentrate and communication skills paired with an agile and product-oriented mindset  As a global company with employees around the world, it is important to us that we treat each other with respect and value all ideas and perspectives. By appreciating our differences, we inspire creativity and drive innovation. In this way, we contribute to sustainable value creation for our stakeholders and society as a whole. Together, we advance how the world moves.  Exciting assignments and outstanding development opportunities await you because we impact the future with innovation. We look forward to your online application.  www.schaeffler.com/careers  Your contact  Schaeffler Technologies AG & Co. KG  Kornelija Jakir  +4915151508865  Keywords: Experienced; Engineer; Full-Time; Unlimited; Information Technology & Digitalization;

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description: At Bridgestone Mobility Solutions we are looking for a Data Scientist dedicated to our line of business Webfleet.  Are you inspired to contribute to and have an impact on solving real-world, big mobility problems of today and tomorrow? As a Data Scientist in Bridgestone Data Solutions & Innovation, you will work on real products, data-based insights, leveraging and exploring hundreds of million data points, such as vehicle telemetry, fleet behavior, mobility and telematic data.  As a data scientist you are on the forefront driving business results by generating data-based insights.  By being a member of a cross functional team, which includes data scientists, data engineers, software developers and product managers, you will be responsible for building up and maintaining a steady inflow of data and making sure that exploration as well as productization of data opportunities will materialize as part of our Line of Business Data Solutions and Innovations.  Here's a little taste of your challenge: Data mining and data analyses to generate new insights and open new business opportunities; Designing a data driven / machine learning product from the bottom up. This includes defining the project goals and understanding the customer problem/journey, carving out the necessary KPIs together with stakeholders, constructing a training/validation and test set, pre-processing the data, employing a machine learning model, and bringing it into production via micro services; Proposing and steering our short- and long-term efforts to exploit new data types and sources, both internally and externally; Coordinate model implementation, monitor and refine launched products; Close collaboration with data engineers and analysts to build products and to grow our customer base.  What do we expect from you?  There is no standard data set or well-trained model that would hold instructions on how to become our new Data Scientist, but to be successful in this role, this is the kind of profile we have in mind: You have at least 4 years’ experience in building statistical models, manipulating data sets and made significant contributions to several product launches; You can utilize all kinds of data sources, such as relational databases via SQL, non-relational databases, and any kind of web interface providing structured and unstructured data in json, xml, or any other common data format; Personal must-haves: strong problem-solving skills, analytic mind, achievement orientation, sense of quality, flexible thinking and good communication skills. You are a self-driven team player with entrepreneurial touch and a passion for results; You have profound knowledge and experience with Python or any other object-oriented programming language; You have a deeper understanding and already applied various unsupervised-learning techniques, such as k-mean, Gaussian mixture models, DBSCAN, self-organized maps, or autoencoders, as well as in standard supervised learning techniques like regression, random forests, naive Bayes. In addition you have already designed deep learning models in Keras or PyTorch; You were able to gain insight into and experience with the following frameworks, standards, and software categories: Spark, Azure, or similar; You have experience visualizing and presenting data utilizing Power BI, Tableau, matplotlib, or Plotly.  What can you expect from us? The chance to work in a fast moving, innovative and international team, dealing with different countries and cultures; A company culture that likes to work hard and play hard. We like to have fun. There is no sense coming to a job everyday if you don’t like the people you work with; Decisive actions. We don’t like to wait. It’s in our DNA to move forward. So, it only makes sense that we don’t jam the company with lots of layers. We make things happen. Quickly.  Let's not forget the good stuff! An international and innovative environment; 30 annual leave days; Working remotely up to 3 days a week; Chance to work abroad for 40 working days per year; 500 euros gross to set up your home office; Birthday off and volunteering time off; Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning; Free English and German lessons; Employee Assistance Program; Support for childcare costs; 100% employer funded pension scheme; Discount on Bridgestone tyres.  Who are we?  We are Bridgestone Mobility Solutions, and we are on a mission to move the world towards a sustainable future using data-driven mobility.  The high-value products and services we develop for fleets, original equipment manufacturers and governments make travel smoother, reduce congestion, increase accessibility, improve vehicle and road safety and cut carbon emissions.  Bridgestone Mobility Solutions is a Business Unit of the Bridgestone Corporation, a global leader in tyres and rubber, present in Europe, the Americas, Australia and Africa.  Data Solutions and Innovation is one of our lines of business within Bridgestone Mobility Solutions. Leveraging big data from connected assets enriched with artificial intelligence, these solutions support our ecosystem partners. Using vehicle data, we bring valuable insights on road safety, infrastructure maintenance, traffic congestion and smart city planning.  We leverage raw anonymised data from Bridgestone and Webfleet connected assets, an ecosystem further enriched with data from third-party sources. Our goal is to become the backbone of smart mobility by 2030, providing a data-driven service B2G for smarter cities and a more sustainable future.  Want to join us?  If that’s a yes, then please apply to say hi. Complete the online form and attachments in either German or English!  Do note that online technical evaluation and pre-employment screening can be part of the selection process.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

Title: Junior Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description: *English version below*  Artefact, ein globales KI- und Datenberatungsunternehmen mit rasantem Wachstum, sucht einen talentierten, energiegeladenen Junior Data Scientisten für sein entstehendes Tech-Team bei Artefact Germany. Wirst du das sein?   Welche Aufgaben du bei uns übernimmst:  Du wirst an der Entwicklung von DS/ML-Modellen mitwirken. Bei den meisten unserer Aufträge erstellen, entwickeln oder pflegen wir Data-Science- oder Machine-Learning-Modelle. Dazu können gehören: Modelle zur Umsatzvorhersage, Modelle zur Erkennung von CV-Produkten, Produktionsoptimierung usw. Du wirst ein breites Spektrum an Data Science Erfahrung sammeln. Es wird von dir erwartet, dass du an einigen Aufträgen pro Jahr (1-3) arbeitest, die dich mit verschiedenen Branchen, Anwendungsfällen und Technologien vertraut machen. Du wirst sehen, wie sich deine Arbeit in der Praxis auswirkt. Im Gegensatz zu anderen Unternehmen, die sich auf ausgefallene Modeerscheinungen spezialisiert haben, sind wir darauf spezialisiert, Lösungen zu entwickeln, die jahrelang genutzt werden können und für unsere Kunden tatsächlich etwas bewirken. Das bedeutet auch, dass du Erfahrungen im Umgang mit Kunden und nichttechnischen Personen sammeln wirst. Du wirst mit hochmodernen Tools arbeiten. Unser Stack variiert von Kunde zu Kunde, ist aber im Allgemeinen sehr modern - zum Beispiel: GCP mit Terraform, DBT, GitHub Actions, Palantir Foundry. Du könntest auch State-of-the-Art-Forschung betreiben. In einigen spezialisierten Bereichen (z. B. Marketing Measurement) ist Artefact weltweit führend in der Entwicklung branchenführender Praktiken, und wir bauen in diesen Bereichen immer noch stark aus.   Was du mitbringst:  Du beherrschst eine Programmiersprache (vorzugsweise Python, aber auch R, Julia, Scala, usw.). Du hast fundierte Kenntnisse in Datenverarbeitung, Datenmodellierung, Algorithmen und Datenarchitektur. Das entspricht einem Master-Abschluss in Data Science, aber wir sind flexibel. Du hast exzellente Problemlösungsfähigkeiten im Umgang mit Daten und kannst schnell lernen. Du bist in der Lage, auch Nicht-Technikern in englischer Sprache von deiner Arbeit zu erzählen.   “Nice-to-haves”  Wir erwarten nicht, dass du alle diese Anforderungen erfüllst, aber du solltest zumindest ein paar davon mitbringen:  Du kennst dich mit SQL aus und hast bereits komplexe Datenmanipulationen durchgeführt. Du hast Erfahrung in der Anwendung von Data Science und KI in der realen Welt, in Produktionssystemen oder mit Kundendaten. Du hast Vorhersage- und Prognosemodelle erstellt, insbesondere mit Tabellendaten. Du hast Erfahrung mit Clustering-Algorithmen. Du hast schon einige NLP-Projekte durchgeführt. Du betreibst Data Science außerhalb von Notebooks. Du bist vertraut mit MLOps-Praktiken. Du verfügst über signifikante Software-Engineering-Fähigkeiten, die deine Data-Science-Kenntnisse ergänzen. Du hast gute Visualisierungsfähigkeiten (Dashboards, SHAP...).   Warum ARTEFACT?  Herausfordernde Projekte für große nationale und internationale Kunden den verschiedensten Bereichen. Vielfältige Karriereperspektiven mit Beförderungen, die sich an deiner persönlichen Leistung orientieren - nicht an deiner Betriebszugehörigkeit. Teamgeist, der uns in der täglichen Arbeit zusammenhält und für uns im Vordergrund steht. Persönliche Weiterentwicklung durch Trainings, Coachings und spannende Kundenprojekte, auch auf internationaler Ebene. Attraktive Benefits: Unbegrenzte Homeoffice Möglichkeit, flexible Arbeitszeiten, 28 Tage regulären Urlaub, 1 Tag Geburtstagsurlaub, Weihnachten und Silvester frei, Mental Health Initiativen, Jobrad Leasing, betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Workation Möglichkeiten, Free Drinks/Kaffee/Wasser, ...   Über ARTEFACT  ARTEFACT ist ein globales Dienstleistungsunternehmen, das an der Schnittstelle von Marketing, Beratung und Data Science angesiedelt ist. Unsere weltweit über 1000 Mitarbeiter durchbrechen Geschäfts- und IT-Silos und verwandeln Organisationen mithilfe von Digitaltechnik, Daten und KI in kundenorientierte Marktführer.  ARTEFACT bietet eine breite Palette von Dienstleistungen von der Strategie bis zur Umsetzung, die Unternehmen helfen, den Wettbewerbsvorteil der Datentransformation zu nutzen.   Wenn du Fragen hast, kannst du uns gerne eine Nachricht an leopold.mebazaa+jobs@artefact.com oder michael.voelske+jobs@artefact.com schicken.  Wir ermutigen Bewerber aus allen Bereichen und heißen dich ungeachtet deines Geschlechts, deiner Herkunft oder deines LGBT+-Hintergrunds willkommen.   ----   Artefact, a global AI and data consulting company with skyrocketing growth, is looking for a talented, energetic junior data scientist for its nascent German tech team. Will it be you?   WHO WE ARE  Artefact is a new-generation AI consulting company. For an early-career professional like you, we are the best school to learn about data science and ML in an applied business context: We are growing quickly... We have been growing enormously fast over the past few years, and want to grow by an additional factor of 4 over the next 4 years. If you join us, you will be an early member of an expanding team. … while already having a global scale. We are about 1,200 now, with a tech team of over 300, scattered across 20 offices on every continent. We have a proven track record of making people grow fast. Artefact alumni have created startups, led technical teams at companies big and small, been hired by Google and Amazon, etc.    WHAT YOU WILL DO  As a junior data scientist:  You will help develop DS/ML models. In most of our missions, we create, develop, or maintain data science or machine learning models. These can include: sales prediction models, CV product recognition models, production optimization, etc. You will gain a wide range of data science experience. You will be expected to work on a few missions a year (1-3), which will expose you to different industries, use cases, and technologies. You will see the real-world impact of your work. Unlike other companies that specialize in fancy vaporware, we specialize in building solutions that can be used for years and actually make a difference for our clients. This also means that you will get experience interacting with clients and non-technical people. You will work with cutting-edge tools. Our stack varies from client to client, but is generally very modern — for example: GCP with Terraform, DBT, GitHub Actions, Palantir Foundry. You could also develop state-of-the-art research. In some specialized areas (such as marketing measurement), Artefact is a world leader developing industry-leading practices, and we're still building heavily in these areas.   MUST-HAVE REQUIREMENTS  We will primarily judge your application on the following criteria:  You are fluent in one programming language (preferably Python, but it can be R, Julia, Scala, etc.). You have significant knowledge in data processing, data modeling, algorithms, and data architecture. That's the equivalent of a master’s in Data Science, but we're flexible. You have excellent problem-solving skills when it comes to data, and you can learn fast. You are able to talk about your work to non-technical people, in English.  We strongly prefer if you're a German resident, although we'll consider great candidates within the EU.   NICE-TO-HAVE REQUIREMENTS  We're not expecting anyone to meet all of these requirements, but you should at least meet a couple of these:  You know your way around SQL, and you've performed complex data manipulations before. You have experience applying data science and AI in the real world, in production systems or with client data. You've built forecasting and predictive models, especially with tabular data. You have experience with clustering algorithms. You've done some NLP projects. You do data science outside of notebooks. You are familiar with MLOps practices. You have significant software engineering skills to complement your data science chops. You have good visualization skills (dashboards, SHAP...).   OUR CULTURE  We are a consulting company, which is great if you want to get more exposure to business and work alongside people with very diverse skill sets. Our team is remote-first, and we don't care where you work. We would like to see you in Hamburg a few times a year, though. (Don’t hesitate to ask us about our remote policy during the interview process.) We are uncompromising on work-life balance (in a good way). Nobody at Artefact is expected to be on-call at night.   OUR BENEFITS  Very competitive compensation package, with twice-a-year bonuses. Flexible equipment options. Home office equipment (such as an external monitor) if required. 6 weeks PTO + 4 weeks of “workation” per year. Financial support for training and studies. Subsidies for mental health apps and bike leasing. Corporate pension plan. We have an excellent espresso machine in Hamburg, fwiw.  This list is specific to Germany, and might change slightly otherwise.    If you have any questions, feel free to message us at leopold.mebazaa+jobs@artefact.com or michael.voelske+jobs@artefact.com.  We encourage candidates from all backgrounds and are welcoming you regardless of gender, race, or LGBT+ background.

Title: Junior Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description: More than 11,200 stores and 200 logistics centers in 32 countries – that's Lidl. In order to continue to achieve our ambitious goals efficiently, we are looking for you to strengthen our analytics division. Here we accompany Lidl on its way to becoming a data-driven company and pilot innovative business applications in the "fail-fast approach" in close cooperation with the specialist departments (sales, purchasing, etc.). To this end, we advise them on issues and help shape global business processes. In addition, we support the countries in building up decentralized analytics competencies and exploiting international synergies through close cooperation. Make a big difference and experience that your entry is worthwhile – at Lidl's international headquarters in Neckarsulm.  Your tasks Identification of questions with the department where data science provides real financial added value for Lidl Cleansing and linking of relevant data sources as a basis for further analysis Use state-of-the-art algorithms to optimize different business processes and bring about proof-of-concept Carry out pilots together with the department to prove the functionality and added value of your models in practice  prepare for the transition to industrialization with colleagues from IT Work on projects in interdisciplinary, agile teams and regularly present new results to stakeholders and management Your profile University degree in mathematics / statistics, computer science, physics, economics, business administration or a related field Very good knowledge in the application of machine learning, optimization and data mining methods (e.g. with  Python, Spark or R) Knowledge of databases (SQL, Hadoop, Hive) Ability to understand complex questions and scenarios, to analyze them in detail and to present the findings to a non-technical audience in a comprehensible way Very good knowledge of German and ideally English skills Your advantages We attach great importance to the fact that your entry into us is worthwhile! That's why you not only benefit from above-average remuneration and all the social benefits of a large company. We recognize the diverse needs of our colleagues and develop solutions to reconcile work and private life. A personal mentor familiarizes you with your job from day one and is your contact person for all questions about the company. So you will quickly find your way around us – and so you can discover the collegial cooperation and the individual training opportunities for yourself right from the start.

Title: Junior Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description: Teaser As part of the identification, evaluation and implementation of data-based solutions, we are looking for support for the initial feasibility check, e.g. by means of data analyses and initial models (proof of concept).  In this role, you live our hybrid model "Flexible". You will work one or two fixed or flexible days on site, on the other days you can work remotely. All information can be found here.  What you can expect from us As a data scientist, you support the Data Lab team and our internal customers in ongoing projects and contribute your expertise in the field of data-driven value creation In order to gain an initial assessment of the feasibility of ideas for data products based on AI/machine learning, you will analyze the suitability of existing data You will work closely with the departments of entertainment,  Commerce & Ventures and Dating, as well as the related areas of product development, data protection and legal department You translate the requirements of the business owners into abstract algorithmic questions and create first models, evaluations and visualizations within the framework of proof of concepts Teamwork and your development are always in the foreground – you will work with our experienced team and get the necessary coaching,  to develop yourself What you bring with you You have a very good degree with a quantitative focus, e.g. data science, (business) informatics, mathematics, natural sciences You can translate a requirement of departments into a sharply defined analytical question and have the necessary communication skills in German and English You have experience with the programming language Python and basic knowledge in the field of data science  (data acquisition, explorative data analysis and visualization) and are curious to expand your knowledge You have already gained initial experience in project-related activities, e.g. through internships or working student activities What we offer you Take advantage of our wide range of training and further education opportunities offered by the ProSiebenSat.1 Academy Benefit from a high degree of flexibility and the possibility of mobile working through our hybrid working model "NWOW" (New Ways)  of working) as well as 30 vacation days per year Also work mobile from currently eleven EU countries – for up to 30 days within twelve months Actively contribute to shaping and further developing the technological future and digital transformation of ProSiebenSat.1 With us, you will work independently in cross-divisional teams with new, future-oriented technologies and actively support the introduction of new processes and systems Benefit from flat  Hierarchies, an employee-friendly working atmosphere and communicative cooperation in committed teams Binding We look forward to receiving your application!  Apply within 5 minutes via our job portal or use the video application option.  You can find out more about our application process here.  Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail for data protection reasons.  This position is to be filled at ProSiebenSat.1 Digital Data GmbH.  ProSiebenSat.1 Digital Data GmbH is a subsidiary of ProSiebenSat.1 Media SE, the leading German entertainment group with a strong e-commerce business.  With 14 free and pay TV channels, the Group reaches over 45 million TV households in Germany, Austria and Switzerland every day. ProSiebenSat.1 generates eight billion video views per month with its global online offerings. The Group's e-commerce business receives over 360 million customer interactions each year.  The generated data is systematically recorded, processed and analyzed by the experts at ProSiebenSat.1 Digital Data GmbH. By applying state-of-the-art AI methods, such as ensemble models with deep learning algorithms, computer visioning and neural networks, important insights into customer needs for the group's entertainment and e-commerce offerings are gained. The ultimate goal is to provide an innovative, exciting end-to-end entertainment experience for the individual customer across all relevant touchpoints.  Corporate text Find out here about the ProSiebenSat.1 Group based in Unterföhring near Munich and our versatile portfolio.  As a signatory of the Diversity Charter, ProSiebenSat.1 is committed to an unprejudiced working environment and actively promotes diversity and equal opportunities among employees.  You have a disability and would like to apply? Then you are very welcome to join us.  We know that we are not yet fully accessible, but we are working on it. Let's talk about how we can remove this barrier together and, if necessary, find an individual solution.  Only the masculine form is used solely for reasons of better readability. Of course, all genders are always addressed.

Title: Proteomics data scientist (m/f/d)
Description: Überblick  As one of the world’s leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker covers a broad spectrum of advanced solutions in all fields of research and development. All our systems and instruments are designed to improve safety of products, accelerate time-to-market and support industries in successfully enhancing quality of life. We’ve been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 60 years now. Today, worldwide more than 7,500 employees are working on this permanent challenge, at over 90 locations on all continents.  To complement our remote team across the globe for Proteomics Bioinformatics, we are looking for a data scientist to assist with both the development and applications of the PaSER software platform. The nature of this role requires that the ideal candidate has an exemplary understanding of data science and computational bioinformatics with direct application in proteomics. This candidate excels working under a collaborative approach both internally within the team as well as externally with key opinion leaders in the field. Furthermore, the candidate will have excellent communication skills to present scientific data to a wide range of audiences. The candidate must interact seamlessly and with a professional demeanor across a broad range of individuals including members of the Senior Management Team. Furthermore, the candidate will be expected to handle highly sensitive and confidential information, intellectual property, and institutional information while exercising professionalism and discretion. Excellent English skills are a must. We offer a diversified job in an interdisciplinary project team with flat hierarchies and short decision processes, and a secure, unlimited employment relationship in an international group with flexible working hours and a wide range of benefits.  Aufgaben/Verantwortlichkeiten  Responsibilities  Manage data science projects across internal and external stakeholders Perform large-scale proteomic data analysis on different datasets based on existing software as well as based on in-house scripts Use and develop prototype code for large-scale data analysis to solve real-world data science problems Assist in prototyping and testing new algorithms and propose bio-statistical models for algorithm improvement Benchmarking of various proteomics  software solutions Since your prototype code will be the basis for the product development you are involved in development from conception to deployment Presenting data to both internal and external stakeholders in the form of presentations, application notes, and journal publications Willingness to travel (<20%) Qualifikationen  Skills And Qualifications (The Ideal Candidate Is/has) Academic degree in proteomics with a strong emphasis on data analysis Background in either data science,  computational bioinformatics, biostatistics or equivalent Strong understanding and domain knowledge of proteomics Experience in the processing of large amounts of complex data and their statistical evaluation, ideally with machine learning methods. Good programming skills with experience in Python (other languages an asset) Enjoys networking and building collaborations with thought leaders and key customers from industry and Academia. Presentation skills to tell a data story and communicate technical concepts to customers and key opinion leaders Goal-oriented and have an entrepreneurial mindset. Enjoy working in an interdisciplinary and international team.

Description: Your profile: The practical analyst Excellent degree (at least Master's degree) in mathematics, physics, computer science, business informatics, engineering or comparable course of study You have in-depth knowledge of the Python programming language for data analysis Sovereign handling of machine learning or deep learning packages (e.g. scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Keras) You are enthusiastic about the development and practical implementation of machine learning models  in a productive environment Conceptual thinking skills paired with a high affinity for numbers and data You are familiar with agile working methods and can quickly adapt to new requirements with your hands-on mentality Fluent in German and English About this job Our travel comparison wouldn't be so innovative without our teams behind the scenes. Both operationally and strategically, you work reliably and tackle topics responsibly – the beginning of an exciting journey.  Not only does the company grow with you, but you can also grow with the company. We are looking for a responsible organizational talent who, as a Data Scientist (m/f/d) travel, enriches our team in the heart of Leipzig with his positive charisma and committed way of working.  We look forward to receiving your application as Data Scientist (m/f/d) at CHECK24 Vergleichsportal Reise GmbH!  Your tasks: Improve customer processes through artificial intelligence You are responsible for setting up a solution for AI-based handling of customer inquiries for travel Through your targeted analysis and evaluation of customer inquiries/data (e.g. via customer chat), you derive measures and recommendations for action You prepare data from various sources and develop business intelligence based on big data You use machine learning,  to derive optimization possibilities (e.g. Natural Language Processing) You bear overall responsibility from conception to release Together with your high-performing team, you work with direct contact to the management Your benefits: Start-up dynamism at the Internet pioneer We appreciate your commitment: Attractive salary package, vouchers for numerous CHECK24 products, a subsidized company pension scheme and a tax-free energy bonus for  Your work-life balance: Fair home office arrangement, more than 30 days of annual leave as well as workation (up to 2 weeks of mobile working from abroad) and individual time out (sabbatical) possible Personal growth: Individual development and further training opportunities thanks to a broad training catalog and specialized personnel development for your career path Strengthened by the day: Free lunch several times a week, free selection of drinks, a cereal bar  and fruit are a matter of course with us! We equip you: Workplace with modern equipment, including laptop of your choice, two additional screens and height-adjustable tables, is available from the first day of work Well on the road: Thanks to a subsidized job bike / eBike or job ticket as well as the excellent transport connections, you are at our central locations in no time at all We are also a great team besides work: We organize joint sports activities (football,  Yoga, back training, etc.) and celebrate legendary company and team events together!   None

Title: Data Scientist (w/m/d) Instandhaltungsprozesse und Prozessanalyse
Description: When it comes to getting millions of passengers and thousands of trains digitally on their way in the future, the best IT experts are needed. We already have 8,000, but not nearly enough. As a project manager, consultant, developer or IT architect, now is the most exciting time to join and implement groundbreaking solutions and major projects in the areas of mobility, infrastructure and logistics in a strong team.  As soon as possible, we are looking for you as Data Scientist Maintenance Processes and Process Analysis (f/m/d) for DB Netz AG in Frankfurt (Main).  Your tasks: You are responsible for the development of a standardized procedure for forecasting, planning and carrying out operational maintenance activities Your tasks include the conceptual development and testing of nationwide standards of IT use for the core processes, detailed planning and operational maintenance as well as handover to the regional implementation organization You are responsible for the further development of existing processes with regard to the order planning process,  responsible for order execution and feedback Your portfolio of tasks includes the instruction and training of regional and central multipliers as well as regular central audits You channel suggestions for improvement from users and continuously adapt the standards to the current maintenance needs as well as to changed regulatory framework conditions The piloting of the developed process with users on site as well as the development of both  smaller as well as more complex applications ( Power Apps), intelligent workflows (Power Automate) and flexible evaluations (Power BI) are also part of your tasks Your profile: You have successfully completed your technical / university studies with a focus on computer science, business informatics or similar orientation IT is your DNA and you have already gained extensive experience in the field of low code Ideally,  you have already gained know-how in the field of maintenance  can and can use your knowledge in a well-founded way You are a visionary - you can easily set up strategies and processes An analytical and structured way of thinking, communication at eye level and assertiveness are among the positive qualities of your character Benefits: We support you in your search for kindergarten places or holiday care for your children. You can also take time off to care for relatives or sabbaticals. Depending on the job, a flexible arrangement of working hours/location is possible. You get up to 16 free rides within Germany per year and other travel discounts for your friends and family. We promote flexible, individual working time models and, where operationally possible, provide support through modern forms of work such as home office or mobile working.  Equal opportunities and self-determined participation of severely disabled and peers as well as respectful cooperation are firmly anchored principles within the DB Group. For this reason, severely disabled and equivalent applicants with equal aptitude will be given preferential consideration.

Title: Data Scientist
Description: POSITION PROFILE We’re looking for a passionate and talented Data Scientist to join our rapidly growing team. In this role, you’ll have the chance to roll up your sleeves and apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across a variety of industries. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, scrappy, and communicative. You will also get the chance to travel: we have clients in New York, Paris, Stockholm, Peru… Make sure your passport is ready to go!  WHO YOU ARE. YOU: Are comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams Can distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations Are able to explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience) Have significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business  situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data; as well as a deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and are able to translate this into business implications for our clients Have strong project management skills  JOB REQUIREMENTS: Recent Master’s Degree in computer science, applied mathematics, statistics, machine learning, or other data centric disciplines with relevant internships or up to 5 years of relevant industry work experience providing advanced analytics solutions Strong record  of extracurricular activity, professional accomplishment, and leadership Additional experience in core analytic methods such as predictive modeling, customer segmentation/clustering, network analysis, supply chain optimization, etc. Fluency in at least one scripting language (e.g. Python, R) Fluency in English and German is required  WORK ENVIRONMENT: Fast-paced, intellectually intense, service-oriented environment Position is located Vienna Expect time spent traveling

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description: We are the Positive Thinking Company. We are looking for the talents of tomorrow to strengthen our experts. Join us, unleash your skills and talents and infect our community with your enthusiasm and ideas.  What is important to us? - The 3 W's: Knowledge exchange, training and further development.  Interested? Then it's getting exciting: We are on a great journey to improve the world every day. Together with our great Positive Thinkers, we face every challenge along the way with creativity and determination. The projects we tackle and the tasks we solve are opportunities to develop, learn new things and strengthen our cooperation. Are you ready to surpass yourself? Then become part of our story!  Tasks Your passion Planning, conception and realization of data science projects Performing complex data analyses Developing predictive models using modern statistical analysis methods and mathematical models Implement methods in our customers' systems for optimized control of business models and processes Modeling and data analysis tasks (e.g. forecasting, recommendation, clustering, classification, reporting) This knowledge provides  real added value for our customers. You are the link between IT and business. You design. You realize. You drive forward.  Qualification Your talent German knowledge at C1 level - mastery of the language (German Fluency is a must) Master's degree preferably in (business) computer science, (business) mathematics, statistics, physics or a comparable field of study First practical experience in the field of data science Willingness to travel within the DACH region Benefits We offer you a culture driven by our leadership principles: Entrepreneurial, results-oriented,  Promoting personal responsibility and helping each other to succeed. We create transparency about corporate goals, cooperation and support from an international team at eye level. We live exchange, team spirit and respectful interaction with each other. This connects us across hierarchies – even in the home office. In 2022, we received the kununu award "TOP Company".  What you can expect from us: Onboarding: You are internally networked from day one: Welcome Day, Hello Drink, mentoring program Development: Development is individually tailored to your strengths: Regular feedback meetings, career paths, career committees, online training catalogue, international working with different cultures Work-life balance: Space for your personal life planning (sabbatical, remote working from abroad, highly flexible working models,  Parental leave programs, 30 days vacation, holiday calendar Baden-Württemberg) Events: Professional and with fun factor (summer tech event, local afterworks, sports events, team events, Christmas parties) Networking: Connect with your colleagues: Communities, lunch breaks, internal know-how sessions Error culture: Make mistakes and test yourself: We give you the freedom to work on the latest technologies Rewards: A variety of rewards for your additional commitment Additional benefits:  Corporate benefits, job bike, company health management No candidate will meet any of these desired requirements. If your experience looks a little different and you think you can add another value to this job, let's talk about it!   Check out our PTC Spotify playlist and get a first musical impression of our team: https://open.spotify.com/playlist/44kgWZRt5jmmgppH0qGszg?si=L312ch\_9SMKsCKBcN-EB\_A But enough of us, now it's your turn - we look forward to meeting you!

Title: Junior Data Scientist (m/w/d) im Automotive Bereich
Description: Place of work: Stuttgart What you can expect: Shaping the future: You develop algorithms and prototypes with the aim of expanding the IoT in the production environment Gain insights: As a data scientist, you analyze IoT data, evaluate it and present the results in Power BI Further development: You integrate data, automation, analytics and AI solutions into the software infrastructure Maintain an overview: Standard reports are built and further developed by you What  You bring along: You have a degree, subject-related degree in the field of IT or relevant professional experience Working in Python or R does not cause you any problems, your knowledge of scikit-learn, NumPy, Keras or TensorFlow is particularly well-founded You have experience in dealing with databases such as SQL and BI tools such as Power BI As an open and committed person, you are characterized by your communication skills across all hierarchical levels Very good German  and good English skills round off your profile (at least B2) Are you looking forward to a new challenge and want to prove your talents in an innovative environment? In addition to working on promising topics within our open corporate culture, Bertrandt offers the necessary freedom to shape your own personal career.  What we can do: Intensive training In-house canteen Group-wide "networking" Free drinks Training offers Sports activities Discounts Parking spaces Public transport connections Employee events Contact: Dana Kroll Phone: +49 703465612451 Contact: Dana Kroll Phone: +49 703465612451 For over 40 years, the Bertrandt Group has been offering development solutions for the international automotive and aerospace industries as well as the mechanical and plant engineering, energy,  Medical technology and electrical industry in Europe, China and the USA. Overall, our employees stand for in-depth know-how, sustainable project solutions and a high level of customer orientation.  Junior Data Scientist (m/f/d) in the automotive sector Location: Stuttgart
