Title: Junior Data Scientist (m/f/x)
Description: Your Role:  You will play a crucial role in shaping the future of Data Science and actively contribute to the success of the digital transformation at ZEISS  As part of our rapidly growing Enterprise Data & Analytics organization within the Data Science team, you develop targeted data-driven solutions. As a growing expert, you will support the develop state-of-the-art analyses and machine learning (ML) models, and advanced analytics  You will apply your skills to a variety of problems, like time series analytics (IoT data), tabular data (e.g. sales forecasting), for example to develop ML driven predictive maintenance solutions  You will actively contribute to the exchange of knowledge within the team and the ZEISS machine learning community  You will contribute to grow projects from early  development into fully functional and operational solutions    Your Profile:  An excellent university degree (PhD is a plus) in natural science, mathematics, computer science, engineering or similar  At least 1+ years of professional experience in a data modeling, algorithm development or data science role  An understanding of data analytics and machine learning and their underlying algorithms  First experience in software development (python) and familiarity with agile software development  (git, Azure DevOps)  Strong communication, presentation, and project management skills  Fluent English and advanced German language skills    Your ZEISS Recruiting Team:  Annett Burger, Jana Spanovskaja

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description: Overview  LMI is a consultancy dedicated to powering a future-ready, high-performing government, drawing from expertise in digital and analytic solutions, logistics, and management advisory services. We deliver integrated capabilities that incorporate emerging technologies and are tailored to customers’ unique mission needs, backed by objective research and data analysis. Founded in 1961 to help the Department of Defense resolve complex logistics management challenges, LMI continues to enable growth and transformation, enhance operational readiness and resiliency, and ensure mission success for federal civilian and defense agencies.  LMI has been named a 2022 #TopWorkplace in the United States by Top Workplaces!  We are honored to be recognized as a company that values a people-centered culture, and we are grateful to our employees for making this possible!  LMI is seeking a Junior Data Scientist to support a Special Operations customer in Kelley Barracks, Germany. This position is on-site at Kelley Barracks, Germany. Responsibilities  Responsibilities may include: Work with analysts to interpret analytic results and refine analysis as needed. Collaborate with Intelligence Analysts to understand needs and devise possible solutions. Apply machine learning techniques to identify and transform data features, find hidden patterns and trends, build and optimize classifiers, create automated anomaly detection systems, and automate steps of the intelligence process. Communicate results and ideas to key decision makers, analysts and other stakeholders. Contractor shall advise on the interpretation and use of data intelligence products, quality assessments and applications. Qualifications  Qualifications Bachelors dergee in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Math, or related STEM field is required. Master’s degree is preferred 1+ years applying statistics, machine learning and analytic approaches to answer key intelligence questions, producing results and re-usable products that provide value to Intelligence Analysts. Ability to obtain an interim Top Secret clearance in a timely manner is required. TS/SCI clearance is preferred. Must be proficient with at least one programming language (Java, C++, Python, R, etc.) Proficient in Agile Development and Git Operations Demonstrated experience applying data science methods to real-world data problems Outstanding communication skills, written and verbal Highly organized and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously Team-player mentality with a positive attitude Keen attention to detail and solid analytical skills Able to articulate complex, abstract concepts concisely and effectively Languages,  Tools, and Techniques Demonstrated proficiency with Python and SQL to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets. Demonstrated proficiency in a variety of supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks. Demonstrated proficiency in advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications. Demonstrated proficiency with common data science libraries. Demonstrated proficiency visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders. Capability to recognize when Data Science can add value to an intelligence problem, and when it cannot.

Title: Data Scientist Insurance (all genders)
Description: We are one of the top addresses in the IT world and focus on optimizing our customers' core business processes. Through the smart use of tailor-made IT solutions, we support our customers in getting the most out of their business and current technologies. But we can only achieve our success through one thing: the people at adesso! They bring together ideas, technical know-how and technologies. Together we program (your) future at adesso.  Locations Berlin, Cologne, Hamburg, Stuttgart, Dortmund, Frankfurt, Munich YOUR ROLE - THIS IS WAITING FOR YOU You enjoy machine learning projects and have already gained a wide range of experience in the field of insurance?  You also like to automate things, especially ML pipelines, deployments and anything else that can be automated?  Then adesso is the right place for you!  Together with us, expand the Data Driven Insurance team into a Competence Center. In the direction of the insurance market, we are the technical spearhead for data-driven solutions and consulting services.  In your role as a data scientist, you will design and develop innovative solutions as part of our "Data Driven Insurance" team, with which we continuously generate business benefits for our insurance customers from their data.  In detail, you will take on the following tasks: You will design and implement innovative AI solutions for insurance companies with a strong focus on cloud infrastructures. You will support us in optimizing and automating existing AI solutions and thus ensure continuous improvement of the AI products of our insurance customers. You automate training and release processes of ML models and advise our customers on the selection and implementation of modern AI platforms and frameworks. You support us and our customers in the identification and implementation of innovative AI use cases as well as in the development of new data-driven business models.  Your skills - What you bring with you Successfully completed studies in computer science, business informatics or a comparable course of study with relevant relevance At least two years of relevant professional experience with a strong ML background and experience in creating, deploying and maintaining ML models in production Project experience at insurance companies Advanced knowledge of Python and the popular machine learning libraries as well as experience with  MLOps tools such as MLflow, KubeFlow or similar Experience in dealing with large amounts of data and in the use of Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, ARM) is an advantage. Enjoy working in an agile team, "out of the box" thinking and a high interest in dealing with new topics.  Our promise: You will feel comfortable with us! Collegial, familiar and at eye level – we live exchange, team spirit and respectful interaction with each other. Diversity and different perspectives are just as valued by us as you are as a person. This and much more stands for our very special sense of togetherness. For which there is even a word: adesso.  Our culture and cooperation are characterized by mutual appreciation, recognition and support. This connects us across hierarchies – even in the home office. Once again, we took 1st place in the competition "Germany's Best Employers in ICT"!. Our extensive range of training courses and a transparent career level model for everyone ensure that your development does not stand still with us. Because growing together and being a giver of opportunities is programmed in our DNA.

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description: We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our Business Intelligence team. You will support us full-time and work from our office in Munich.  How you'll be hosting with heart: You bring our pricing algorithms to the next level by combining market, competitor, and internal data. You analyse past performance and identify how we can predict demand and customer price sensitivity more accurately. You work on various other data science topics like fraud analysis, modelling business cases for new properties and many more. You share your ideas for new opportunities and collaborate closely with your team members from engineers to business analysts. What you need to shoot for the stars:  You are enthusiastic about analytics, pricing and automations to gain insights into the latest analytics tools and technology and learn how to combine them with knowledge in data science & statistics. You have at least one year of work experience in data science and are looking forward to applying your experience. You love sharing your latest insights with your colleagues in small presentations and know how to use the right charts to explain your results. You are used to writing SQL queries as well as Python code, and have used some of the common data science libraries like Pandas, PyTorch, Keras, Scikit, Pymc, etc. We're designed to stay because: Everything for our limehomies: We focus on your physical wellbeing (Urban Sports Club), to your mental wellbeing (Nilo.health), or even staycations in one of our beautiful limehomes, and many more suite benefits. Join us and find out! ;) Hybrid Office Model: We offer a flexible and empowering work environment - you can choose to work 100% from our office in Munich or partially from home and the office. Visa & Language Support: We’ll support you during your visa process and with learning German on every language level after passing your probation period. Relocation Support: We'll financially support your move to Munich if you live further away than 300km from our office. Oneteam: We are #oneteam with a transparent company culture by staying up to date with each other through team stand-ups, regular All-Hands and suite events (Summer, Wiesn, Christmas). Growth and Development: We make sure that you keep growing - through constant feedback, peer reviews and exchanges with focus on your development. Workation: You have the chance to work twice per year for a duration of up to 4 weeks from a different country in the European Union. Our limehomies love traveling so we want to give them the chance to work from inspiring new locations regularly. Sabbatical: After your 2 years anniversary with limehome we offer the possibility for a 3-month sabbatical. You can use it for whatever you want: may it be traveling, spending time with your besties or volunteering. Everything for our limehomies: We focus on your physical wellbeing (Urban Sports Club), to your mental wellbeing (Nilo.health), or even staycations in one of our beautiful limehomes, and many more suite benefits. Join us and find out! ;) Limitless learning: We offer you the possibility to choose an external development format that will help you in reaching your full potential without any limits in budget. Katja is looking forward to your application.  Who we are: limehome is “designed to stay” - a digital hotel concept. Through our Tech DNA and with our fully digital-enabled guest journey, we make stays more enjoyable for those who want to change their way of travelling, living and working. We offer high-quality and comfortable suites in more than 90 locations in Germany, Austria, Spain and the Netherlands – but this is just the beginning. Apply now to make an impact and bring the hospitality industry into the 21st century!  How we work: At limehome, we welcome innovative thinkers and big dreamers from all different cultures, every corner of the world, religion and gender, who don’t shy away from questioning the status quo. We encourage our limehomies to host with heart and shoot for the stars in a company culture that provides a better place for people to grow, have a lasting impact and fun together. Always feel free to hand in your application without a picture or information about your nationality, religion, individual background, or gender.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description: Company Description  We are an equal opportunities employer and place where everyone is welcome. We strongly encourage people from minority backgrounds, LGBTQIA+, parents, and individuals with disabilities to apply. If you need reasonable adjustments at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.  In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example - she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).  We’re one of the world’s largest privately owned real estate tech companies and a subsidiary of Axel Springer. Our mission is to unlock everyone’s perfect place! Some of Europe’s best known digital real estate marketplaces and brands form part of our Group, they are: 🇫🇷 Meilleurs Agents, 🇫🇷 Groupe SeLoger, 🇧🇪 Immoweb, 🇩🇪 Immowelt, 🇪🇸 Housell and 🇮🇱 Yad2.  We also invest in innovative business models which shape the future of how people buy, sell, rent or lend properties and hold minority participations in companies such as: 🇬🇧 PurpleBricks, 🇩🇪 Homeday, 🇺🇸 Zumper and 🇺🇸 Parcel.  Our ambition is to be the leading Employer in PropTech across Europe and this is a pivotal time to join us as we embark on this journey enabling us to help unlock everyone’s perfect place!  What We Do At Buying Selling Rental Dynamics  The Data Science team has the mission to revolutionise how people experience the real estate market. To achieve this goal, data-driven solutions and tailor-made algorithms are key. As part of the cross-functional "Buying Selling Rental Dynamics" team we work directly with our partners in Product and Tech to provide scores and predictions in various contexts.  Job Description  WE ARE LOOKING FOR AN INDIVIDUAL WHO CAN :  Effectively partner with product and engineering teams to design and build data science solutions to drive revenue growth, support interactions between our users (seekers, owners and intermediaries) and help developing a marketing mix model to support strategic decision making. Apply sophisticated statistical techniques to model user behaviour, identify causal impacts, build and benchmark metrics, and forecast future performance. Develop predictive, explanatory models and machine learning algorithms. Deploy trained model artifacts to AWS to serve ML models in production. Create automated learning systems that gracefully scale to increasing complexity and expectation. Analyse large-scale structured and unstructured data. Create ETL pipelines to get the required data in a format ready for downstream tasks. Help improve the scope of our data sets by identifying new data collection and procurement opportunities on an ongoing basis.  Qualifications  AN INDIVIDUAL WHO HAS :  MS in computer science, statistics, mathematics or similar. Two or more years of relevant work experience in the industry building and product ionising ML models and data science workflows. Experience with one or more of the following in an applied business setting: advanced statistical techniques for experimental design, observational causal inference and time series forecasting. Strong proficiency with Python and SQL and large-scale distributed systems. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to synthesise, simplify and explain complex topics to different types of audience, including executives. You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic and high energy environment and are comfortable with ambiguity. Strong creative thinking and problem-solving skills.  Additional Information  WHAT WE OFFER YOU:  We are one of the leading PropTech platforms in Europe. If you’ve ever rented or purchased a property then you may have used one of our classified portals. This is a great time to join us to help elevate our AVIV brand. 30 Days of Holidays guaranteed and the freedom to organise your day the way it fits you best. Openness for Sabbaticals. Unlimited self-development opportunities. The opportunity to work hybrid within our operating footprint with international travel to our locations in France, Belgium and Germany. The autonomy to work in a style which suits you to be the most productive The freedom to tell us which tools you need to be successful in your job so we can set you up to make it happen.

Title: Pipeline: Data Scientist (all genders)
Description: The opportunity to make a great impact with your strengths? We Offer That.  A career with growth potential? We Offer That.  A promising future? We Offer That.  Welcome to AbbVie! As part of an international company with 48,000 employees worldwide and around 3,000 employees in Germany, you will have the opportunity to work closely with us to address the health challenges of tomorrow. Do you have a passion for improving health care around the world and for using your expertise to improve patients' quality of life? In a challenging work environment that allows you to broaden and develop your own skills? You’ve found the right place!  Further develop your expertise and join our team in Wiesbaden as  Data Scientist (all genders)  Make an Impact:  The Data Scientist drives the development and delivery of advanced analyses, tools, and insights to optimize AbbVie commercial and medical initiatives.  Applies machine learning and predictive analytics with a focus on regression and linear models in Python to create new insights and real value for our business units Creates profound data visualization in Python Applies (agile) project management and proactive communication to ensure safe & sound project delivery Demonstrates understanding across a wide range of technologies, including big data,  data integration, data visualisation and analysis, software development, statistics and machine learning Develops and maintains a good understanding of business priorities, challenges and needs Effectively organises and presents project objectives and progress, clearly contributing to technical documentation and presentations Works with complex data sets, keeping focus on achieving success for our business and our patients  This Is How You Can Make a Difference  Bachelor/Master degree in  statistics, mathematics, econometrics, physics, business informatics or a similar field At least 3 years or more of work experience Experience in time series analysis, forecasting, regression and linear models Experience in statistical data analysis, concepts and methodologies and in predictive and prescriptive analytics Experience in machine learning/pattern matching or equivalent scientific field (publications in scientific journals would be considered a plus) Fluency in Python and  familiarity with packages such as scikit-learn, statsmodels, scipy and pandas. Knowledge of common data structures and ability to write efficient code in Python Ability to integrate large volumes of data from multiple data sources and conduct statistical analysis systematically Ability to communicate, present and explain results and data science concepts clearly and easy to understand Good English and German skills, verbal and in writing  What we offer you:   a diverse area of work where you can make a real difference an open company culture attractive remuneration intensive onboarding by a mentor flexible work models for a healthy work-life balance corporate health management with comprehensive health and exercise programs corporate social benefits diverse career options in an international organization high-level, attractive career development opportunities a strong international network  At AbbVie,  your individual contributions count – help us achieve more together. Be a part of it and grow with us – go above and beyond!  Sounds like the perfect career opportunity for you? We look forward to receiving your application. All you need is a complete CV – anything else will be discussed in person, where possible, if general suitability is determined.  Have questions? Email us at TalentAcquisition.de@abbvie.com – we look forward to hearing from you!  At AbbVie, we value bringing together individuals from diverse backgrounds to develop new and innovative solutions for patients. As an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. If you would like to view a copy of the company’s affirmative action plan or policy statement, please email CorpJat_ABV@abbvie.com.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description: Junior Data Scientist (Entry-level Machine Learning)  Join us to advance data science and machine learning.  ClearML is a rapidly growing open source MLOps platform that helps data science, ML engineering, and DevOps teams easily develop, orchestrate, and automate ML workflows at scale. Our frictionless, unified, end-to-end MLOps suite enables users and customers to focus on developing their ML code and automation, ensuring their work is reproducible and scalable. ClearML is trusted by brands such as NVIDIA, NetApp, Samsung, Hyundai, Bosch, Microsoft, Intel, IBM, and Philips.  Overview:  We are an open source end-to-end MLOPs platform, built by developers for developers. We're looking for a Data Science Intern (Machine Learning AI) to join our growing team. In this role, you will collaborate across our development and product teams and will have a chance to collaborate with our MLOPs experts working in the exciting areas of machine learning, deep learning, DevOps, and AI.  The ideal candidate will be a junior ML/AI Data Scientist who wants to learn how to analyze large amounts of raw information to find patterns and use them to optimize performance. You will work with our team to learn to build ML/DL data pipelines to extract valuable business insights, analyze trends, and help us make better decisions.  We expect you to be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math, and statistics, and a passion for machine learning and research. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are also required.  Responsibilities:  Research and analyze valuable data sources and automate processes Perform preprocessing of structured and unstructured data Review large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns Create predictive models and machine-learning algorithms Modify and combine different models through ensemble modeling Organize and present information using data visualization techniques Develop and suggest solutions and strategies to business challenges Work together with engineering  and product development teams to build and test ML/DL solutions stretching the entire spectrum of ML operationalization from data processing, model training, hyperparameter tuning, deployment, and model management. Support development and maintenance of data pipelines for unstructured and structured data  Requirements:  Graduate role, no experience necessary, remote opportunity Knowledge of SQL and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java, or C++ is a plus. Experience in NLP, ML Engineering, Deep Learning, or Computer Vision Experience with data science tools to support data analytics and data visualization Experience with ML/AI frameworks, e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch, or other machine learning frameworks Familiar with Kubernetes and/or perhaps similar container system Strong math and analytical skills, with good business acumen Strong communication and presentation skills Good problem-solving abilities BSc or BA degree in Computer Science,  Engineering or other relevant area; graduate degree in Data Science or other quantitative field is preferred

Title: Data Scientist (w/m/d)
Description: More than 100 million homes are in poor energetic condition. As a result, millions of tons of CO2 are emitted too much each year. This must change so that we can achieve the climate targets!  From automated energy audits to financing & grants, we will be the one-stop solution to help homeowners decarbonize their homes.  Together with you, we want to achieve the energy transition and build the leading brand for energy retrofits.  Take this exciting opportunity to join our fast-growing Climate Tech startup and become part of the success story that will sustainably improve European homes. 💚  Build something that matters, Million people will use and has a huge impact on achieving the climate targets! 🚀  We’re looking for people with an analytical and entrepreneurial mindset who enjoy having the freedom to directly own and impact parts of the baupal product.  Tasks You will work in a cross-functional development team with the mission to fully digitise the energy audit and deliver a great experience to our customers You will support the team by creating data-driven insights and by bringing data products to production, employing a wide range of data science and machine learning methods, drawing from a rich set of data You will deliver products end-to-end,  from use case generation to product delivery You will have the opportunity to build a data science team around you on a need-basis and to form a data-driven working culture You will collaborate with business and technology stakeholders to deliver value to both our customers and our company You set up data pipelines and the infrastructure around it  Requirements A minimum of three years in a professional data science work environment,  ideally with first leadership experience or the strong ambition to gain it Solid programming skills in Python and all of its data science ecosystem (pandas, scikit-learn, etc.) Solid experience and expertise of SQL Experience with a wide variety of machine learning models and techniques applied to a broad range of problems (e.g. regression, classification, forecasting, recommendation systems, NLP) An analytical mindset and the ability to analyse data and derive actionable insights from data Track record of applying data science methods to business problems in an industry context Track record of deploying and maintaining Data Science products in production You are  fluent in English, German is a real plus.  Benefits Become part of one of Europe's fastest growing climate tech startups - funded by Europe's best-known VC's We offer a very attractive salary and diverse career opportunities Take on responsibility from day one and contribute directly to helping us achieve the energy transition We offer you an exciting job with short decision-making processes and plenty of room for your personal development. Become part of a passionate, professional and friendly team while getting first-hand experience in building a world-leading tech company This role is remote-friendly A beautiful office in Berlin with a view of the Spree River, with everything your heart desires and numerous team events  All of us love to get things done and strongly believe in “done is better than perfect”.  We hope to have raised your interest and look forward to receiving your application!

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description: We are taod. We are all united by the passion for data, the desire for challenges and the enthusiasm to constantly create new solutions for our customers. This includes groundbreaking technologies and proven process models as well as experimentation and experimentation. We employ people who want to drive change.  We are experts in data and analytics who, with highly specialized knowledge and a lot of personal commitment, declare topics of digitization to be their core tasks. Whether you develop into a specialist on a professional level or want to gradually take on more project responsibility in the team is up to you. We rely on your ambitions to elicit that certain something from projects in order to achieve excellent results.  You want to experience, improve and shape the world of data together with us? Here you will find the right data analytics job for you.  Tasks As a Data Scientist (m/f/d) you are responsible for the implementation of complex analytics platforms from different industries. You will work together with data engineers and analysts in interdisciplinary teams.  Your tasks include: Assumption of responsibility in the context of big data and advanced analytics as well as predictive analytics projects Transfer of business cases into technical requirements for a wide range of application scenarios Preparation, interpretation and communication of results as well as the development and implementation of solution approaches including their presentation Cooperation with external clients and partner companies from our Cologne office or home  Office - no regular travel necessary Qualification Completed studies, training or comparable qualification Project experience in the field of machine learning/deep learning and the corresponding frameworks Knowledge of Python and relevant libraries (e.g. PyTorch, Tensorflow or Orbit) Experience with BI and visualization tools (we use Tableau and Power BI) First knowledge in dealing with relational databases and ETL processes with SQL Very good  German knowledge of spoken and written Benefits What does it mean to work at taod? We'll be happy to tell you. Work-life balance With us, you can arrange your working hours flexibly, compensate for your overtime and, depending on the situation, work from home. Together Look forward to regular team events and an open exchange with our management. By the way: we do not have a dress code. Help shape With us, you can take responsibility in an agile mindset and actively shape a growing company. Further training Through our in-house and externally tailor-made training courses, you benefit from a team of clever minds. Your health & prevention We offer the service of "doQtor" for your physical and mental health, a discounted Urban Sports membership and a company pension scheme. Office in Cologne-Ehrenfeld Team offices with height-adjustable tables, breaks on the Playstation, lots of after-work drinks on the roof terrace or a little sport at the table tennis table or in your own fitness room are just some of your options in our office.  Interested? On our career page you will find an overview of all our benefits.  Interest? Then apply now: We look forward to receiving your application. To keep it simple, we like to do without a cover letter, because we only need from you: Your current CV, your desired starting date, your salary expectations And in one sentence, what you expect from your job at taod.  If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact our HR Manager Natalie (01577-7534434).  Did you know? On our LinkedIn & Instagram profile we give you even more insights from our daily work.  Severely disabled persons with equal aptitude will be given preferential treatment.

Title: Stagiaire Data Scientist (H/F/X)
Description: CONTEXT As part of the Digital Transformation and Industry 4.0, we are looking for a Talent to support the industrial process through the development and implementation of new digital transformation tools based on Artificial Intelligence.  You will be immersed in Cartier's industrial process where your main role is to develop algorithms and solutions to solve complex problems.  HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?  Build analytical models of Machine Learning / Deep Learning that allow to answer the problem and support the production of the models Extract, organize and build the datasets necessary for modeling Formalize the problem algorithmically and work with data from 3D designs / images (Computer Vision) Prototype, deploy, evaluate and monitor model prediction performance Collaborate with technical experts and  Jobs to understand the company's problem and identify the main challenges WHAT ARE THE KEYS TO YOUR SUCCESS WITHIN OUR HOUSE?  Master in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics or equivalent Hands-on experience with machine learning algorithms (e.g. Python, R) Knowledge of ML/DL frameworks (Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy, Tensorflow, Pytorch or OpenCV) Knowledge of Cloud Computing Platforms (GCP, AWS) is an asset Database skills, SQL/NoSQL queries, knowledge of CAD software, a plus Autonomous person,  methodical, persevering, with a sense of observation and listening WHAT DO WE HAVE TO OFFER YOU?  We create an innovative and positive environment where we pride ourselves on employing talent from different backgrounds, experiences and identities. We believe that when diversity and inclusion are fully accepted and strengthened, creativity and knowledge emerge to achieve excellence. We continuously develop you through training, continuous learning and a feedback culture. It is essential for us to create this healthy and solid culture, in which you will feel entitled to give an honest opinion.  YOUR CANDIDATE JOURNEY WITH US Your application is analyzed according to the requirements of the position. If you get an interview, you will meet our Talent Acquisition Partner as well as your future manager. They will invite you to share your skills with them and get to know each other better. This will also be an opportunity for you to ask questions.  Throughout its history, Maison Cartier has distinguished itself by the commitment of each of its employees. We believe that when diversity, equity and inclusion are fully embraced, innovation and creativity emerge to deliver excellence. Regardless of visible or invisible differences, we are committed to creating an environment where everyone has an equal opportunity to reach their full potential, to be heard and to feel valued.  Starting date: March 1, 2023 or to be agreed, for a period of 6 months

Title: VIE Data Scientist – Frankfurt, M/F
Description: Your daily routine?  You are part of the Performance Steering team within Finance, primarily focus on Corporate and Institution Banking, including Securities Services.  Your first mission is to focus on leading, coordinating or contributing development of data solution for analysis and reports for performance steering, levering the available group tools.  Your second mission is to collaborate with P&L Reporting team for the accurate and timely financial analysis to monitor financial performance, on a monthly or ad-hoc basis.  Your third major challenge is to Business with Financial data required for business steering and development and coordinating the local budgeting and forecasting.  Last and not the least, you contribute to general data culture within Finance and development of data science capability within Finance.  The working environment is important!  You will join the Germany Branch Finance team, based in Frankfurt, Germany.  Germany is one of the most complete and challenging countries of BNP Paribas with all business lines represented in this Territory. Germany is considered as strategic from business point of view, therefore a strong need for Finance to provide support and add value to our business lines for their performance monitoring and development.  The Branch Finance teams are composed of 60 people based in different locations in Germany. Very international, the team is composed of more than 10 nationalities with English as main business language. The atmosphere is very good and positive with CFO and Finance managers insipring international and collaborative way of driving the teams. All ideas are welcome and listened which gives a room for innovation and inspiring for one young profile with first job experience.  The main office is situated in the Frankfurt city center with easy access by public transportation very well organized in Frankfurt.  The next steps?  The Data Science Analyst position will place you in the middle of financial dimensions and business dynamics, give you the opportunity to learn from different people the business activities, financial analysis, processes, usage of data in business steering, to develop coordination and negotiation and oral presentation, communication skills with large scope of potential areas of development going from Production activities,  performance management, projects and ad-hoc topics in the scope of Finance activities.  Why join BNP Paribas?  Our world is changing! Today, what counts in a job is to live real experiences, to learn, to share objectives and results with colleagues. In short, to chart your own path, different, responsible and sustainable. At BNP Paribas, we recruit our employees with the idea that they are looking for the world and the bank of tomorrow.  Do you want to know all the reasons to join us ? Go to: https://group.bnpparibas  What about remuneration?  It is set by Business France and can be viewed directly on their site.  Are you our next VIE?  You have a Master degree from a University or a Business or Engineering School, majoring in Data Science.  You have a solid data and financial knowledge. You have gained first experience (internships and work-study program included) of at least one year.  You speak fluent English. A knowledge of German and/or French will be a plus. You have a very good command of Business Intelligence Cognos, request and programming tools, SmartView and Thinkcell.  You demonstrate adaptability and effective communication skills. Your organization, your team spirit and your analytical ability will be assets to progress on this mission.  In a changing world, diversity, equity and inclusion are core values necessary for well-being and team performance. At BNP Paribas, we intend in welcoming and retaining all talents without distinction: this is how we shall all be building the finance of tomorrow, innovative, responsible and sustainable.  Finally, we attach particular importance to ensuring that our future employees act on a daily basis with ethical and professional responsibility.  During the recruitment process, information contained in your CV, your personal identifying information and background can be checked at all times.  VIE availability  As soon as possible for a period of 24 months.  Please, only send your resume and cover letter in English, and check that you fulfil the conditions for undertaking a V.I.E. How to get a job abroad in Germany on the Business France VIE?  Lieu principal  DE-HE-Francfort-sur-le-Main  Type d'emploi  VIE  Domaine d'activité  DATA  Niveau d%27Etudes  Master ou équivalent (> 4 ans)  Niveau d%27expérience  Au moins 1 an  Horaire  Temps plein  Langue (1)  Anglais  Langue (2)  Allemand  Langue (3)  Français

Title: Data Scientist/ Specialist In-Sensor Computing
Description: At the Fraunhofer Institute for Photonic Microsystems IPMS, we work at the highest international level on nanoelectronic, mechanical and optical components and their integration into tiny, »intelligent« components and systems. Together with industry, service companies and the public sector, we develop technologies for the future.  At the Fraunhofer Institute IPMS-ISS in Cottbus, we develop optical miniaturized systems and research hardware-related AI integration for our sensory components. To this end, we are building up a new team and continuing to expand the location in the future. Our goal: We want to make hardware-related artificial intelligence usable for mobile sensor technology.  Become part of our team and further develop the classic signal processing of sensor technology using artificial intelligence methods together with us.  What you do with us You will examine sensor networks for their performance and develop integrated sensor systems with a focus on mobile applications. Microcontrollers and FPGAs for sensor data acquisition are programmed by you and as part of the evaluation you extract the characteristics of the sensor data and information. By using learning algorithms, you can adapt the sensors to different environmental conditions. You independently create software and firmware, taking into account safety-critical properties. Shape the future with us and bring our sensor systems with AI into practical application.  What you bring to the table You have successfully completed an engineering or scientific degree and have good knowledge of software and/or system development. You have already gained initial experience with algorithms in resource-limited hardware and with sensors. Ideally, you have basic knowledge in signal analysis and processing as well as a great affinity for signal and sensor data evaluation. Are you innovative and like to think outside the box? Do you like teamwork and appreciate good cooperation? You are courageous to tackle new challenges and you can always be relied upon? Excellent! Then we look forward to receiving your application!  What you can expect Look forward to an inspiring working environment that thrives on trust, creativity and team spirit. We offer you independent tasks with creative freedom for your talents and ideas. We promote your individual development with intensive training, regular feedback meetings and individual training. In addition, we support you in balancing work and private life through flexible working hours, the possibility of location-independent work, various sports and health offers as well as other Fraunhofer programs. We combine current research work with customer projects for companies in a unique way.  Your career: challenging, varied, with the best development opportunities.  Your environment: Highly professional and innovative.  Her new employer: the Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft.  Your address for the future: Fraunhofer IPMS.  We value and promote the diversity of our employees' skills and therefore welcome all applications – regardless of age, gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion, ideology, disability as well as sexual orientation and identity. Severely disabled people will be given preference if they are equally suitable.  The weekly working time is 39 hours. The position can also be filled part-time. The position is initially limited to 2 years. Long-term cooperation is sought. Employment, remuneration and social benefits are based on the collective agreement for the public service (TVöD). In addition, Fraunhofer can grant performance- and performance-related variable remuneration components.  With its focus on future-relevant key technologies and on the exploitation of results in business and industry, the Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft plays a central role in the innovation process. As a guide and initiator for innovative developments and scientific excellence, it contributes to shaping our society and our future.  Have we aroused your interest? Then apply online now with your detailed application documents. We look forward to meeting you!  Contact Human Resources I Ms. Luisa Nütz I Phone: +49 (0)351 8823 1330 Department I Dr. Sebastian Meyer I Phone: +49 (0)351 8823 137 Fraunhofer Institute for Photonic Microsystems IPMS www.ipms.fraunhofer.de reference number: 40098

Title: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d) Shopping
Description: Your Qualifications  Master’s or Ph.D. in computer science, mathematics, or statistics At least 2 years of professional experience in the field of Statistics and Machine Learning Know-How in manipulating data sets, implementing mining techniques and building end to end ML systems Extensive knowledge of machine learning algorithms, evaluation metrics and best practices Solid programming experience (e.g.,  Python, Java) Experienced in operating Linux-based systems Strong communication and team-work skills Enjoyment of analytical, structured and data-driven work   Über diesen Job  CHECK24 is a leading tech company in Germany that offers steep career mobility, fast decision-making and a stable work environment. Online shopping is a fast-growing area, with exciting potential. Join our team and be part of our development by contributing to implement state-of-the-art Machine Learning technologies at our Munich location. This is where we need you:  You will work as a Data Scientist / Machine Learning engineer (m/f/d) in our shopping department – specifically, in Machine Learning, Automation & Business Intelligence – an area that continues to experience rapid revenue growth.  Quick decision-making, excellent resources and strong involvement in application development - working at CHECK24 offers numerous opportunities for personal and professional development. Would you like to join us? We are looking forward to your application at CHECK24 Vergleichsportal Elektronik & Haushalt GmbH.  Your Responsibilities  Be part of a cross-functional team in charge of building innovative algorithms and technologies in the area of machine learning and automation (e.g., recommender systems, information extraction, anomaly detection, asset pricing) Own end-to-end projects, from the discovery and exploration phase through the implementation of models in production with a direct impact on our customers Monitor and assess the performance of the released projects prior to and after their release.  Keep track of their business impact Participate in the engineering life-cycle, designing infrastructure, writing performant and scalable production code and working alongside our devops teams Direct communication with different teams (product, marketing, customer, sales) to ensure the highest business impact and influence business decisions by generating data-driven insights   Your Benefits  We value your commitment: Permanent contracts with an attractive and performance-oriented salary  package. Vouchers for numerous CHECK24 products, a subsidized company pension plan, subsidized company bicycle leasing and an MVV ticket are on top We support your development: Individual development and training opportunities through our strong and sustainable growth. We also support your development with professional training and regular feedback meetings Steep career opportunities: Take the path to become a specialist or develop into a manager with us Work-life balance: Possibility to work remotely from home several days per week Environment in which you will feel comfortable: Flat hierarchies and open-door policy to management. In addition, we provide you with an extensive range of drinks, fresh fruit and cereals as well as one free lunch per week We are also a great team outside of work: Numerous events to celebrate and network, as well as our legendary summer and Christmas party Excellent transport connections: Central location at the Donnersbergerbrücke in Munich   https://www.youtube.com/embed/ShMCMIyZSOs

Title: Data Scientist (w/m/d) Service Condition Monitoring Center

Design and development of CM reports for service technicians and data analysts. Design and implementation of necessary database structures such as SQL tables and data access functions. Translate requirements into suitable data analyses and visualizations in the form of interactive dashboards or HTML reports. Development of adaptive solutions for complex problems using SCRUM in an agile team.  What we are looking for Successfully completed studies in the field of (business) informatics, (economic) physics, (industrial) engineering or mechanical engineering Several years of experience in statistical analysis and programming with R, Shiny, SQL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript. Enjoyment in dealing with complex issues High degree of structured and analytical thinking skills High customer and service orientation Sound methodological knowledge with regard to mathematical-statistical procedures and data modeling Ability to work in a team and cultural understanding Good German and written English skills What we offer Access to the latest technologies and state-of-the-art development environments Flat hierarchies in a dynamic team Agile working,  e.g. in the SCRUM procedure Flexible working hours and mobile working (contractual place of work at other locations such as Schramberg possible) Creative and inspiring working environment Wide range of training courses, e.g. through online seminars or coaching-on-the-job Have we convinced you?  We look forward to receiving your online application! All our advertised positions are currently still to be filled. On our career page you will find all FAQs about your application to us.  Your contact Please send your online application to Silke Schmid. If you have any questions, please contact us at: Tel.: +49 (07422) 515-140.

Title: Data Scientist "Softwareentwicklung" (m/w/d)
Description: LKA NRW We are looking for a Data Scientist (f/m/d) in Department 41, Division 41.3 "Software Development" Reference number: 2022-Tarif-072 The classification takes place if the collective bargaining and personal requirements are met up to salary group 14 TV-L.  The phenomenon of cybercrime (CC) is subject to constant and highly dynamic change. Currently and in the future, new CC phenomena are establishing themselves again and again. Law enforcement authorities need to take up these developments quickly and respond adequately. That's why we are building up our own competencies in the areas of big data and artificial intelligence (AI) with a new team of AI experts (m/f/d).  This team will become part of the Cybercrime Competence Center of the LKA NRW. The Cybercrime Competence Center consists of investigative commissions for outstanding proceedings in the field of computer crime, the evaluation office for child pornography, the state-central ICT investigation support, telecommunications surveillance and departments for the evaluation, analysis and prevention of computer crime.  Department 41.3 designs, implements, tests and supports software solutions for the NRW police. We work with agile methods (e.g. based on Scrum). Our requirements for project staff are correspondingly agile As a data scientist, you support us in particular in the preparation of feasibility studies regarding data-based solutions and products for use in the project context as well as downstream prototyping. In addition, the development, establishment, maintenance and further development of data management are also part of the task portfolio.  We are happy to answer questions about your future activities and our department. Please feel free to contact us.  What you can expect Identification and evaluation of existing or under development products and solutions in the field of data science with relevance for use in the police sector Conducting feasibility studies and prototyping solutions for project ideas Coordinating the results of feasibility studies and prototyping with other project participants; If necessary, preparatory implementation of the solutions Development and maintenance of a coherent data management / data management system and integration of this into the overarching project work What we absolutely expect Completed scientific university degree in the field of data science, econometrics, IT security or a comparable course of study in the field of engineering or natural sciences (diploma or master's degree, DQR level 7) or relevant, proven  Professional experience of at least three years with a degree at DQR level 6 (Bachelor, Diplom (FH)) in an area relevant to the work of a data scientist Proven experience in dealing with large amounts of data and data management projects as well as relevant statistical visualization methods Proven experience in establishing, establishing, maintaining and further developing knowledge management for a task portfolio or comprehensive data storage What we want  Very good German and English skills High willingness to innovate and learn, independence Very good programming skills in the common languages (Python, R, etc.) Good knowledge of the standard software for office communication Experience in agile methods, for example Scrum In addition, you have the following competencies with the ability to work in a team Willingness to cooperate and conflict resolution High willingness to innovate and learn Independence and focus on results What we offer you Very good technical equipment Modern working environment Work mainly in the home office Good training opportunities Flexible working time models Good compatibility of  Family & career (www.buk-familienservice.de) In principle, it is possible to work part-time.  We welcome applications from individuals regardless of their gender, ethnic, cultural or social origin, age, religion, belief, disability or sexual identity.  We promote the professional development of women. Therefore, applications from women are particularly welcome. Women are given preferential consideration in accordance with the provisions of the LGG NRW and the LBG NRW, unless reasons in the person of a competitor prevail.  We endeavour to employ severely disabled persons and persons treated as such within the meaning of 2 SGB IX; applications from this group of persons are expressly welcome.  As part of the compatibility of work and family, we offer a parent-child office, childcare and suitable and reliable childcare support from BUK-Familienservice (www.buk-familienservice.de).  What else you need to know In the event of employment, SÜG NW1 requires a review of you and your wife or partner with whom you live in a marriage-like union. You may have to give your consent to this in due course.  Please note that the data required when entering the application will be temporarily stored as part of the selection process in accordance with 18 (1) of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Information on the processing of personal data by the LKA NRW for job advertisements can be found on the right (mobile view below).  Have we aroused your interest?  Then send your application by e-mail with the subject "Data Scientist (m/f/d)" and stating the reference number 2022-Tarif-072 and in a pdf file by 05.02.2023 to za21BewerbungFuest.LKA [at] polizei.nrw.derel="nofollow".  Please attach this to your application: Cover letter Curriculum vitae School and vocational qualifications Employment references Certificates of further education and training We would like to point out that the receipt of the application by the LKA NRW is decisive for compliance with the above-mentioned deadline. The submission of the original evidence may be expected at a later date. Missing evidence will not be requested. The submitted application documents apply.  Your contact persons For technical questions about the advertised positions: Mr. Kahr Tel. +49 211 939-4130 (Head of Department 41.3), E-Mail: robert.kahr [at] polizei.nrw.de Mr. Siebenlist Tel. +49 211 939-4131 (Deputy Head of Department 41.3), E-Mail: tobias.siebenlist [at] polizei.nrw.de.  We look forward to receiving your application.  1Security Review Act North Rhine-Westphalia of 23.02.2022

Title: Data Scientist Supply Chain

Title: Data Scientist – Vehicle Occupant Monitoring (m/f/d)
Description: At CARIAD, it’s our mission to transform automotive mobility for everyone, everywhere, making it safer, more sustainable, and more comfortable in every way.  To deliver on that promise, we’re building a unified technology and software platform, including a vehicle OS and cloud platform, as well as a unified architecture. As a 100% subsidiary of the Volkswagen Group, we’re developing solutions for all of its brands, including Volkswagen, Audi, and Porsche, and will bring our software to over 40 million vehicles by 2030.  Is this an easy task? Not at all! To tackle such a huge challenge, we need a great team. And that’s where you come in. You’ll join more than 5,000 CARIDIANS already working on the latest vehicle features and functions like automated driving, state-of-the-art charging technology, as well as a new digital ecosystem. Together, we’re bringing sustainable change to one of the largest companies in the world.  YOUR TEAMThe fuel of digitalization is data and information. Knowledge about the occupants is the basis for data driven features and business within an car.  We support the laws by monitoring if the driver is tired, unattended and much more parameters.  We increase safety by giving occupant status to assisted driving functions, restraint systems, etc.  We increase comfort and well-beeing by monitoring physiological data of the occupants.  We increase fun by supporting innovative new features for future cars.  Our home is the field of assisted (ADAS) and autonomous driving (ADAP) and our passion includes the whole interior monitoring.  We are working in agile teams focused on driver/occupant monitoring, driver/occupant behavior and physiological status of the occupants.  We are proud of our team spirit and innovative atmosphere and we are driven by the idea to create the future of interior data use.  #NextGenDriverAssistance  What You Will Do  Investigate interior data and analyze the underlying metadata, logic and data lineage Generate new and innovative information ouf of the collected data Agile implementation of data-driven use cases with the right and correct information on how and what data should be used Work closely with the agile teams of the agile release train occupant monitoring  Who You Are  Successfully graduated your studies in the fields of data science,  computer science, mathematics, information technology or related field. working experience in the field of data science, biological or medical digitalization, Strong analytical and conceptional skills Experience in SAFe Innovative mindset Fluent english skills (german is a plus) SAFe Certificates (e.g., Scrum Master) is a plus  NICE TO KNOW  Remote work options Temporary work from abroad in selected countries Flextime / optional working hours Company pension plan Annual professional development Sabbatical option up to 6 months 30 days paid + 10 days unpaid leave  Possibility for VW Group car leasing If you have further questions about the candidate journey at Cariad, talk to Cari, our Cariad Chatbot. Can’t see it? Check your settings or visit our FAQ

Competence Center, actuarial services/controlling, etc.)  What distinguishes you: You have a master's degree in a course of study with a statistical-analytical focus. Title: Junior Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description: We are taod. We employ open-minded, curious and committed people who shape and advance our company through their personalities. What unites us all is the passion for data, the desire for challenges and the enthusiasm to always create new solutions for our customers. This includes groundbreaking technologies and proven process models as well as experimentation and experimentation.  As a junior, you will have the opportunity to get started ambitiously and as quickly as possible. You already have relevant professional experience in your field and want to go directly into medias res, because you are not only familiar with data, but also with processes and structures.
