You will work in interdisciplinary teams consisting of data engineers, analysts and scientists and regularly exchange ideas with the specialist departments of our clients.  Your tasks are: Assumption of responsibility in the context of big data, advanced analytics and predictive analytics projects Application of machine learning in big data and cloud context with tools such as Apache Spark, Databricks or Azure Machine Learning Studio Finding, merging and analyzing large and/or unstructured data sources Understanding and translating business cases into technical requirements for a wide range of application scenarios  Preparation, interpretation and communication of results as well as the development and implementation of solution approaches including their presentation Qualification Completed training, studies or comparable qualification First relevant professional experience in the form of working student activities, internships or similar Enthusiasm for working with machine learning algorithms in the cloud environment Knowledge of programming languages, such as Python High affinity for numbers and complex  Data structures Very good knowledge of German, spoken and written Benefits What does it mean to work at taod? We'll be happy to tell you. Work-life balance With us, you can arrange your working hours flexibly, compensate for your overtime and, depending on the situation, work from home. Together Look forward to regular team events and an open exchange with our management. By the way: we do not have a dress code. Help shape With us, you can take responsibility in an agile mindset and actively shape a growing company. Further training Through our in-house and externally tailor-made training courses, you benefit from a team of clever minds. Your health & prevention We offer the service of "doQtor" for your physical and mental health, a discounted Urban Sports membership and a company pension scheme. Office in Cologne-Ehrenfeld Team offices with height-adjustable tables, breaks on the Playstation, lots of after-work drinks on the roof terrace or a little sport at the table tennis table or in your own fitness room are just some of your options in our office.  Interested? On our career page you will find an overview of all our benefits.  Interest? Then apply now: We look forward to receiving your application. In order to keep it simple, we are happy to do without a cover letter, because we only need from you: Your current CV, your desired starting date And in one sentence, what you expect from your job at taod.  If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact our HR Manager Natalie (01577-7534434).  Did you know? On our Instagram profile we give you even more insights from our daily work.  Severely disabled persons with equal aptitude will be given preferential treatment.

Title: Data steward/data scientist au centre de compétences accompagnant les processus transition numérique
Description: Agriculture and food: do your bit!  Multiple use of data in the agriculture and agri-food sectors The new competence centre that will be created to support the processes of the digital transition in the agriculture and agri-food sectors will be responsible for deploying the multiple use of data throughout the sector. The competence centre will be responsible for the development, implementation and standardisation of data strategy, governance and data in collaboration with a large number of interest groups from the agricultural and agri-food sectors and various federal services, cantons and private sector actors. One of the central tasks of the Competence Centre will be to coordinate all this large-scale work among so many stakeholders.  The idea of creating a competence centre and its implementation stem from the report "Digitalisation in agriculture. Role of the Confederation » Link to the report: https://www.parlament.ch/centers/eparl/curia/2019/20193988/Bericht%20BR%20F.pdf.  Your tasks Actively participate in the establishment of the competence center for digital transition processes Develop strategies and conceptual bases for data management in the agriculture and agri-food sectors Plan and lead ambitious and cross-cutting pilot projects for data harmonization and standardization in order to generalize the multiple use of data in the agriculture and agri-food sectors (implementation of the principle  once-only) Assume responsibility for the development and maintenance of data catalogues in the agriculture and agri-food sectors Organize and maintain exchanges with various interest groups in the agriculture and agri-food sectors, coordinate professional events and answer questions related to data management, standardization and governance Your profile University degree in natural sciences,  with specialization in data science Team spirit, willingness to develop solutions to enable multiple use of data in the food and agri-food sectors Skills in data management and standardization as well as in the creation of data catalogs Digital project management skills Good knowledge of two official languages and English Additional information For more information,  please contact Mr Cédric Moullet, Head of the Digital Transition and Data Management Management Unit, tel.: 058 465 39 59, cedric.moullet@blw.admin.ch or Ms Daniela Trokan, Personnel Sector, HR Advisor, tel.: 058 460 81 32, daniela.trokan@blw.admin.ch.  The position is of limited duration until December 31, 2025.  Reference Number: JRQ$540-3677 About Us The Federal Office for Agriculture (FOAG) is the Confederation's centre of excellence for the agricultural sector. It is responsible for implementing agricultural policy, preparing its future development and, with the help of Agroscope (Federal Agricultural Research Station), carrying out research in the interest of a sustainable agricultural and agri-food economy.  The federal administration is attentive to the different life paths and needs of its employees and promotes their diversity. It gives the highest priority to equal treatment.

Title: Data Scientist (M/W/D)
Description: We are the Positive Thinking Company. We are looking for your talent and passion to strengthen our Data & Analytics experts. Join us, unleash your skills and talents and infect our community with your enthusiasm and ideas. What is important to us?  The 3 W's: Knowledge exchange, training and further development. Interested? Then it's getting exciting: Tasks Your passion Responsibility for the planning, conception and implementation of data science projects Carrying out complex data analyses Developing predictive models using modern statistical analysis methods and mathematical models Implementing methods in our customers' systems for optimized control of business models and processes Modeling and data analysis tasks (e.g. forecasting, recommendation,   Clustering, Classification, Reporting) This knowledge offers our customers real added value. You are the link between IT and business. You design. You realize. You drive forward.  Qualification Your talent Degree preferably in (business) computer science, (business) mathematics, statistics, physics or a comparable field of study Experience in the field of data science Fluent in German and English Willingness to travel within the DACH region Benefits Your community With us, you will join a dynamic, experienced team of other dedicated and passionate data and analytics specialists. We always want to go to our limits in order to develop the best solutions together, as a positive thinking company.  Every day you will work with inspiring colleagues from our diverse domains. You will work with personalities such as division managers, project managers, product owners, developers, business analysts and sales. Our community is diverse: We bring different backgrounds and combine our creative ideas and skills to learn from each other.  Right from the start, you will be immersed in a culture of creativity, fun and collaboration. We learn from mistakes in order to inspire our innovative strength.  Our promise We offer you a culture that is driven by our leadership principles: entrepreneurial, results-oriented, personal responsibility and helping each other to succeed. We create transparency about corporate goals, cooperation and support from an international team at eye level. We live exchange, team spirit and respectful interaction with each other. This connects us across hierarchies – even in the home office. In 2022, we received the kununu award "TOP Company".  What you can expect from us: Onboarding: You are internally networked from day one: Welcome Day, Hello Drink, mentoring program Development: Development is individually tailored to your strengths: Regular feedback meetings, career paths, career committees, online training catalogue, international working with different cultures Work-life balance: Space for your personal life planning (sabbatical, remote working from abroad,  highly flexible working models,  Parental leave programs, 30 days vacation, holiday calendar Baden-Württemberg) Events: Professional and with fun factor (summer tech event, local afterworks, sports events, team events, Christmas parties) Networking: Connect with your colleagues: Communities, lunch breaks, internal know-how sessions Error culture: Make mistakes and test yourself: We give you the freedom to work on the latest technologies Rewards:  A variety of rewards for your additional commitment Additional benefits:  Digital mobility budget, corporate benefits, job bike, company health management Neither candidate will meet any of these desired requirements. If your experience looks a little different and you think you can add another value to this job, let's talk about it!  But enough of us, now it's your turn!

Title: Data Scientist* in der Produktion mit Promotionsabsicht
Description: In the "Production Quality" department of the Fraunhofer IPT, we accompany companies on their way to climate- and resource-efficient production. In our research and industrial projects, we therefore place a special focus on the end-to-end digitization and networking of production as well as the targeted evaluation of production data.  As a data scientist*, you and your colleagues ensure that the production environment of our clients is sustainably improved through cross-domain, data-based solutions.  What you do with us Linking heterogeneous data sources as well as integration and preparation of production data for analysis purposes Creation of machine learning and artificial intelligence models to optimize production processes, e.g. to increase product quality or to detect process anomalies Implementation of the model results in the production environments of our customers with the aim of providing information and decision support Technical  Implementation of the digital twin based on  process and product data, simulations and models Acquisition, coordination and processing of national and international industrial and research projects in a team Conception and implementation of workshops and seminars for specialists and executives from industry and research What you bring with you Successfully completed scientific university studies (Master, Diploma) in the field of computer science, data science,  computational  Engineering Science (CES), mechanical engineering or a comparable engineering discipline Knowledge of common programming languages (e.g. Python) Experience in dealing with relevant software libraries, e.g. Scikit-Learn, Keras, PyTorch, TensorFlow Enthusiasm for applied research and interest in helping shape digital transformation in production Enjoy interdisciplinary team and project work An independent way of working as well as analytical  Skills Very good German and written and  spoken English What you can expect A collegial team and freedom to implement your own ideas Participation in highly innovative research and development projects with well-known industrial partners from a wide range of industries State-of-the-art machinery, equipped with edge cloud systems and a 5G infrastructure Excellent professional and personal development through a variety of internal training programs  Opportunity to do a doctorate at RWTH Aachen University in a self-developed topic  Flexible working hours based on trust, home office and various support services for reconciling private life, family and career Excellent prospects for attractive career opportunities in industry and research Diversity is an important strategic goal at our institute: We are actively committed to equal opportunities and diversity, starting with diversity training for all  Employees Our declared goal is to sustainably increase the proportion of women in science. Young professionals and scientists can participate in the "Fraunhofer TALENTA" career program and take advantage of qualification offers as well as the necessary freedom for their own professional development and further qualification.  We value and promote the diversity of our employees' skills and therefore welcome all applications – regardless of age, gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion, ideology, disability as well as sexual orientation and identity. Severely disabled people will be given preference if they are equally suitable.  The position is initially limited to 2 years. There is the possibility of extension.  The weekly working time is 39 hours. The position can also be filled part-time. Employment, remuneration and social benefits are based on the collective agreement for the public service (TVöD). In addition, Fraunhofer can grant performance- and performance-related variable remuneration components.  With its focus on future-relevant key technologies and on the exploitation of results in business and industry, the Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft plays a central role in the innovation process. As a guide and initiator for innovative developments and scientific excellence, it contributes to shaping our society and our future.  Have we aroused your interest? Then apply online now with your detailed application documents. We look forward to meeting you!  If you have any questions about this position, please contact: Dennis Grunert M.Sc.  Head of Production Quality Phone: +49 241 8904-376 Fraunhofer Institute for Production Technology IPT www.ipt.fraunhofer.de reference number: 37162 Application deadline:

Title: ML Data Scientist (m/w/x) Vollzeit
Description: Are you a passionate data scientist and want to actively shape the environmentally friendly agriculture of tomorrow?  You have a strong technical background, are committed to implementation and work independently in a team? Then you've come to the right place!  For you, the backend is too far away and ML Ops is a foreign word? Then this is unfortunately not the right place for you.  You fit perfectly into our team if you: actively clear ambiguities out of the way, question solutions together in the team, skilfully overcome hurdles, implement new findings properly and comprehensively based on your own ideas.  Do you find yourself again? Then write us directly and convince your new team that you don't do things by halves.  Learn more about us and our product: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=frd5-hKiHhs tasks As a data scientist with a passion for machine learning and the urge for automation, you will work independently on the further development of SAM-DIMENSION's image recognition pipeline. You will take responsibility for improving, expanding and maintaining the end-to-end evaluation pipeline. The focus is on the scalability, robustness and accuracy of results of the process flow. You are actively involved in the development and product roadmap and derive tasks of the tech team from weaknesses in the process flow. Your independent work and flexible working hours allow you to organize your workflow yourself. Through the direct exchange within the team, upcoming to-dos are determined jointly and transparently.  Qualification Evergreens: Python, TF, PyTorch, Linux, Git, AWS (not a must, but very advantageous) Experience in image processing and artificial intelligence (AI) Experience in dealing with gigantic amounts of data Experience with management tools in software development Experience with horizontal and vertical scaling Fluent spoken and written English Bonus points are: Basics in languages and frameworks of front- and backend (HTML,  CSS, JavaScript, NodeJS, ExpressJS, Django) agricultural background Benefits A young, international team of strong characters, where every voice counts Regular team events ensure a three-dimensional exchange of remote teams and strengthen our cohesion We attach great importance to further education and promote it individually Start-up mentality with secured financing Remuneration: €45k - €55k What we value: An appreciative,  respectful and open interaction with each other is the basis of our cooperation. We know technical obstacles and impassability in detail and never lose sight of our goal when finding solutions. We understand in detail what we do and do everything we can to achieve it together step by step. We are focused on achieving the next goals. We appreciate the flexibility of remote work, but a personal exchange is just as important to us to strengthen team spirit.

Title: Data Scientist
Description: JustWatch offers data-driven movie marketing for the film industry. Based on user data from justwatch.com and our apps - now the largest streaming guide worldwide - we run data-driven digital marketing campaigns for Hollywood’s latest blockbusters, most popular shows as well as independent movies. We are also building a new proxy that measures movies and tv show success: we are seeking to create a new industry standard combining modern methods of measurement and machine learning.  Who We Are Looking For  We are looking for someone that shares our passion for movies and tv shows, with a result-driven mindset, that is able to effectively communicate complex topics to non-technical audiences, and with extensive knowledge in the field of predictive analytics.  We love challenging goals. We question everything. We are always learning, and we are excellent in execution. We believe in the 80/20 rule and try to apply common sense and pragmatism to everything.  Here's What You Will Do Develop and iterate a model that uses extensive survey data to predict how many streamers will actually watch the movie or show in the end Help develop an extensive benchmarking system for our surveys that spans multiple platforms and employ statistical methods to gain insights from survey results Make sure we gather the right data points needed to achieve this and assist our survey team to improve their process Develop reports with visualization, summarize findings, and communicate with the stakeholders  What You Will Need Passion for movies and tv shows and eagerness to build a predictive model to forecast the performance of movies & tv shows on streaming services Solid knowledge of statistics e.g. population vs sample, credible interval vs confidence interval, bootstrapping, hypothesis testing Hands-on experience with data modeling/prediction techniques and tools:   Techniques: unsupervised and supervised Machine Learning, including clustering methods, predictive models, outlier detection, sentiment analysis, and recommender systems Languages: Python ML and Visualisation: sklearn, XGboost, pandas, AUTOML, Plotly, Altair, Seaborn Model Explainability: SHAP, Explainerdashboard, EVALM Interest in gathering insights from historical data and passion for predicting the future from this data in general Ability to apply data cleaning,   feature engineering, statistics, machine learning, and common sense to predict future behavior Readiness and curiosity to learn new tools and methods Team player mindset. You enjoy working with talented and inspiring people. Ability to cope with imperfect data sets Excellent English communication skills, with the ability to synthesize, simplify and explain complex topics to different types of audiences  If you feel like you are missing some of the hard skills – don’t worry, we are hiring for the attitude, values, and personality.  We embrace our entrepreneurial responsibilities. Through our 6-figure environmental and social impact budget, we offset every employee’s carbon footprint, give back to the community, support causes that matter, and have recently implemented a wellbeing and mental health programme.  Read more about our culture in our blog post and Talent page:https://www.justwatch.com/de/Talent  __How to apply:  Show your interest in any way that works for you, we simplified the application process - send us whatever you have or just your Linkedin and a message explaining why you are a great fit for this role. We won’t look at one-click applications.

Title: Senior (Wirtschafts-) Mathematiker:in / Data Scientist / Aktuar:in
Description: Your tasks Development of actuarial controlling from actuarial benchmarking, pricing models to profitability deep dives Interface to many relevant areas and participation in selected projects, e.g. impact of inflation Advancing and rethinking traditional and emerging pricing topics Cooperation and collaboration in cross-functional and agile teams for pricing and product development Independent and target group-oriented presentation of the  Results Your profile Completed studies with a focus on (economic) mathematics Ideally completed training as an actuary (DAV) Professional experience in the actuarial environment in composite insurance or consulting Interest in data science and programming Ability to reduce - present complex results easily Communicative – enjoy exchanging ideas with other experts and stakeholders Team player – enjoy cooperation and team development  A sense of responsibility and an eye for detail Be You!  We focus on people. We live a corporate culture of openness and appreciation and guarantee equal opportunities for all employees and candidates. In this way, we create an environment in which personal potential can be developed in the best possible way.  Company HDI AG Place of Work Hanover Contact Claudia Goldschmidt Job ID 12011 Start date flexible Type of employment Full/part-time (up to 38 hours) unlimited

Title: Data Scientist - Commercial (x/f/m)
Description: The Role  At SellerX we are growing our Commercial Unit and now we are looking for a Data Scientist - Commercial (x/f/m) to join our team. In this role you will help us to build and test data models, and create effective methodologies to enable precise pricing and demand planning for all our brands at SellerX. You will report to the Head of Pricing and Planning with dotted line to the Data Analytics Team. Sounds exciting? Apply today!  Key Responsibilities  Apply data modeling techniques with Python and SQL to develop and optimize current planning/pricing models for all our portfolio selection Level up our pricing and forecasting methodologies, accuracy, rules and processes and our current tool set Challenge assumptions and propose solutions to further scale and automate the processes Launch real time tests and measure impact of pricing/promotion strategies on sales,   profitability and product rankings Collaborate cross-functional with teams in commercial, supply chain, operations and finance to determine constraints and goals to feed into the model Lead one-off analysis for our leadership team (CCO / CEO)  Your Background  To join our team, you bring along  Hands on experience applying statistics in planning, pricing, analytics, plus very good commercial and business understanding Experience in building operational optimization models and algorithms in  Python and/or other programming languages for large datasets. Proficiency in Python and SQL Strong Excel capabilities (incl. Power Pivot and Power Query), Power BI is a plus Educational background in Engineering, Computer and/or Data Science, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering or equivalent experience and evidence of exceptional ability Very good stakeholder management and the ability to deliver solutions to business requirements  Sounds exciting but you're not sure if you tick all the boxes? We are always happy to read your application and hear your story. Everyone's talent is unique!  Who Are We?  We are SellerX and have an ambitious goal: To become a leading global acquirer and operator of a new generation of eCommerce businesses. We are one of Europe’s fastest growing start-ups and have raised $750M from top-tier VC and PE funds, including L Catterton, 83North, Cherry Ventures, Felix Capital, Sofina, Victory Park Capital and BlackRock towards this goal. Within 15 months, we have grown to a team of 750 talents and operating 10 offices across Europe, APAC, and the US.  Our founders are serial entrepreneurs and Harvard Business School graduates who have 12+ years of experience in eCommerce and private equity. Senior Management consists of top Amazon, eCommerce, and investment professionals. We are looking for you, knowing that our company will only be as good as the team we build!  At SellerX we value a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we believe it is the key to innovation and happy employees. SellerX is committed to providing an open, friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for every employee. We are delighted to receive applications from diverse candidates including gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, and religious beliefs  SellerX does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our job’s alias, SellerX employees or any other organization location. SellerX will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description: Data Scientist wanted in Wiener Neudorf (m/f/d) Are you looking for an exciting, new challenge as a Data Scientist in the Vienna area and really want to make a difference with your knowledge in the areas of statistics, probability and econometrics?  Would you like to develop further in technology with Python and SQL and bring your own models and forecasts to the company?  This is exactly what my customer, one of the largest logistics and forwarding companies in Austria, offers you, as well as many other benefits! As a Data Scientist (m/f/d) in Wiener Neudorf, you will work with a professional team of currently 4 Senior Scientists and use your expertise to ensure massive progress in the team's forecasts.  Your benefits A competitive annual gross salary from € 60,000,-. Depending on qualifications and experience, the salary can also be agreed to be significantly higher A sixth week of vacation that can be used up by the hour Home Office 50% Free parking or free shuttle service from U4 Meidlinger Hauptstraße or Vienna Hbf to Wiener Neudorf (departure times: 7:00/7:20 and return time 16:55) Interesting, varied projects with modern technologies Company laptop with free choice of technology Your profile Graduate of Operations  Research, Machine Learning, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Economics, Financial Mathematics Experience with Probabilistic Machine Learning, Stochastic Optimisation, Forecasting, Reinforcement Learning / Bandits Very good knowledge of statistics and mathematics Familiar with programming languages Python, SQL and safe handling of databases Interdisciplinary thinking and working, self-motivation and innovative strength Result orientation,  Strong communication skills and the ability to convey complex topics easily Good knowledge of German (min. B2) and fluent English (min. C1) Your tasks Support in the conception, implementation and co-responsibility of innovative and data-driven projects Conducting research & development with a special focus on machine learning and statistical modeling Assistance in the conception and implementation of optimization problems Extract, transform and process  Data for data-driven projects Creating and communicating analyses, insights and visualizations in the team and for our management Accompaniment of the transfer and operationalization of your research results into our software landscape Transfer of knowledge and know-how to younger colleagues Does that sound interesting to you?  Apply as a Data Scientist (m/f/d) in Wiener Neudorf for more information. Please send your CV to c.pfannhauser[at]computerfutures.at.  If you have any questions, please feel free to call me at +43 1 395 071 539. I'm looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description: As a Data Scientist (m/f/d), you will analyze and evaluate existing databases in order to create new knowledge and make the best possible decisions for payment tools. At the point where others lose track, you really warm up. For you, big data is not a collection of hieroglyphics, but a melting pot of valuable information to achieve goals.  Modern payment methods are something wonderful. Apple Pay, PayPal, credit card - the list of payment options is long. But unfortunately, this leads to pain for consumers and retailers. You know that.  We, Paymenttools, are a start-up of REWE Group and want to clean up payment transactions in Europe. And later throughout the solar system. In other words, #wesolvepayn.  You deliver a value contribution: As a data scientist, you drive the automation processes of our system landscape. Even in data chaos, you keep a cool head and know how to structure, cluster and evaluate the data. You use scientific methods, algorithms and state-of-the-art digital tools to find the needle in the data haystack.  Tasks Your tasks The responsibility for the development and further development of e.g. forecasts, segmentations, analyses, ML/AI algorithms and decision engines is in your hands You participate in the joint development of our big data and analytics architecture of tailor-made products in close cooperation with interdisciplinary teams You analyze large amounts of data with state-of-the-art data science methods and approaches such as classification,   Clustering and pattern search You always have the big picture in view: You take over the visualization of existing programs and dedicate yourself to the automation of existing processes Check data, derive hypotheses and verify hypotheses are the alpha and omega for you, while you always critically question the status quo You will accompany projects throughout their entire life cycle:  from the creation of a use case to the development of a proof-of-concept to  Production phase and handover You analyze data from many different sources and systems in order to prepare them You develop your own machine learning models Qualification Your experience You have a degree in computer science, data science, mathematics or physics You are fundamentally familiar with coding,  know how to adapt data models and algorithms as well as create and understand various problem and solution cluster forecasts,  Regression and linear models, neural networks, and statistical tests are your allies Programming is your passion: Your heart beats faster with R and Python You have already worked with frameworks such as tidyverse, ggplot, scikit-learn, pytorch,  or Jupyter You understand the requirements of different parties to be able to help them with the data and can also bring your solution to people who do not come from the data sector You know big data  Tools and cloud technologies and live out technical innovation. With regard to new technologies and developments, you are always up to date You have a sound knowledge of SQL and relational databases as well as advanced knowledge of common architectures and processes in data processing Benefits Your benefits Short decision-making paths and large decision-making leeway Hybrid work from anywhere you have Internet. The main thing is that the view is right! Flexible working hours that fit your workflow, as long as you manage to attend our meetings from time to time Responsibility from day one Creative freedom for your ideas, impulses and tools that you like to use Great scope in choosing your smartphone & notebook Your job ticket in the VRS (+ VRR) job wheel

Title: Werkstudent Data Science (m/w/d)
Description: Your new team: As a working student (m/f/d) in the field of data science, you are not only a member of our data & analytics team, but also part of an interdisciplinary agile team in the development of each new data product. If you have always been fascinated by numbers and their potential for entrepreneurial decisions, then you've come to the right place. We are driven to make auxmoney a little better every day through our analytics and automated solutions. Be there to accompany data-driven solutions from conception to implementation and experience progress up close.  What you can expect: Support in data science projects (further) development of machine learning models, e.g. to predict customer behavior, optimize processes and marketing expenses Creation of statistical analyses and evaluations Visualization of data and support in interpretation You will learn best practices from us and gain practical hands-on experience in data science & machine learning projects What you bring with you:   You are currently completing at least your 4th semester in the field of natural sciences, mathematics, computer science, data science or something comparable First experience in the conception and/or implementation of data science / machine learning projects, e.g. through corresponding internships, university projects and/or private projects Good knowledge of Python and the relevant libraries (pandas, scikit-learn, etc.) and ideally SQL Working with data is fun for you and you have  an analytical and structured way of working Good knowledge of written and spoken English German language skills at min. B1 level What we bring with us: Flexible working hours Possibility to work from home Flat hierarchies Diverse design and development opportunities Numerous cross-divisional events Free sports activities such as yoga and mobility & movement Daily fresh fruit, endless coffee, tea and water Discounts on Corporate Benefits Please enter in your  Apply, by when you expect to be enrolled, your earliest possible start date and, if available, the link to your GitHub profile.  We look forward to receiving your application! About us You are passionate about working agile and want to make every day different? Then you've come to the right place! We are auxmoney – a leading digital platform for personal loans in Europe and convinced that a better credit supply for more people is possible.  As a company, we combine the startup mentality with the security of a successful grown-up. Together we work in our offices in Düsseldorf, Budapest, Dublin and Málaga.  Thanks to flat hierarchies and diverse design and development opportunities, you will achieve excellent results on your own responsibility and can work on exciting projects. You can simplify processes and products and actively shape auxmoney as a company in the long term.  Whether intern or manager: Everyone makes a valuable contribution to us. In the context of accounting, regulatory and market-related requirements, interdisciplinary teams work in the Financial Accounting Advisory Services division to develop holistically tailor-made solutions for our clients from the financial services sector. You will strengthen us in Frankfurt/Main or alternatively at another location in Germany with accounting, regulatory and/or quantitative expertise to develop and implement innovative ideas for our clients. You will take on a variety of tasks: Consulting and auditing of national and international companies in the financial sector within a group of quantitatively trained, innovative experts Development of creative solutions to exploit untapped data potential (e.g. use of machine learning) Establishment of global, cloud-based services for quantitative topics (e.g. pricing and analysis of large portfolios of financial instruments) Modeling and automation  complex business contexts Accompanying  accounting and risk management on the way to the financial world of the future What you bring with you – skills with which you shape the future Completed studies with a quantitative focus (e.g. mathematics, statistics, physics, computer science) and experience in the field of data analysis (e.g. machine learning, natural language processing) Safe handling of a programming language (e.g. C++,   Java, PHP, Python, Ruby) and/or a database system (e.g.SQL, SAS, MongoDB) Ideally initial practical experience (internship or working student activity) Team player:in with commitment and a high sense of responsibility as well as interest in complex business contexts Very good communication skills in German and English What we offer you – an inspiring working environment At EY,  we do everything we can to make the world work better. Learn more about your benefits at EY.  Do you want to make a difference? Then become part of our team.  Apply now via our job portal: www.de.ey.com/karriere. Title: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Expert (m/w/d)
Description: BD4 is a market-leading provider of artificial intelligence (AI) driven personalization and real-time optimized online experiences.  Our mission is to deliver the most relevant and compelling shopping experience to each and every user in real time. The uniqueness of our award-winning solution is to "listen" and understand each individual end-user to present them with the most appropriate products, content and services at exactly the right time.  In doing so, BD4's AI technology ensures that all data collected improves the user experience in real time. In parallel, our clients can combine their market and product knowledge with AI to implement commercial strategies and present products that support their business strategy.  Our typical clients are medium to large travel, aviation and retail companies in numerous international markets. Our clients base includes companies like Expedia, EasyJet Holidays, Emirates, Europcar, DER Touristik, Hilton and Ab-in-den-Urlaub.  BD4 is headquartered in Frankfurt am Main and serves customers in numerous international markets. We are majority-owned by dnata and are thus a company of the Emirates Group.  Due to our constantly growing customer base in different segments of the travel industry and the retail sector, we are strengthening our team with more great colleagues.  Tasks  You are a member of our data science team who develop and continuously improve our predictive models. These models are at the core of our products and give our customer – online travel portals – a detailed picture of their users' interests, intent and current experience on the site. Data mining and data analyses to generate new insights and open new business opportunities. Develop and improve our existing predictive, explanatory models and machine learning algorithms Create automated learning systems that gracefully scale to increasing complexity and expectation Help improve the scope of our data sets by identifying new data collection and procurement opportunities on an ongoing basis Conduct and collaborate on A/B tests and their evaluations to help us understand better how our products are performing Monitor the industry for promising new approaches and  technologies and evaluate its potential by developing research prototypes Be part of an interdisciplinary Scrum team with engineers and work closely together with the product team as well to get enhancements or new models into production.  Requirements  The ideal candidate has several years hands-on and demonstrable experience in the field of data science, machine learning and data analysis. Furthermore, the following skills and experiences are required: Deep understanding of techniques and tools in data analysis, machine learning, and recommendation systems You have strong experience in machine learning frameworks, Python and other programming languages (eg. R, Spark, TensorFlow) Experience in designing analytics pipelines in Azure ML or other Cloud environments You have good business sense and are capable of thinking holistically about how insights and deliverables feed into the wider business strategy. You have the ability to quickly understand technical information, derive insights, build solutions and work independently and responsibly with attention to detail. You are an effective communicator with an ability to find stories in the insights and data and explain them to diverse audiences. A creative, curious and analytical mind able to layout facts and figures to tell a clear story You are comfortable working with data and have practical experience with quantitative data analysis & visualization, BI tools (e.g. PowerBI), SQL queries and data pipelines. Good programming knowledge (ideally in python and pyspark) and a solid understanding of machine learning techniques is preferred. Experience working with big data tools is a plus You are a team player and you like working in an agile environment Proficiency in written and spoken English is required  Benefits  What we offer  Our office is located on the fourth floor above the rooftops of Frankfurt - in the multicultural district of Rödelheim. With over 600 sqm of open space office plus 300 sqm of outdoor space, everyone will find a suitable place to work. On the spacious terraces with skyline view, you can not only work in the fresh air, but also have lunch with colleagues, barbecue or enjoy your after-work beer (or coke!). Of course, there are also options for "mobile working".  What else do we have to offer? A young company with a multicultural start-up culture and flat hierarchies. Our office is conveniently located with a direct S-Bahn connection and infrastructure (and a secure bike cellar!) Exciting challenges within the framework of an innovative and international company Free drinks, fruit, snacks and regular company events, yoga classes etc. as well as after-work activities An attractive compensation and benefits package  If this sounds like you and you’re excited to find a successful international start-up with grown-up ideas about how to do business, please send us your application right away. If you have any questions, we are happy to assist you.  We are looking forward to your application!

Title: (Junior) Data Scientist (w/m/d) - Big Data & IoT
Description: We are looking for a customer with locations throughout Germany hybrid or remote: (Junior) Data Scientist (f/m/d) Technologies in use Languages: Python, R Frameworks: Django, PySpark, Tensorflow, Jupyter, Latex, Apache Spark Libraries: PyTorch, Pandas, Numpy, Keras Cloud: AWS Sagemaker, Amazon Kendra, Lex, Comprehend, Rekognition Requirements Experience in developing with Python and developing algorithms Experience with neural networks,  Deep learning, regression models at best experience with NLP, image analysis, recommender systems and others at best experience with cloud providers, especially AWS Business fluency in German What it's all about The company is a medium-sized IT service company that has expanded throughout Germany over the last 25 years and currently covers all major IT areas, from cloud transformation and software development to big data and IoT,  for both the private sector and the public sector.  As a data scientist, you will develop algorithms and software based on Python for use in the analysis of image, video and text files, predictive maintenance, chat and voicebots, as well as various other applications in the field of machine learning. This is both cloud-independent with open source tools or in the cloud. All three major cloud platforms are in use, currently mainly AWS and Cloudera. In addition, the company is building a virtualized GPU cluster for AI development.  In terms of projects, in the medical field, for example, the company has built a consolidated data lake for a research institute, on the basis of which the data science team has developed algorithms for anomaly detection in medical treatment. In another project, the team wrote a predictive maintenance algorithm for a German automobile manufacturer in production, which can be used to detect and rectify possible failures along the production line at an early stage.  The company relies heavily on individual diversity and the further development of all employees. Thus, the company provides unlimited working time and funds for participation in courses, further education and the corresponding certification in new technologies. In addition, the company focuses on the internal exchange of knowledge through technology-specific communities, where new tools and possible areas of application in the projects are openly discussed.  The salary consists of a fixed and a variable salary component, whereby the variable component is linked to the use in projects. The full distribution already takes place on 120 project days a year. In some cases, it may be that they are also used by the customer as part of the requirements recording and along a project. Of course, this is also associated with a corresponding remuneration.  In addition, there is an annual trip to Phantasialand with the entire department.  Imprint - https://www.frankgroup.com/de/impressum/

Title: Data Analyst / Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description: We are looking for a full-time Data Analyst / Data Scientist (m/f/d) at the Glashütte location near Dresden at the earliest possible starting date.  Your mission Our analytics team is all about the customer: we combine the information from the specialist departments – from finance to production, sales and communication – and combine it with the insights about our customers to form an overall picture. They complement our operational and strategic decision-making with their cross-divisional analyses. They are in constant contact with our business stakeholders and thus turn numbers, data and facts into real answers – or the right questions.  Your tasks You take up the requirements and questions of our internal customers and translate them into the world of data You design, create and maintain data models, reports and dashboards (ad-hoc and regularly-recurring) You monitor data flows and ensure high data quality, if necessary you independently initiate optimization measures. Salary and participation in the bonus program High degree of personal responsibility and opportunity to implement your own ideas International cooperation within the Richemont Group A modern working environment An intensive induction Flexible working hours and the possibility of working from home Subsidy for the job ticket  Employer-sponsored pension model and capital-forming benefits Two paid vacation days for Christmas and New Year's Eve Annual employee appraisals and individual personnel development Health-preserving measures and company medical care Subsidy for childcare costs for children who are not of school age Free use of digital training opportunities in LinkedIn Learning Free use of the Group's internal digital voice software Speexx Extensive  Corporate Benefits Offers A challenging task awaits you in a modern company of the Richemont Group. Become part of our success story and leave your footprints. Enrich a team that works with passion and strong community spirit the work of Ferdinand A. Long into the future - true to our motto "Never stand still".  We look forward to receiving your application documents, including your earliest possible start date.  Please click on "Apply now". Title: Data Scientist (d/m/w) Industrial Processes
Description: Tasks Preparation and analysis of data from industrial processes with machine learning algorithms to uncover correlations and develop predictive models. Development and training of AI models to map the interdependencies of large-scale industrial plants (digital twin). Support in the development of web apps for real-time visualization of plant KPIs and model predictions. Development of professional software products for our customers. Cooperation with our customers in the thyssenkrupp Group for end customers worldwide. Profile University degree in the field of data science, physics, mathematics, engineering, or comparable qualification also with a doctorate. Professional experience in the described area is an advantage. A strong understanding of technical systems and physical or chemical impact chains paired with experience in data analytics and AI projects. Sound knowledge of Phyton and state-of-the-art open source ML libraries and frameworks (e.g. pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Keras) for data analysis. Knowledge of database systems (e.g.SQL, influxdb, NoSQL, MapReduce), cloud platforms (e.g. MS Azure, AWS), version management (git) and DevOps methods (CI/CD)Knowledge of HTML, Javascript and React. Ideally, experience in programming APIs (flask, Azure Functions). Enjoy interdisciplinary and international teamwork as well as fluent German and English skills, both spoken and written. What we offer With around 30 employees, we offer a working atmosphere that resembles a start-up or SME. At the same time, thyssenkrupp Transrapid and TechCenter Control Technology are part of the large, international group of companies thyssenkrupp AG with over 100,000 employees worldwide. Thanks to this rare combination, a job with us combines the best of both worlds: attractive and performance-related remuneration combined with the excellent company pension scheme of the thyssenkrupp Group. Group-wide training opportunities and health campaigns. Flexible working hours with the possibility of home office. Design opportunities and leeway in a growing area. Flat hierarchies and collegial cooperation. Contact Transrapid GmbH TechCenter Control Technology Kirsten Harling Phone: 089 2304 7667 Company The TechCenter Control Technology of thyssenkrupp Transrapid GmbH is an agile interdisciplinary business unit within the global thyssenkrupp Group. In Munich, we develop digital products and data-based cloud solutions for intelligent process and plant monitoring, process optimization and control for our customers within and outside the thyssenkrupp Group. We use the latest methods and processes of big data analysis and machine learning.  We are now looking for employees for this young and expanding business area at our location in Munich. Do you want to develop and design digitization for industrial processes with us? Then apply now.

Title: Junior Data Scientist mit Schwerpunkt Softwareentwicklung - Customer Facing
Description: Our mission at getML is to develop a machine learning framework for relational learning that enables data scientists and data engineers to reduce the manual workload involved in developing predictive analytics models by up to 90%.  The unique selling point of getML is our unique algorithms for feature learning on relational data and time series. Just a few lines of Python code are enough to learn from billions of features. Here, getML beats popular frameworks from Alteryx, Facebook and BlueYonder in terms of speed and accuracy of the models learned.  You can find out more about relational learning, numerous sample notebooks and a live demo at https://getml.com.  As part of our data science team, your central task is to further develop the getML framework and to support our customers in the use of getML.  Tasks The range of tasks as a data scientist at getML is very diverse. We trust that you can support us with a high degree of personal responsibility right from the start in some areas. We trust you and offer a lot of creative freedom.  Specifically, your tasks will include: Support of our customers by designing customer-specific ML applications Assumption of project-related data engineering & data science tasks Technical Support of getML Data Science Training related to relational learning Contribute to the development of the getML framework Support in the further development of the getML python API Application of getML on sample datasets (https://notebooks.getml.com) Participation in  selected Data Science Challenges Constant updating of documentation & tutorials (https://docs.getml.com) Qualification You have experience in the development of machine learning models You have a strong understanding of common machine learning methods and an overview of available ML frameworks You master the Python programming language and want to familiarize yourself with Golang You are able to communicate confidently in German (B2) and English  Experience with visualization frameworks such as DataStudio, Tableau, superset, Dash is advantageous Ideally, you have knowledge of cloud infrastructures such as Google Cloud, AWS, Azure Benefits Startup atmosphere with flat hierarchies, as well as a dynamic and agile team Flexible working hours and hybrid office with the option of remote within Europe Option for an office in a lively and inspiring working environment of the old cotton mill in Leipzig The  Opportunity to work with us to revolutionize machine learning on relational data Exciting and challenging projects in our international clientele Actively shape the future of getML as part of our growing team As a developer, you also get state-of-the-art hardware for your home office. These include: MacBook Pro, electrically height-adjustable desk, 38-inch curved screen We look forward to receiving your application.

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description: Job Number: 47824  Group: Magna Corporate  Division: Magna International Graz  Job Type: Permanent/Regular  Location: GRAZ, SANKT VALENTIN  Group Description  At Magna, we create technology that disrupts the industry and solves big problems for consumers, our customers, and the world around us. We’re the only mobility technology company and supplier with complete expertise across the entire vehicle.  We are committed to quality and continuous improvement because our products impact millions of people every day. But we’re more than what we make. We are a group of entrepreneurial-minded people whose collective expertise gives us a competitive advantage. World Class Manufacturing is a journey and it’s our talented people who lead us on this journey.  Role Summary  The Data Scientist will be a key member of the R&D team and will solve data-related challenges in manufacturing operations. Maintain liaison with individuals and groups within and outside Magna, while maintaining responsibility for acting independently on technical matters pertaining to the designated subject area.  Key Responsibilities  Derive and show optimization potentials for given applications based on data analysis with state of the art and cutting age mathematical methods (AI) Deploy machine learning methods to simplify / substitute repeating tasks Develop proof of concepts (POC) based on AI methods for closed loop control in production (e.g. Vision based decision making, reinforcement learning approaches for controls) Interpret results and communicate to technical and non-technical audiences,  cross-functional teams, and executive leadership. Support, plan, and execute ML and AI initiatives, manage, and facilitate initial small-scale implementation, and support broad deployment and adoption within the organization. Develop, maintain and document the source code for all developments Leverage internal and external expertise as required. Regularly interface with senior management to provide project updates. Travel up to 25% domestic and international may be required.  Indirect Supervisory Responsibilities  Plan, organizing, and supervise the work of external staff(s) of engineers, scientists and technicians pertaining to projects s/he is responsible for. Evaluate progress of the external staff and results obtained. Recommend changes to achieve overall objectives. Advise on the management of staffing needs, selection/ assessment criteria, and hiring process.  Knowledge and Education  Master’s Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics or a closely related education with 2+ years of experience in industry. PhD preferred. Deep knowledge of Python and data analysis relevant libraries SW development knowledge with detailed understanding of SW deployment processes is a plus Knowledge of network technologies and protocols (e.g. mqtt)  Work Experience  Deep experience with a wide variety of ML and AI techniques and algorithms. Excellent mathematical knowledge in the field of statistic and robustness Advance knowledge of Python, SQL and other related tools and toolchains to be able to oversee, direct and manage projects in the field. Experience with virtualization and deployment tools (e.g. docker)  Skills and Competencies  Very good knowledge of English language is required, knowledge of German language is advantageous Open mindset and eager to learn Challenge the status-quo mentality Team player and analytically thinking personality with high communication skills Willingness to ask questions and build networks/relationships with other departments/groups.  Additional Information  For dedicated and motivated employees, we offer an interesting and diversified job within a dynamic global team together with the individual and functional development in a professional environment of a global acting business. Fair treatment and a sense of responsibility towards employees are the principle of the Magna culture. We strive to offer an inspiring and motivating work environment. We offer attractive benefits (e.g. employee profit participation program) and a salary which is in line with market conditions depending on your skills and experience.  We wish to fill this position as soon as possible and offer a min. gross salary of EUR 47.000,- p. a. for this position depending on qualification and experience. If you are interested in this position, please apply with information regarding your availability and salary expectations.  Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.  At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

Title: Junior Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description: Ta oferta została pozyskana z tablicy ofert pracy. Więcej informacji More than 11,200 stores and 200 logistics centers in 32 countries – that's Lidl. In order to continue to achieve our ambitious goals efficiently, we are looking for you to strengthen our analytics division. Here we accompany Lidl on its way to becoming a data-driven company and pilot innovative business applications in the "fail-fast approach" in close cooperation with the specialist departments (sales, purchasing, etc.). To this end, we advise them on issues and help shape global business processes. In addition, we support the countries in building up decentralized analytics competencies and exploiting international synergies through close cooperation. Make a big difference and experience that your entry is worthwhile – at Lidl's international headquarters in Neckarsulm.  Your tasks Identification of questions with the department where data science provides real financial added value for Lidl Cleansing and linking of relevant data sources as a basis for further analysis Use state-of-the-art algorithms to optimize different business processes and bring about proof-of-concept Carry out pilots together with the department to prove the functionality and added value of your models in practice  prepare for the transition to industrialization with colleagues from IT Work on projects in interdisciplinary, agile teams and regularly present new results to stakeholders and management Your profile University degree in mathematics / statistics, computer science, physics, economics, business administration or a related field Very good knowledge in the application of machine learning, optimization and data mining methods (e.g. with Python,  Spark or R) Knowledge of databases (SQL, Hadoop, Hive) Ability to understand complex questions and scenarios, to analyze them in detail and to present the findings to a non-technical audience in an understandable way Very good knowledge of German and ideally English skills Your advantages We attach great importance to the fact that your entry into us is worthwhile! That's why you not only benefit from above-average remuneration and all the social benefits of a large company. We recognize the diverse needs of our colleagues and develop solutions to reconcile work and private life. A personal mentor familiarizes you with your job from day one and is your contact person for all questions about the company. So you will quickly find your way around us – and so you can discover the collegial cooperation and the individual training opportunities for yourself right from the start.  Mobile working up to 5 days a week Using flexible working/part-time models, you can arrange your working hours with up to 5 days per week in coordination with your supervisor, regardless of location, i.e. on site or in mobile working, as it best suits your personal situation.  A great team Health at work We keep an eye on the health aspects of your workplace and have our own health management. The workstations at Lidl are therefore equipped in such a way that you can work there safely.  Modern equipment The IT equipment of your workplace is tailored to your job. Depending on your position, you will also receive a business mobile phone or iPad, including regular exchanges for current models.  Canteen Hunger is not good for your career, we know that. We provide a remedy at administrative locations with a canteen or discounted lunch offers.  Training according to plan We want you to arrive well with us. Therefore, we give you enough time to learn your professional tasks. Your induction plan gives you the necessary security for a good start and regulates all steps.  Sabbatical After five years of service, you have the opportunity to take a three-month sabbatical. No matter what you plan to do during this time - we give you the freedom.  Salary and benefits As a collective bargaining employee, you currently pay at least 14 euros at Lidl (varies from 14 – 18.26 €/hour depending on the tariff area, depends on education and experience. Does not apply to internships, apprenticeships, Abi program and dual studies). In addition, there is an annual one-off payment and capital-forming benefits after 12 months.  Workplace with responsibility Whether you are an industry expert or a career changer, at Lidl you can develop your full potential. You quickly take on responsibility and can shape your career. We support you in mastering challenges.  Further education and training You can deepen your professional knowledge in seminars and training courses. This not only qualifies you for higher positions, but also develops yourself personally.  Appreciation We have a lot of confidence in our employees and respect how they get involved on a daily basis. With team spirit and fairness, we move things forward together.

Title: Data Scientist* in der Produktion mit Promotionsabsicht
Description: The Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft (www.fraunhofer.de) currently operates 76 institutes and research facilities in Germany and is the world's leading organization for application-oriented research. Around 30,000 employees develop the annual research volume of 2.9 billion euros.  In the production quality department of the Fraunhofer IPT, we accompany companies on their way to climate- and resource-efficient production. In our research and industrial projects, we therefore place a special focus on the end-to-end digitization and networking of production as well as the targeted evaluation of production data.  As a data scientist*, you and your colleagues ensure that the production environment of our clients is sustainably improved through cross-domain, data-based solutions.  What you do with us Linking heterogeneous data sources as well as integration and preparation of production data for analysis purposes Creation of machine learning and artificial intelligence models to optimize production processes, e.g. to increase product quality or to detect process anomalies Implementation of the model results in the production environments of our customers with the aim of providing information and decision support Technical  Implementation of the digital twin based on process and product data, simulations and models Acquisition, coordination and processing of national and international industrial and research projects in a team Conception and implementation of workshops and seminars for specialists and executives from industry and research What you bring with you Successfully completed scientific university studies (Master, Diploma) in the field of computer science, data science, computational  Engineering Science (CES), mechanical engineering or a comparable engineering discipline Knowledge of common programming languages (e.g. Python) Experience in dealing with relevant libraries, e.g. Scikit-Learn, Keras, Pytorch, TensorFlow Enthusiasm for applied research and interest in helping shape digital transformation in production Enjoy interdisciplinary team and project work An independent way of working and analytical skills  Very good German and written and spoken English What you can expect A collegial team and freedom to implement your own ideas Participation in highly innovative research and development projects with well-known industrial partners from a wide range of industries State-of-the-art machinery, equipped with edge cloud systems and a 5G infrastructure Excellent professional and personal development through a variety of internal training programs Opportunity to  Doctorate at RWTH Aachen University in a self-developed topic Diversity is an important strategic goal at our institute: We are actively committed to equal opportunities and diversity, starting with diversity training for all employees Flexible working hours based on trust, home office and various support services for reconciling private life, family and career Excellent prospects for attractive career opportunities in industry and research  Our declared goal is to sustainably increase the proportion of women in science. Young professionals and scientists can participate in the "Fraunhofer TALENTA" career program and take advantage of qualification offers as well as the necessary freedom for their own professional development and further qualification.  We value and promote the diversity of our employees' skills and therefore welcome all applications – regardless of age, gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion, ideology, disability as well as sexual orientation and identity.  The position is initially limited to 2 years. There is the possibility of extension. The weekly working time is 39 hours. The position can also be filled part-time. Employment, remuneration and social benefits are based on the collective agreement for the public service (TVöD). In addition, Fraunhofer can grant performance- and performance-related variable remuneration components.  If you have any questions about this position, please contact: Dennis Grunert M.Sc. Head of Production Quality Department Fraunhofer Institute for Production Technology IPT Steinbachstraße 17, 52074 Aachen Phone: +49 241 8904-376

Dynamic team with a flat hierarchy that attaches great importance to quality, customer-oriented thinking, creativity & open communication. Do you already see yourself eating the party pizza with us and then working it out on the treadmill? Then apply now!

Title: Principal Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description: At Bayer, we are visionaries and determined to overcome our planet's greatest challenges and contribute to a world where enough food and adequate medical care for all people are no longer unattainable goals. We do this with energy, curiosity and pure dedication, always learning from the people around us, expanding our mindset, improving our abilities and redefining the "impossible". There are many reasons to join us: if you are looking for a varied and meaningful professional future where you can really make a difference together with other brilliant minds, we want you on our team.  Principal Data Scientist (m/f/d) For our global team we are looking for a Principal Data Scientist (m/f/d) to strengthen the organization Digital Transformation & IT – Pharma.  The Decision Science department at Bayer Pharmaceuticals works on AI projects across all functions, from medical affairs and pharmacovigilance to research and development. We solve complex analytical problems and develop solutions with the aim of improving decision-making in the company and making it more efficient. The team is focused and specialized in the application of natural language processing and patient data (real world data), but also includes other data science areas. If you are interested in becoming part of a dynamic team and industrializing cutting-edge ML algorithms together, we would love to hear from you.  YOUR TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES You will lead Natural Language Processing (NLP) initiatives and act as a technical point of contact for the team and organization You will lead the ideation and development of innovative AI and data science applications as part of digital products that solve business problems in the areas of medical affairs, pharmacovigilance and research & development. You will maintain good relationships with stakeholders in the company, understand their requirements and pain points, and help design and implement strategies as part of the digital agenda You will develop and implement complex NLP algorithms to generate insights from large amounts of unlabeled text data (clinical notes, regulatory documents, medical literature). You will take responsibility for end-to-end products from notebooks to production-ready code Research and development of survival models using data from clinical trials, electronic health records and other real-world data sources to understand health risks and drive innovative communication and clinical decision support products in clinical practice In your daily work, you will use agile methods to promote  Collaboration between data scientists, machine learning engineers, a large IT organization and business domain experts in multidisciplinary product teams You act as a mentor and help colleagues from the data science team with their technical development. In addition, you convince and inspire other teams with your AI expertise and stay up to date on state-of-the-art AI applications in the life science industry and research You publish innovative methods and scientific discoveries in peer-reviewed journals You explore opportunities for collaboration with universities, start-ups and established external providers WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE PhD or BSc/MSc with many years of experience in machine learning,  Statistics, applied mathematics, computer science or related fields with strong knowledge in machine learning Several years of professional experience (preferably pharmaceuticals) or excellent academic achievements demonstrating the implementation of groundbreaking projects in ML Expert level knowledge in machine learning, with a strong focus on NLP, especially in dealing with large language models and their fine-tuning, and/or health risk models Very good programming skills  in Python, extensive experience in developing, deploying and maintaining ETL and ML pipelines using cloud services (AWS, Azure, etc.) It is easy for you to explain complicated concepts in simple words and can adapt the degree of complexity to the target group. You are an expert at presenting solutions to business You are passionate about using statistical and mathematical tools to make the world a better and more efficient place. You want to be part of a motivated team of data scientists working on topics ranging from automated generation of insights from regulatory documents to risk models for oncology patients You are a team player and enjoy working together and learning from each other in a diverse team in a respectful and supportive way Fluent in English,  spoken and written YOUR APPLICATION This is your chance to join us in tackling the greatest global challenges of our time: maintaining people's health, feeding the world's growing population and slowing down climate change. They have a voice, ideas and perspectives that we want to hear. Because our success starts with you. Be part of it!  Bayer welcomes applications from all persons regardless of ethnic origin, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, trade union membership, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other extraneous criterion under applicable law. We are committed to the principle of treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.  Location of Berlin Division: Enabling Functions Reference code: 783461

The company was founded in 2020 with the aim of once again offering the IT business, which had previously been subject to full outsourcing, within the company and making all core IT competencies available to Rheinmetall worldwide. It is also a sparring partner of the business in the development of new, innovative business areas and operates the necessary infrastructures and collaboration tools.  As an integrated technology group with more than 25,000 employees worldwide, the listed Rheinmetall AG stands for a strong, internationally successful company that is active in various markets with an innovative range of products and services. As a well-known development partner and direct supplier to the global automotive industry and as a leading international systems house for safety technology, Rheinmetall uses its high level of expertise in its basic technologies to address long-term megatrends, identify future-oriented new markets with high growth potential and develop innovative solutions for a secure and livable future. Deine Aufgaben  Because Of This Wide Focus, When Joining Our Team You Will Have The Opportunity To Contribute To Production-ready Solutions In Any Of The Following Areas  Our products support HR departments in a wide range of tasks, from recruiting and assessing candidates to assisting in the development of employees. NLP: Utilize and improve NLP solutions for concept extraction, applying them to structured or semi-structured texts in order to exploit relevant information, such as skills.
