Title: Data Scientist IPL - EMEA
Description: Description  Data Scientist IPL  Position Overview  ISG is looking for your leadership to support ISG Research and marketing teams with insights gained from analyzing company data. Can you analyze different products and data jellies to suggest improvements or even to create new products and services respectively to increase the go-to-market speed as well as to reduce costs? If you are a strategic thinker and good in reducing complexity across different and heterogenous data assets, you are the right candidate.  When you join ISG as Data Scientist for IPL (ISG Provider Lens), you will become part of the ISG team helping our clients to transform and optimize their business processes. The ISG Provider Lens™ (IPL) Quadrant research series is the only service provider evaluation of its kind to combine empirical, data-driven research and market analysis with the real-world experience, observations of ISG's global advisory team as well as first-hand enterprise customer experience (CX).  You will have the opportunity to work with a diverse group of colleagues and clients; many recognized industry experts, with experience in the largest 1,000 companies and leading Global Service Providers. Depending upon your project assignment, you will be responsible for data gathering, data input, manipulation and analysis, financial modeling/estimation as well as comparing and analyzing complex information. Additionally, you get the chance to join the IPL Management team as thought leader.  Data scientists utilize their analytical, statistical, and programming skills to collect, analyze, and interpret large data sets. They then use this information to develop data-driven solutions to difficult business challenges. Data scientists have a wide range of technical competencies including: statistics and machine learning, coding languages, databases, machine learning, and reporting technologies such as Q for Qualtrics. Ideally, they have gained experience in how to develop and maintain software.  Role & Responsibilities Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions. Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies. Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques. Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets. Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes. Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality. Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes. Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy as well as consistency in the IPL program.  Required Skillsets Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product/service development. Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets. Experience working with and creating data architectures. Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks. Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications. Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams. A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques. We’re looking for someone with 5-7 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models, has a Master’s or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field, and is familiar with the following software/tools: Coding knowledge and experience with several languages: C, C++, Java, JavaScript, etc. Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc. Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python, SLQ, etc. Experience using web services: Redshift, S3, Spark, DigitalOcean, etc. Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc. Experience analyzing data from 3rd party providers: Google Analytics, Site Catalyst, Coremetrics, Adwords, Crimson Hexagon, Facebook Insights, etc. Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Gurobi, MySQL, etc. Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: Periscope, Business Objects, D3, ggplot, etc At ISG, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our clients, and our communities. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. ISG is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. The more diverse and inclusive we are, the better our work will be.  ISG (Information Services Group) (Nasdaq: III) is a leading global technology research and advisory firm. A trusted business partner to more than 700 clients, including more than 75 of the world’s top 100 enterprises, ISG is committed to helping corporations, public sector organizations, and service and technology providers achieve operational excellence and faster growth. The firm specializes in digital transformation services, including automation, cloud and data analytics; sourcing advisory; managed governance and risk services; network carrier services; strategy and operations design; change management; market intelligence and technology research and analysis. Founded in 2006, and based in Stamford, Conn., ISG employs more than 1,300 digital-ready professionals operating in more than 20 countries—a global team known for its innovative thinking, market influence, deep industry and technology expertise, and world-class research and analytical capabilities based on the industry’s most comprehensive marketplace data.

Title: Data Scientist /Data Engineer (w/m/d)
Description: Lünecom Kommunikationslösungen GmbH is a telecommunications service provider, network operator and Internet service provider based in the Hanseatic City of Lüneburg. The company's focus is on the regional and nationwide expansion of a digital infrastructure, especially in rural areas. Lünecom has been relying on future-proof fibre-optic technology since 1998.The range of products and services includes network expansion, Internet connections, IP telephony, telephone systems, IPTV, cloud services and an online shop.  Your tasks Engineering:You model and structure existing database management systems and significantly develop data warehousing. Consulting: You are significantly involved in decision-making processes in the field of in-house database and data analysis systems. Cooperative work: You act as an interface between software development and database use for the "Controlling and Accounting" team. Data Wrangling: You collect data from different sources and merge them in a structured way. ETL process:You structure data by extracting these sources, transforming them into appropriate formats, and loading them into a database. Objective:Based on the search for opportunities for improvement, you define goals and questions for data analysis within the "Controlling and Accounting" team. Data analysis: You examine the relationships between the data by identifying certain structures and patterns. Modeling of data:You develop and implement new analysis methods (e.g. machine learning models). Creation of forecasts & recommendations for action:With suitable analytical methods (advanced analytics, predictive analytics) you make predictions and derive trends that help Lünecom make decisions. Documentation & Reporting: You summarize your results and present them with graphics and models. Scientific work: For data analysis and to create and test forecasts, you use statistical and mathematical methods and use different programming languages.  Your profile You have studied computer science, business informatics or mathematics or have relevant experience in this field. You have the functionality and structure of databases as well as the query language SQL on the box. You understand architectural principles inside out and are therefore able to build a scalable analysis platform for all relevant data. You enjoy statistics, mathematics and artificial intelligence. You already have in-depth knowledge in the field of Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing or Data Mining. Initial industry experience in the fields of planning, construction or telecommunications is an advantage. Languages: good German and English skills High analytical thinking skills Independent and solution-oriented way of working, high degree of commitment Enjoy working in a small but growing team and in a company that pursues big growth goals Hands-on mentality, sense of responsibility and implementation strength Why us? We offer: a secure and future-oriented workplace Flex Office opportunities open-minded and cooperative interaction within the company Training and further education opportunities Retirement provision Advantages such as bike leasing, membership in the partner gym

Title: Traineeship in Data Science and Analytics in HR
Description: General Information  Type of contract Traineeship  Who can apply? EU nationals eligible for our traineeship programme  Grant The trainee grant is €1,070 per month plus an accommodation allowance (see further information section)  Working time Full time  Place of work Frankfurt am Main, Germany  Closing date 01.02.2023  Your team  You will be part of the Human Resources (HR) Analytics team in the Employee Services Division of the Directorate General Human Resources. Our Directorate General has over 100 members of staff who provide operational, talent management and advisory services to approximately 4,000 ECB employees.  The task of the HR Analytics team is to enable the Directorate General to use a data-driven and evidence-based approach to best serve the needs of employees and the organisation. In particular, the team provides data science services to stakeholders in the Directorate General and in other business areas, supporting their activities, generating insights to shape HR strategy, and using data analytics to optimise the impact of HR policies on working conditions, well-being and performance.  The team comprises 10-12 highly skilled data science and analytics professionals who collaborate with colleagues from across our Directorate General.  The ECB is an inclusive employer and we strive to reflect the diversity of the population we serve. We encourage you to apply irrespective of age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, race, religious beliefs, sexual orientation or other characteristics.  Your role  As trainee in HR Analytics you will:  develop statistical analyses and data science solutions and provide recommendations for strategic HR decision-making and HR policy development; contribute to exploring new tools and technologies, testing them and developing prototypes; support the development of a data and evidence-based HR approach by reviewing research literature, generating insights from available reports and tools, and training colleagues to integrate them into their work; contribute to transforming and visualising HR datasets for various projects and tasks.  The position offers you excellent opportunities to learn from experienced data scientists, gain hands-on analytics experience and work with leading technologies in a dynamic and inspiring environment. You will be part of a multicultural team that strives for continuous innovation to make a positive impact on the lives of European citizens.  Qualifications, Experience And Skills  Essential:  a bachelor’s degree or higher in data science, statistics, mathematics, computer science, human resources management, business administration, economics, social and organisational psychology, business information systems, business analytics, or another relevant discipline; as a minimum, advanced skills in R or in another statistical programming language; excellent analytical and conceptual skills, and an interest in complex technical content; a good knowledge of the MS Office package; an advanced (C1) command of English and an intermediate (B1) command of at least one other official language of the EU, according to the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages .  Desired:  experience in HR analytics; experience with SQL, Tableau and/or big data technologies; experience in data cleaning, data transformation and data visualisation.  You are curious and eager to learn, and want to further develop your ability to analyse complex information. You are keen to collaborate with others, pursue team goals and learn from other people’s diverse perspectives. You strive to know and anticipate stakeholder needs, and will signal any need for change and propose alternative solutions.  You are motivated to contribute to the ECB’s mission, to serve the citizens of the EU as a member of a public institution and to work with colleagues from all over Europe. You are keen to be part of our team and to use your skills and competencies to achieve the aims of this position.  Further information  Traineeship of between 6 and 12 months in total.  Other details on the conditions applicable to traineeships at the ECB can be found on our website.  Application and selection process  Further information on how to apply is available on our website.  The recruitment process for this position will include a remote written exercise in the pre-selection phase and, if you are invited to participate in the subsequent selection phase, an online interview.  If you are not selected for this position but are still considered suitable, you will be placed on a reserve list for 12 months from the closing date for applications, from which you might be considered for other traineeship positions within the ECB.

Title: Data Science (w/m/d)
Description: With the bold goal of being independent of fossil fuels by 2030, the energy industry faces a masterful challenge: The highly volatile generation of electricity from renewable sources must be reconciled with a constantly increasing demand for electricity.  Flexibility in the consumption of electronic systems is becoming a key resource for the further expansion of renewable forms of energy. but connecting them all usually means inefficient processes and additional hardware for plant operators. And that's expensive!  We at encentive build a platform that connects to the existing cloud infrastructure of the manufacturers of electronic systems, calculates flexibility potentials of the systems and, based on this, markets a wide variety of services to the energy industry.  At encentive, you have the opportunity to make a difference in a growing startup on your own responsibility and to accelerate the energy transition together with us.  Tasks You are jointly responsible for setting up our data science department Building pipelines for automated deployment in the AWS environment Data processing and formatting of plant data Development of state-of-the-art models for predicting the power consumption and expected temperatures of heat pumps and refrigeration systems that air condition supermarkets, offices or warehouses Continuous optimization/further development of models and algorithms based on new,  customer-specific data Qualification Professional experience in project management Experience in software development with python First experience in the AWS cloud environment (services such as SageMaker) Project experience with common frameworks (e.g. Tensorflow, PyTorch) Benefits Be part of one of the most innovative start-ups in the energy industry and actively work on the energy transition with Flat hierarchies, dynamic working environment - independent work right from the start Highly motivated and very  appreciative team Grow with us (company participation possible) Work in our modern office (meals included) or remotely, with your own equipment - or we provide you with what you need You feel addressed?  Send us your CV and write in 2-3 sentences what your motivation is and how you can help us achieve the energy transition!

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d) for Predictive Maintenance
Description: Schubert-Motion is a young development office in Dresden, near the Technical University. Gerhard Schubert GmbH is the market leader in modular robot-based packaging machines. We are integrated into the company as an independent department and work closely with our colleagues from Crailsheim in the development of new technologies and their implementation. A good example of this is our machine learning-based software for calculating optimal robot movements. This requires, on the one hand, an understanding of the physical relationships as well as the data-driven analysis of the often complex cause-effect relationships. We build on a wide range of preparatory work in the field of data engineering (Schubert Data Center, GS. Gate in every new machine) and develop condition-based analyses for our customers (4YOU Digital Services). In the future, this offer will be expanded to include high-performance fault diagnostics for the field and estimate the remaining service life of critical components (RUL). It is our goal to operate our machines even more reliably - to further optimize them through field data and to detect and classify anomalies more quickly.  We are a small, highly qualified team and want a colleague who can familiarize himself with our ubiquitous machine learning topics and set new accents with his experience. We are looking for your support!  Your tasks with us are Development of software components for condition monitoring and predictive maintenance Estimation of machine states on the basis of model knowledge and implementation in the existing calculation software (cyclically executing part) Classification of machine data to fault conditions and RUL Anomaly detection with machine learning Statistical data analysis, sensitivity analyses Model-based evaluations in the time and frequency domain Measurement data preparation and  Signal processing Improvement of ML-based robot motion planning (bias reduction, data analysis, inference, topology) What you bring with you Successfully completed studies in the field of data science / computer science / engineering / physics / mathematics or similar Confident handling of common Python libraries for statistical data analysis, data mining and machine learning In-depth knowledge of machine learning methods (from supervised to reinforcement learning) and  Model topologies Overview of IIOT platforms and web-based analysis tools Basic experience with modeling dynamical systems as differential equations Interest in robotics for participation in the development team A result-oriented way of working, enthusiasm and a high degree of communication and teamwork skills

Title: Data Scientist Schwerpunkt Computer Vision (m/w/d)
Description: Positive Thinking Company is part of our global ecosystem "Collaboration betters the world". Our 6 founding partners Positive Thinking Company, Steep, Versett, Alispharm, Otofacto & OneAston help our clients grow through strategy, technology and design.  What is important to us? The 3 W's: Knowledge exchange, training and further development. Interested? Then it's getting exciting: Tasks Responsibility for the planning, conception and implementation of data science projects with a focus on computer vision and image recognition Performing complex data analyses Developing predictive models using modern statistical analysis methods and mathematical models Implementing methods in customer systems for optimized control of business models and processes Modeling and data analysis tasks (e.g. forecasting,  Recommendation, Clustering, Classification, Reporting, ...) Further development and optimization of existing technical solutions for image recognition problems This knowledge offers our customers real added value. You are the link between IT and business. You design, realize and drive forward.  Qualification Master's degree, preferably in (business) computer science, (business) mathematics, statistics, physics or a comparable field of study Experience in the field of data science, especially with R and Python Experience with a visualization tool (e.g. QlikView, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, etc.) or in-memory databases as well as experience in computer vision Experience in dealing with deep learning libraries for designing, modeling and evaluating the quality of models  for image recognition problems (e.g. Pytorch, Tensorflow, Keras, OpenCV, etc.) Good basic understanding of methods and procedures of image classification, object detection and semantic segmentation is available Cloud understanding (e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.) as well as GPU knowledge are an advantage Business fluent German and English Willingness to travel within the DACH region Benefits With us, you will join a dynamic, experienced team of other dedicated and passionate data and analytics specialists. We always want to go to our limits in order to develop the best solutions together, as a positive thinking company.  Every day you will work with inspiring colleagues from our diverse domains. You will work with personalities such as division managers, project managers, product owners, developers, business analysts and sales. Our community is diverse: We bring different backgrounds and combine our creative ideas and skills to learn from each other.  Right from the start, you will be immersed in a culture of creativity, fun and collaboration. We learn from mistakes in order to inspire our innovative strength.  Our promise We offer you a culture that is driven by our leadership principles: entrepreneurial, results-oriented, personal responsibility and helping each other to succeed. We create transparency about corporate goals, cooperation and support from an international team at eye level. We live exchange, team spirit and respectful interaction with each other. This connects us across hierarchies – even in the home office. In 2022, we received the kununu award "TOP Company".  What you can expect from us: Onboarding: You are internally networked from day one: Welcome Day, Hello Drink, mentoring program Development: Development is individually tailored to your strengths: Regular feedback meetings, career paths, career committees, online training catalogue, international working with different cultures Work-life balance: Space for your personal life planning (sabbatical, remote working from abroad, highly flexible working models,  Parental leave programs, 30 days vacation, holiday calendar Baden-Württemberg) Sustainability: It is important to us that our work has a positive impact on the environment and humanity. To this end, we make our solutions and our cooperation a little more sustainable every day. Events: Professional and fun (summer tech event, local afterworks, sports events, team events, Christmas parties) Networking: Connect with your colleagues: Communities, lunch breaks, internal know-how sessions Error culture: Make mistakes and test yourself: We give you the freedom to work on the latest technologies Rewards: A variety of bonuses for your additional commitment Further advantages: Corporate benefits, job bike, company health management None: e candidate will meet any of these desired requirements. If your experience looks a little different and you think you can add another value to this job, let's talk about it!   Check out our PTC Spotify playlist and get a first musical impression of our team: https://open.spotify.com/playlist/44kgWZRt5jmmgppH0qGszg?si=L312ch\_9SMKsCKBcN-EB\_A But enough of us, now it's your turn - we look forward to meeting you!

Title: Technikverliebter Data Scientist* - Machine Learning
Description: Your tasks You develop forecasting models based on various (especially unstructured data) with the help of modern methods from the fields of machine learning and deep learning Communication with the departments and IT as well as the technically optimized implementation of complex models is part of your day-to-day business You are responsible for the conception, implementation, performance and deployment of the models and data pipelines on the respective infrastructures of the customer You are  responsible for the integration of models and data pipelines into the customer's technical and functional standard processes You develop production-ready code for complex machine learning solutions with developer tools such as IDEs, Git, Docker, etc. By actively participating in national and international conferences, you build up and expand your own network You support the digital transformation of our existing and new customers and work closely with decision-makers Your qualifications You have completed a degree in computer science/statistics/mathematics/physics or a similar quantitative course of study You have very good knowledge of Python,  PyTorch or Tensorflow esp. with the following methods: regressions, random forrest, boosted trees, SVMs, various neural networks, clustering, collaborative filtering, etc. You have knowledge in the areas of NLP, image and speech recognition or recommendation systems and already have experience with the development and use of unstructured data sources (images, speech, weblog data, etc.) You already have existing know-how in data preparation and the development of data pipelines with SQL, Spark, Scala, pandas, etc. including scheduling You are familiar with different databases such as Oracle, Teradata, Exasol and cluster technologies such as Spark You have a very good technical process understanding and good project management skills (agile in. SCRUM, waterfall) You enjoy it,  advise customers outside your place of residence and have a basic willingness to travel Why you should come to us Individual induction and support from day one by your manager and a mentor Responsibility from the beginning – You start your first project relatively quickly and take on tasks and responsibilities adapted to your own learning curve Extensive internal and external training as well as certifications and  Training in the latest technologies Flat hierarchies and short decision-making paths Close team cohesion, successes are celebrated together: Ski weekend, summer party, Oktoberfest, Christmas party Flexible working time models, subsidy for fitness membership, job bike and company pension scheme A top team behind the scenes, which stands by you even in difficult situations, away from everyday project life. For us, gender, sexual orientation, origin, skin color, faith, age, etc. play no role at all. It is important to us to work with people who enjoy their work, are passionate about their interests and who care about mutual respect and appreciation just like us. If you can identify with our values, we look forward to receiving your application!
